About the job
The Ubuntu Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done in the project, coordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavour of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community.

This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.

In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You can get into the trenches with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you can represent community interests to Canonical teams.

You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of the project. This role is likely a good fit for someone with experience in DevOps, Software Development, Testing or QA, package management, container technology. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux.

You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.

You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.

What you will do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
Engage with the Ubuntu community through AskUbuntu, IRC, social media, conferences, etc
Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences.

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc).
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors
Nice to have / optional:
Experience with community management
Experience with Developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects
We offer
Learning and Development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel
Flexible working option

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

About the job
Department: Technology

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Germany

Description

Team Internet AG is an online marketing company founded in 2010 and acquired by CentralNic in 2019. With the domain parking platform ParkingCrew.com and the Traffic Marketplace TONIC. We are one of the leading companies in our industry worldwide and want to continue and expand this success in the future. Characteristic for us is the focus on technical solutions and the high degree of personal responsibility of our employees.

We are looking for a software developer to support our team on a long-term basis.

Key Responsibilities
Our developers are the owners of their product and therefore the daily work covers the whole range of tasks
Further development of front and backend in Elixir with the Phoenix Framework, as well as individual processes in Node.js and Python
Further and new development of batch processes for processing big data
Development of future-oriented architectures and solutions based on stakeholder requirements
Expansion of our partially automated release process (continuous integration) and quality assurance (unit testing, code reviews)

You work independently in the Scrum Team with product owners, UX designers, Scrum Masters and their stakeholders

Our requirements

About the job
Xometry (NASDAQ: XMTR) powers the industries of today and tomorrow by connecting the people with big ideas to the manufacturers who can bring them to life. Xometry’s digital marketplace gives manufacturers the critical resources they need to grow their business while also making it easy for buyers at Fortune 1000 companies to tap into global manufacturing capacity.

To continue our rapid growth on the UK & Ireland market of custom & serial on-demand manufacturing, we are looking for a passionate and fast-moving Marketing Specialist , who will help the company get the word out about its products and services across our target audiences and via multiple digital channels.

Responsibilities

Overall, you will be responsible for acquiring new leads and improving Xometry’s positions in target market segments using all accessible communication tools and channels. Here’s an example breakdown of what your activities would include:
Set up and improve performance ads in paid channels in collaboration with our paid media manager
Create and manage marketing campaigns (e.g. prepare texts and visuals) in multichannel environment (e.g. social media, emails)
Organise webinars (both in-house and with partners) for our target audiences
Analyse efficiency of existing advertising channels, discover and assess new channels
Find and vet new industry channel partners, influencers, and publications
Review and improve communication with the target audiences across various touchpoints (existing advertising, website, product, emails)

Channels

You will work with multiple communication channels such as:
Social media
Digital media
Email marketing
Event marketing
Partner and affiliate marketing
Sponsorships

Ideal candidate

To be able to successfully deal with the responsibilities, an ideal candidate has:
Digital mindset and growth focus;
At least 2 years of on-hands experience in performance/ lead-gen marketing (also in an assistant role);
Experience in creating promotional content (writing promo texts, creating pictures or videos);
Knowledge of Google Ads, Facebook and LinkedIn Business Suites;
Experience in organising webinars and knowledge of relevant tools (Zoom, ClickMeeting, etc);
NATIVE level of ENGLISH (other languages will be a great benefit);
Has a background in or interest in learning more about engineering, 3D printing, manufacturing.

Working conditions
Interesting work in a dynamic and fast-growing environment
A friendly international team from Europe and overseas
Possibility to work up to 100% remotely from home office
Salary based on the qualifications and experience plus equity incentive plan

If this job isn’t for you but you have a friend who may be a perfect fit - share this job with them!

Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

job_title: Software Engineer, Query Processing, Munich, Germany
description:
About the job
Description

Who we are

Firebolt is a disruptor in the data & analytics space. Based on technology that delivers an order-of-magnitude performance leap in TB-scale analytics, Firebolt helps the most data-forward companies create a new wave of data & analytics experiences for end-users. With a team of world-class data experts, led by leadership veterans from Looker, Google BigQuery, Imply and Sisense, and backed by $264M in funding - we are growing quickly and are poised to build the data platform of the future, and set a new bar for what can be done with data.

About The Job

Firebolt is building a distributed team of talented developers to work on our distributed query processing engine.

Firebolt is composed of several open-source projects and relies on a unique IP that boosts data analytics and enables full scalability and decoupling storage from compute.

As part of our growing team here in Munich, you can have a major impact on Firebolt’s product. We are focused on improving the performance of our vectorized query engine which aggressively uses runtime code generation to speed up execution.

Our projects range from building a modern code generation stack, improving distributed query processing, all the way to collecting detailed statistics for our cost-based query optimizer. If these challenges sound exciting, we would love to hear from you!

Your Responsibilities
Take a key position in our R&D team.
Take part in the definition of our product design and architecture.
Design, build, and maintain our cutting-edge query processing and optimization engine.
Work closely with other Firebolt teams to provide a seamless data experience.

Requirements

You should have
Bachelor’s/Master’s/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or equivalent experience.
3+ years of experience working with C++ on a production software.
Fluency in modern C++ (C++11 and above, our codebase uses C++20).
Experience building multi-threaded, high-performance systems.
Experience with database internals and query processing.
Experience developing for Linux.

Bonus Points
Experience with runtime code generation and compilers.
Experience with distributed query processing.
Experience with distributed systems & cloud computing.

About the job
Pennylane is the first platform that combines business software for accountants and financial management tools for their clients. Pennylane centralizes in real time all the financial flows of companies and facilitates collaboration between managers and their accountants. Launched in 2020, Pennylane has more than 330 employees (more than 25 nationalities) and already supports more than 1000 accounting firms and 40 000 business owners.

👪 Team and environment

We are looking for an Application Security Engineer to join Romain in the technical security team. Reporting directly to Guillaume, our Head of Information Security, you will be responsible for all technical matters involving security issues. Working with the security compliance team, you may be required to provide technical support to the team in the definition and monitoring of long-term projects designed to strengthen the security of our assets in a sustainable manner. You will have a key role in advising, assisting, informing, training and alerting all employees (especially developers). You will also be responsible for the day-to-day management of technical operations in the context of ISO 27001 certification.

The technical security team is involved from the identification/detection of a security issue to its resolution (development and implementation of the security patches). If the needs or the complexity of the patch are too great, the security team can count on the support of the developers and in particular the Security Champions team to sustain the effort.

🎯 Your tasks

You Will Be Required To Work On

All technical security issues/projects while providing technical support on compliance needs

Let’s Break It Down
Security by design within the projects by discussing with the teams to consider the security risks
To be proactive in the security projects to be carried out, to define and to prioritize them
Ensure the security of the main Web application in Ruby on Rails and React: its dependencies, its code, its infrastructure and its configuration
Security and maintaining the security condition of other applications and AWS infrastructure, including its Kubernetes environment (AWS EKS)
Conduct and perform regular security assessments (internally or by an external firm) on the applications (code reviews/pentests/bug bounty in particular) and the infrastructure
Conducting code reviews from a secure development point of view (about 80 releases per day, not all of which have security implications, but it is an important and recurring topic)
Build/Improve secure development training materials and conduct regular training sessions with the developers
Contribute to tenders to explain our security policies and provide the necessary technical details
Learn about Rails and React to detect vulnerabilities during code reviews and implement associated patches
Strengthen the current means of detecting malicious attempts
These missions are not exhaustive and remain evolving.
🥇You’re the right candidate if
You have just graduated or ideally have a first experience in defensive or offensive application security, are a quick learner and like to work on different projects. As a security team member at Pennylane, you’ll work on all security topics (application, cloud infrastructure, security by design, training, ISO 27001, etc.).
Working in an English-speaking environment doesn't scare you, you don't need to be bilingual. You need to be able to share your ideas and thoughts well in spoken and written English and to understand what is being said. If you need help with this, we can provide you with a Busuu subscription to improve your English immediately.
You ideally have the following skills/experience:
Able to perform offensive security assessments on an infrastructure or an application
You know how to exploit and fix a wide range of Web vulnerabilities (not just the OWASP top 10)
You already have experience in a programming language (Ruby, Python, JavaScript), either for quick and dirty scripting to exploit a vulnerability or for larger projects
You have experience in cloud infrastructure security
You are able to popularize technical terms to facilitate the adoption of security measures within projects or to broadcast messages to Pennylaners
You are autonomous, proactive and organized
Working with remote colleagues is not an issue for you
Bonus: if you have already developed in Ruby or React and/or if you have technical application security certifications.

A multi-skilled profile will be preferred.

✨ Our vision
We aim to become the most beloved financial Operating System of European SMEs.
We help business owners get rid of the time consuming hassle of handling accounting and finance, while giving them access to key information that they can use to make better decisions.
Meanwhile, we’re helping accountants. By using Pennylane, rather than doing manual and repetitive tasks, they can spend more time advising and guiding their clients.
🎁 Perks

🏢 You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to

🏡 You’ll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

📈 You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

❤️‍🩹 A very complete mutual insurance (Alan) and a mental well-being application (AlanMind)

⛹️ Through our partner Gymlib, you’ll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

🇬🇧 You’ll have access to Busuu to perfect your English or your French

💻 You’ll get the latest Apple equipment

👋🏻 You’ll be integrated through a dedicated onboarding week of newcomers

🎉 You’ll be part of a vibrant social community: we do lots of sports together (soccer, running, climbing, etc.), we love to hang out and have a drink together (Thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. We regularly meet every 2 to 3 months during tech days and do company seminars. Last time, we went on a trip to the French Alps and to French Provence which were fabulous!)

💬 What does the recruitment process look like ?
You will first have a general chat with a Talent Acquisition Manager (30min)
Then you’ll meet Romain - Application Security Engineer, a first introduction meeting where you’ll also discover the technical challenge (15/20min)
You carry out independently the technical challenge for the next 48h
Then, you’ll discuss about your solutions with Romain and Guillaume - Head of Information Security (45min)
Finally, a last culture fit meeting with one of our co-founders (30min)
We make sure we move fast; you can expect the recruitment process with us to last between 15 and 25 days in total.

About the job
Partner with the best

As part of 24/7 Remote Operations Team you will provide real-time support for the LWD product portfolio and associated software. With the goals to prevent/minimize non-productive time for customers and provide the service delivery.

As a Remote Operations Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Providing real-time monitoring and evaluation of drilling and well parameters in order to complete operations in a safe and efficient manner
Collecting and ensure both surface and down-hole data is stored in the database and perform required deliverables
Participating in managing the job cycle activities to proactively impact service delivery
Mentoring junior engineers on raising the competences by developing specific processes and procedures
Providing technical support for the assigned product portfolio and associated software when required
Conducting all business activities in accordance with Baker Hughes HSE policies and compliance requirements

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:


Have completed Bachelor studies in Petroleum Engineering, Geology or Earth Sciences and have relevant experience
Be able to work in a 24/7 service environment, based on an agreed shift schedule
Have a solid background and knowledge across a broad range of down-hole drilling, evaluation tools and services
Have proven ability to recognize, analyze and solve technical issues, coupled with a process oriented working style.
Have good communication skills both verbal and written in English

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:


This is a shift based working pattern (two weeks on, two weeks off)

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace challenge with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:


Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

About Us:

We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

About the job
At intive we innovate through design and engineering to create people-centric digital products. We are more than 3000 people with a passion for digital, who partner with the world’s leading brands such as Dow Jones, FOX, Warner Bros., Verizon, Macmillan, Facebook, Google, BMW, BlackBerry, Discovery, and more.

Our clients come to us to solve their biggest and the most complex business and technology challenges. We have over 20 years of experience working with companies across many industries, including Media & Entertainment, EdTech, Telecommunications, Retail, Automotive, FinTech, and Transportation.

Unser QA-Team wächst!

Ein großer Teil der modernen Softwareentwicklung ist die Qualitätssicherung mit allen ihren Formen und Facetten. Als QA Engineer in einem agilen Umfeld gestaltest du Ideen zu digitaler Wirklichkeit und arbeitest mit Kunden wie Audi, Deutsche Telekom, NETZSCH, Deichmann, ING, Vorwerk und Zalando an der Zukunft.

Die Rolle des QA Engineer bedeutet für uns mehr als nur "Automatisiertes Testen". Wir glauben an die Fähigkeiten unserer Mitarbeiter:innen über das eigene Skillset hinaus und suchen neugierige, mutige und offene Kolleg:innen. Bei uns bekommst du die Möglichkeit, mit der Zeit zu gehen und deine Potenziale immer wieder neu zu entdecken! Wir fördern aktiv Spezialisierungen innerhalb der QA, z.B. als zertifizierte/r Cloud Solution Architect oder DevOps Engineer. Obendrauf gibt es auch vielfältige Möglichkeiten für deine Karrierewünsche in Bereichen außerhalb der QA, z.B. Consulting, Software-Architektur oder Leadership!

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Du Passt Zu Uns, Wenn Du
Fundierte Kenntnisse aktueller Methoden des Software-Testings vorweisen kannst und mindestens eine ISTQB-Zertifizierung (Foundation Level) erfolgreich absolviert hast
Bereits zwei oder mehr Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich des automatisierten Software Testing gesammelt hast
Erfahrung mit Testautomatisierungs-Frameworks wie Appium, Espresso, XCUITest, Cypress, Playwright, REST Assured oder Flutter-Testing gesammelt hast
Continuous Integration für dich kein Fremdwort ist
Mindestens eine der gängigen Programmiersprachen beherrscht
Das Arbeiten im SCRUM-Modus für dich zum Alltag gehört
Über gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie solide Englischkenntnisse verfügst
Ergebnisorientiert und proaktiv arbeitest und dich deine kommunikationsfreudig Art auszeichnet

Du Bekommst Extrapunkte Für
Eine Advanced ISTQB-Zertifizierung
Kenntnisse in der Software-Entwicklung
Erfahrung in der Testautomation mobiler Applikationen
Erfahrung im Bereich E-Commerce

Als Teil Unseres Teams Wirst Du
Automatisierte und manuelle Testaufgaben planen, durchführen und koordinieren
Detaillierte Testreports erstellen und auswerten
Die Zusammenarbeit der Tester:innen & Test Engineers im Projektteam koordinieren
Regelmäßig mit den Ansprechpartner:innen auf Kundenseite kommunizieren
Risikofaktoren im Projekt identifizieren, kommunizieren und Lösungen vorschlagen
Die Testpläne und Ergebnisse sowohl intern als auch vor dem Kunden präsentieren

Warum intive?

Wir fördern ein Umfeld, in dem innovative Ideen und herausragende Leistungen gedeihen können - sowohl vor Ort als auch remote. Unsere Lernkultur belohnt Neugierde und gibt unseren Teammitgliedern die Möglichkeit, zu lernen, zu wachsen und ihre Karriere selbst in die Hand zu nehmen.
Remote Work, Flexibilität & Balance - Hybrides Arbeiten. Du bist in unseren Büros in München, Regensburg oder Buxheim willkommen, musst aber nicht vor Ort sein. Du wählst deine Ausstattung: MacBook oder Dell sowie ein Firmenhandy deiner Wahl für die berufliche und private Nutzung
Meet.me-Programm - regelmäßiger partnerschaftlicher Austausch zwischen Mitarbeiter:innen und Vorgesetzen, die 2 oder 3 Mal pro Jahr stattfinden. Du kannst deinen Karrierepfad auf der Grundlage deiner Ziele gestalten. Wir bieten Schulungen, Mentoring und Unterstützung, auf dich auf deinem Weg zu begleiten
Training & Mentorship - Learning and Development sind ein wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Unternehmenskultur. Wir arbeiten mit einer Skill Matrix. Du wirst Zugang zu individuellen Schulungen und einem Buddy Programm haben
Tech Chapters - Du wirst Teil einer Gemeinschaft von Kolleg:innen, die deine Interessen teilen. Es gibt Raum für internen Austausch von Wissen und den Zugang zu den neuesten Technologien
Culture & Connection - Wir fördern die Verbindungen innerhalb unserer Teams, über Zuständigkeitsbereiche und Hierarchieebenen hinweg. Wir sorgen dafür, dass jede:r wahrgenommen wird und sich mit unserem Auftrag und unseren Kolleg:innen verbunden fühlt. Wir veranstalten regelmäßige Teamevents (Summer Games, Weihnachtsfeier, Oktoberfest, etc.)
Benefits - Wir bieten zahlreiche Zusatzleistungen. Von der betrieblichen Altersvorsorge über Zuschüsse zum Öffentlichen Verkehr bis hin zum Job Bike.

About the job
Who We Are

AlphaSights is the leading global knowledge platform. Our sophisticated technology platform enables our clients, our people, and our experts to connect, collaborate, and transfer globally distributed knowledge faster than ever before. Professionals at investment firms, consultancies, corporations and nonprofits rely on us to connect them seamlessly with knowledgeable domain experts who help enhance their thinking, inform critical decisions and propel their business forward. Founded in 2008, AlphaSights currently employs more than 1,500 professionals in nine offices around the globe and regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world.

The Role

We are looking for highly talented and driven senior front-end software engineers who take pride in their work, to expand our Engineering team in Portugal. Successful candidates will join a cross functional team including product managers and designers working closely with the rest of our business to deliver working code that solves real problems for both internal and external customers. You will take ownership of the problems that your team solves, ensuring a high level of quality in everything that we release, working as part of a top performing international development team. If you have a strong passion for solving problems with code, and want to work with exceptional colleagues in a high achievement environment, this role is a good fit for you.

What You’ll Do

Design solutions: Define the best technical solutions to business problems, contributing to an architectural vision that will scale up to be the world's leading research platform.
Ship working code: We primarily work with React on the frontend and Kotlin microservices with Postgres on the backend, with some older services written in Ruby on Rails. We’ve always got an eye open to assess new technologies that might improve our stack.
Deploy and iterate: We release frequently to our customers, using CIrcleCI and Spinnaker for CI/CD, and quickly gather feedback in order to inform our next iteration.
Learn and grow: Engineers can use our L&D budget and regular “Sandbox days” to learn and grow skills outside of what they encounter in their day-to-day.
Maintenance and troubleshooting: Carefully monitor our services, catching errors before users notice them, diagnosing the root cause and deploying fixes.

Who You Are

You probably have a degree in a STEM subject, but we’re happy to work with people who perfected their craft via a different route.
Experience working at a similar level in a mature Engineering team, and looking to take your career to the next level. We’re looking for people who have incredible potential.
Technical expertise with at least one programming language (we use Kotlin and a bit of Ruby), and ideally experience with relational databases.
Proven track record – You’ve made a demonstrable impact in your previous roles, standing out from your peers.
Highly driven and proactive – you relentlessly and independently push through hurdles and drive towards excellent outcomes.
Meticulous – you hold high standards and have an obsessive attention to detail.

Learn more about our tech organization and see our team in action by viewing this video!

Don't worry if your experience or background doesn't match all of these areas, we believe a broad spectrum of experience provides great perspective on solving problems in new and innovative ways and we’d love to hear from you.

Please note that unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visas for this position. AlphaSights is an equal opportunity employer.

THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION EXCLUSIVELY FOR CURRENT PORTUGUESE RESIDENTS.

About the job
Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 6 billion downloads and over 150 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #2 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google.

The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, having raised over $1B and backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL.

Voodoo is now a team of over 750 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hyper-casual, hybrid-casual, casual, mid-core and blockchain experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Our Core games team is divided into Publishing, Partnership and Internal Studios teams. With over six billion downloads worldwide, we are the largest and most successful mobile gaming publisher in the world. Since the creation of the App Store, only Meta and Google have achieved more downloads, and we are the only European player in the top six.

What will be your main challenges?

We are looking for talents interested in creating something bigger ! To succeed in this role, you will need to have a good understanding of the hyper casual & casual mobile game market. You will support small and high performing teams. Through your work you will develop your skills and help us to deliver fun and entertaining games to millions of people all around the world!

Identifying and documenting core mobile games concepts and mechanics that can be built into something bigger
Designing the game toward engagement: level design, in-game progression, economics
Building metagames that are modular, versatile and revenue generating
Exploring new ways to entertain a hyper casual audience with casual/midcore concepts
Using the extensive game library of Voodoo to understand what motivates a new generation of game player

The role

Drive selection of game concepts to support teams transition from pure Hyper Casual to more complex Puzzle and Battle mobile games:
Analyze game play and users behavior through internal and external models and tools
Deconstruct and analyze mobile games mechanics to come up with relevant and marketable concepts
Build on yours’ or others' ideas and create consistent and comprehensive game designs starting from a core mechanic
Benchmark the market to stay on top of new trends
Support the creation of new Hybrid Casual Games Hits:
Pitch and implement new game ideas and features to the team, through detailed Game Design Documents
Design games from A to Z: gameplay, FTUE, levels, environments, reward systems, difficulty, balancing, etc.
Get involved in all aspects of game development: UI,UX, game design, logic, performance, etc.
Help fine-tune game balancing, pacing and feeling
Support teams production with relevant tools and good ways of working
Improve the workflow (building a better pipeline, creating reusable templates, creating procedural level designs, etc)
Create gameplay prototypes and a database of gameplay concepts that could be used in the future

Profile

At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Game Designer (or App Designer) with Unity experience preferred
Experience with game prototyping (including participating in game jams)
Solid knowledge about Game Design including game mechanics, level design, and UI/UX
Experience with balancing game systems (difficulty, reward, economy, etc) and funnel optimization
Experienced with creating mock-ups and design documents
Experienced in communicating with programmers, leading them through the execution of your designs and giving feedback
Creative problem-solving skills to address a diversity of game design issues every day, including but not limited to gameplay, level, interface, etc
Good level of English (both writing and speaking)
Versatile, can adapt quickly, and move fast

Benefits : competitive salary and other benefits according to the country you reside.

About the job

Job Description & Summary
PwC IT Services is a great place to work for ambitious, open-minded and responsible people. We have been implementing the most innovative customer experience solutions for our clients since 2005. We are partners of the largest software providers in the world – Salesforce, Microsoft, Mulesoft and many more. We believe that our success comprises not only modern technologies we use but, above all, well trained, competent people. We are In Touch with Tomorrow helping our clients rise and develop faster.


Data is a crucial asset for virtually all enterprises and institutions operating in a modern world. Regardless of the size of business, proper analysis of data enables leaders to make right and timely business decisions, identify and predict problems, verify correctness and performance of implemented solutions, optimizations, marketing campaigns etc

Data Practice at PwC IT Services is a group of over 30 professionals helping our clients to become data-driven organisations and take advantage of data they collect & process by delivering full-scale, cloud based data & analytics platforms and reporting solutions. We cooperate with clients from a variety of industries e.g. manufacturing, pharmaceutical, financial services, telecommunications, FMCG etc. and geographies.

Currently, we are looking for experienced Data Engineers to join our Data Practice.

Role:

As a Data Engineer you will:

design and implement data ingestion processes
design and implement data cleansing, transformation & processing pipelines
design data models,
Write unit tests for delivered scripts, notebooks etc.

Contribute to standards and delivery guidelines used in our Data Practice.

Candidate profile:

Databricks\PySpark
Azure Data Platform (e.g. Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL, Azure Synapse etc.)
Snowflake

Good knowledge of procedural SQL languages (T-SQL, PL/SQL)
Strong analytical skills
Very good communication skills (both oral and written communication)
Team player (experience in working in international environment is a plus)
Good command of English (C1 level)

Nice to have:
Experience with CI/CD tools
Experience with Power BI

Our offer:

Great job in an even greater team and in the package:

Opportunity to develop competences and gain experience in the development of IT systems for the largest Polish and European companies,
An interesting job in a group of professionals with many years of experience in international companies,
Long term, stable cooperation,
Long list of benefits (private health care, multisport, life insurance and more),
Different career paths to choose from, training and development programs,
Friendly work atmosphere of a technology company.


Send your application today! In case you have any additional questions, contact us: pl_ITrecruitment@pwc.com.

Your personal data will be processed for the purpose of performing a recruitment process for the job offered. About the job
Acreto is looking for an experienced Golang developer to join our team.

This developer will work directly with Data/Analytics branch of Acreto, for the purpose of creating scalable data pipelines that will be used for both internal and external reporting, data analysis, and eventually, ML solutions.

You will help us build our Acreto Cloud Security platform coined by Gartner as Secure Access Service Edge (SASE).

Join us! Come with us on our journey to change the face of security. We’re thrilled to work with you.

Responsibilities:
· Development of Golang-based backend system components
· Active participation in the architecture of the backend
· Participation in the Code Review process
· Creation of Automated data validation processes for the purpose of reporting
· Design and execution of pipelines into Acreto’s data warehouse for both long term and short-term analysis
· Creating indices and nodes in elastic for the purpose of time series analysis.

Must-Have Skills:
· Golang
· Elastic Cluster (7 or greater)
· DB (SQL, ORM, NOSQL)
· REST API
· Message Broker / Stream Processing: Kafka
· Microservice Architecture
· Network Protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, DNS, HTTP)
· Git Versioning, Issue Tracking, Merge/Pull Requests
· Docker
· Basic Python Knowledge
· Basic SQL Knowledge

Nice to Have:
· Design and Implementation of Distributed Systems
· Public Key Infrastructure
· IPv6 fundamentals
· VPN fundamentals
· Public Cloud Providers (AWS, GCP, …)
· Test Automation
· CI/CD workflows

How we work:
· The majority of the team works remotely, but we have offices in the US and Europe.
· We need availability during European business hours

This is a full-time, long-term position. We are NOT looking for agencies for this position.

About Acreto
End-to-end, Zero-Trust security to protect anything, anywhere. One security from one provider to protect all your systems.Acreto seeks to democratize security. We have lived in a world where security consists of stacks of bulky, inflexible solutions that do not meet the needs of all users and require huge amounts of overhead to implement and operate. In a world of increasing insecurity, and with more and more assets being moved to a digital space, one of the great challenges of our time is securing our data, our businesses, and our lives. Acreto seeks to democratize the security of our digital spaces by providing an all-inclusive, robust, and customizable SASE platform for all.Join us on our journey to provide one of the most valuable assets in an uncertain world: security. As a member of the Acreto team, you will be engaged in an environment of brilliant, motivated problem-solvers, with a passion for building a game-changing security architecture; designing elegant and intuitive User front end control; crafting robust and meaningful representations of security data; and researching cutting edge cyber-security AI.

About the job
Senior Analytics Engineer
Since launching in 2010, WP Engine has become the world’s leading WordPress Digital Experience Platform (DXP), now with over 100,000 customers in 140 countries. We’re proud of the technology and service we offer our customers that move their businesses forward faster. At WP Engine, we strive to do the best work of our careers, and feel empowered to do what is right for our customers. We love investing in employee success and uncovering opportunities for you, the best, to get better. 99 percent of employees believe you’re made to feel welcome at WP Engine. Be you. Be here.

What's cool about this job?
WP Engine is on a mission to help our customers win online! Whether that’s helping an aspiring entrepreneur to turn a hobby into an online business or a multinational corporation to launch a new campaign in weeks instead of months, our platform is there to help them win — whatever that means for them.

We have an opportunity for an experienced Analytics Engineer to help construct a contextualised view of our data. These data assets will be used across business & data analytics teams and will become the core repository for their data needs. As an Analytics Engineer, you will sit at the intersection of these groups and will be responsible for bringing about trusted, robust and valuable data assets, as well as incorporating changes over time as the business needs change. We are looking for an individual who cares about organizing data into reusable and maintainable components and can bring their energy to helping us grow this function at WP Engine.

Our culture is renowned; we believe it is meaningful to hire the best and ensure that we provide an environment where the best get better. If you are great at solving problems, a hard worker with excellent interpersonal skills, and enjoy working across different time zones and cultures, you may be the person that we are looking for!

The day to day.
Work closely with business stakeholders in Sales, Marketing, Finance & Customer Experience to design valuable data models
Develop, deliver and maintain dbt code to advance our Unified Analytics Model as the trusted source for valuable data
Create and maintain system, data and architectural documentation related to data assets maintained by Analytics Engineering
Be an advocate for maintaining high quality and highly maintainable data assets through best practices and standards
Review code contributions to the Unified Analytics Model, educating on best practices and hygiene that lead to healthy data models
Identify & develop process improvements that result in an improved Analytics Engineering practice

Your skills and expertise.
Advanced SQL skills - clean, readable, high quality code
Experience building complex, maintainable dbt models
Advanced experience working with source control (git preferable)
Experience working with one of the major cloud vendors (GCloud, Azure, AWS)
Experience working within an Agile team, delivering iterative value every sprint
Ability to work effectively with a remote team across multiple time zones
Driven and self motivated with excellent organizational skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to understand, document and convert business requirements into useful data models
Previous experience in a business domain such as: marketing, sales, finance, customer service or engineering
3+ years in the data space working as an analyst, engineering or similar
2+ years working on data analysis and delivery of data assets for business insights
1+ years working with dbt

The perks and benefits.
Stock Options (Every employee is an owner in the company)
Matched pension plan
VHI Healthcare & Dental
Strive Pass - €80 to expense every month on anything that makes you happy!
Employee Assistance Program
Generous Vacation Time (Who doesn’t like time off)
One-time €450 Home Office Stipend
Employee Resource Groups
4 Company Wellness Days
Wellness Program
Calm App Subscription

*As part of the recruitment process you will be asked to complete an exercise to demonstrate practical examples of your SQL and DBT skills to transform data and apply business logic. The purpose of this exercise is to show that you can design and maintain a clean and sustainable DBT project.*

At WP Engine, we strive to have the broadest possible view of diversity, going beyond visible differences to include the background, experiences, skills, and perspectives that make each person unique. WP Engine is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

description:
About the job
La société

Leur mission: rendre l'accès aux soins cardiaques de haut niveau accessible à tous, n'importe où, n'importe quand.

Pour concrétiser cette vision, ils tirent parti des technologies d'apprentissage automatique (IA) et de cloud computing. Leur premier produit est une application SaaS, déjà déployée dans le monde entier pour aider les médecins à diagnostiquer les maladies cardiaques.

L'examen le plus courant pour diagnostiquer une arythmie est un électrocardiogramme (ECG) ambulatoire, qui enregistre l'activité électrique du cœur entre 1 et 30 jours, voire jusqu'à quelques années dans le cas des dispositifs implantables. Les grandes quantités de données générées par de tels tests nécessitent encore que les experts passent par un processus long et laborieux, ce qui entraîne des coûts élevés, des retards de traitement et une qualité variable.

Le poste

Vous serez garant de l'infrastructure de leurs produits qui sont utilisés pour rationaliser le diagnostic de plusieurs milliers de patients quotidiennement, sur quatre continents différents.

Vous approfondirez également les sujets techniques liés à la haute disponibilité, à la surveillance des performances et aux améliorations ou encore à la sécurité.

Votre profil

Une personne autonome, engagée, enthousiaste avec un esprit "can-do", créatif et challengeant
Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience dans la mise en place et la gestion de plateformes SaaS
Connaissance des architectures modernes de plate-forme Web
Vous avez déjà travaillé avec au moins deux des éléments suivants : Python, Ruby (Rails), systèmes de surveillance et de journalisation tels que Datadog, Kubernetes, bases de données relationnelles, services cloud (tels que GCP, AWS ou Azure)
Maîtriser l'anglais parlé et écrit, et avoir au moins des notions de base en français

Les petits plus

Vous avez déjà travaillé dans un environnement de startup.
Vous avez une expérience antérieure et/ou un fort intérêt pour le développement de produits de santé

Ce qu’on préfère

Être impliqué à fond dans une aventure avec de nombreux challenges techniques
Des apéros mensuels
Des cours de yoga hebdomadaire
Très bonne ambiance, équipe solidaire et orientée partage d’informations
Et surtout full remote accepté

Ce poste a été soigneusement choisi par votre coach. Powered by Octopus IT, cabinet d’Experts en Recrutement Tech (CDI et clients finaux uniquement) – Visitez nous pour plus d’opportunités : www.octopusit.fr

About the job
🚀 Whatnot

Whatnot (YC W20) is a livestream shopping platform and marketplace backed by Andreessen Horowitz and Y Combinator. We’re one of YC’s top companies and one of the fastest growing marketplaces ever. We’re laser focused on creating an exceptional software company, team, and place to work.

Our mission: enable anyone to turn their passion into a business and bring people together through commerce. We’re building the future of ecommerce; an interactive community where creators can make a living off their passion.

Did we mention we’re high growth? In January 2021, Whatnot had 10 ambitious employees. Today, the Whatnot team is 160+ employees and will exceed 300 by year end. We’re hiring forward-thinking problem solvers across all functional areas. We recruit thoughtfully, can adapt quickly, and are scaling fully remotely .

📈 Opportunity Size

The e-commerce experience has been static for 20+ years and is one of the largest opportunities for disruption in the startup space today. Livestream shopping is a $300B GMV market in China and has grown 100% YoY. Retail is a $5T market opportunity!

💻 The role

Payments at Whatnot makes the money flow, and orders happen. The team’s scope is large, encompassing pay, fraud & shipping. Engineers own these entire flows from experience, to vendor integrations, to inhouse infrastructure. Last year we moved >$150m through these pipelines and shipped millions of products to users and this year we’re aiming to 10x those numbers.

To achieve these goals, we’re looking to make a number of substantial improvements to our systems and customer experiences including critical areas of the business like payment scale & reliability, increased payment options, fraud mitigation, advanced shipping options, and improved delivery times and bringing Whatnot to hundreds of millions more customers.

We’re looking for capable iOS engineers with a proven track record for building slick UI's that people love. Whatnot is growing very rapidly, so you must be able to deal with the pressure/growth that comes with a high-growth environment. You will be working in a high-growth startup, wearing multiple hats.
Build native iOS applications in Swift.
Build intuitive user interfaces from the ground up.
Create modifiable, maintainable, and well-tested code.
Investigate and solve issues with bugs and data inconsistencies.
Improve the availability and performance of current systems.
Work with the engineering team to define implementation strategy, define overall requirements, and redefine a product, if needed.

👋 About You

3+ years of software engineering experience.
2+ years of experience writing production iOS apps.
Expert in Swift - Interest in SwiftUI a bonus!
Experience writing readable, maintainable, and scalable code
Strong attention to detail. Whatnot operates without a product team, giving engineering full reign of the product.
Constantly strives to push yourself and the team forward through technical and intellectual rigor.
Self-starter. You will be able to hit the ground running with little direction.
Startup experience at a high-growth company is a major plus.

🎁 Benefits

A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback.
Competitive base salary and stock options in a hugely successful, Series company
Unlimited Vacation Policy and Company-wide Holidays (including a spring and winter break)
Comprehensive Health Insurance and Paid Parental Leave
Work From Home Support

💛 EOE

Whatnot is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, parental status, disability status, or any other status protected by law. We believe that our work is better and our company culture is improved when we encourage, support, and respect the different skills and experiences represented within our workforce.

About the job
Job Description

Do you relish the prospect of working in the digitization innovation industry?

Would you like to be in a team managing remote sites globally?

Join our excellent remote drilling team!

Our remote drilling team is responsible for real-time support to our global customers. This includes controlling remote jobs, technical support and other service requests. The team is always looking for further improvements in processes, procedures and ways of working.

Partner with the best

As part of 24/7 Remote Operations Team you will provide real-time support for the Directional Drilling product portfolio and associated software. With the goals to prevent/minimize non-productive time for customers and provide the service delivery.

As a Remote Operations Engineer DD, you will be responsible for:


Provide supervision and direction for Directional Drilling operations, real-time drilling performance and drilling optimization services
Be responsible for Anti-collision, running anti-collision scans when required.
Participating in managing the job cycle activities to proactively impact service delivery
Mentoring junior engineers on raising the competences by developing specific processes and procedures
Providing well plans and parameters to rig crew, perform effective communication with client representatives, and drill crew.
Conducting all business activities in accordance with Baker Hughes HSE policies and compliance requirements

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:


Have completed Bachelor studies in Petroleum Engineering, Geology or Earth Sciences and have relevant experience
Be able to work in a 24/7 service environment, based on an agreed shift schedule
Have a solid background and knowledge of downhole directional drilling tools including Rotary Steerable Systems, directional drilling and drilling optimization principles
Have proven ability to recognize, analyze and solve technical issues, coupled with a process oriented working style.
Have good communication skills both verbal and written in English

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:


This is a shift based working pattern (two weeks on, two weeks off)

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace challenge with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:


Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits

About Us:

We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
