job_title: Medior Azure Data Engineer [Kosice or Remote]
description:
About the job
Accenture Advanced Technology Center is looking for Medior Azure Data Engineers who are ready for a challenging IT career and focus on Azure Data Platform Modernization and application development with BI implementation for business.

You have the opportunity to grow as Azure Data Engineer - and become Azure Data Architect - under Accenture’s wing and help our clients develop applications with a cloud-first, data-focused mindset, generate the next wave of innovative solutions for the most decisive players of different industries.

You will be part of our state-of-the-art Accenture Data Hub which we are building up. The members of this group of excellence have the opportunity to get trained and certified in the area of Azure Data, where we provide the materials, the bootcamp and we sponsor you to take exams and get certified.

What You Will Do

As a Medior Data Engineer you are helping our projects with realizing their digital strategies.

Designing, implementing and testing Azure Data solutions that meet design specifications

Identifying, creating and preparing data required for modern business intelligence solutions

Deploying BI solutions into Azure Cloud environments

Integrating the New Solutions with other existing components in the applications

Building BI solutions using existing cloud provided services

Be part of a community focusing on Agile delivery and applying agile principles in day to day work

Co-operate and communicate with client teams to follow up on business requirements

Take active part in trainings to grow further

Help fresh graduate colleagues with their learning path

What We Expect

Good knowledge of any SQL (Postgres, MSSQL) and at least one programming language. Preferred languages are Python, PySpark and C#

Familiar with the concepts of relational and non-relational data, and different types of data workloads such as transactional or analytical.

At least 0.5-1 year experience with Big Data technologies in the environment of Azure (Spark, Data Bricks) and cloud technologies is an advantage

Have foundational knowledge of core data concepts and how they are implemented using Microsoft Azure Data services

Hands-on experience at least in one ETL tool (SSIS, Informatica, Talend, Glue, Azure Data factory) is an advantage

Having AZ-900 and / or DP-900 is beneficial

What We Offer

Accenture offers a competitive compensation package. As required by the Slovak law we hereby state, that the legal monthly minimum gross base pay starting from 1 800 € to 3 000 € depending on your professional and personal qualifications in the required areas.

Recognition:

Guaranteed paid overtime or overtime vacation

German language bonus up to 400€ monthly/gross depending on language proficiency and level of seniority

Flexible Benefit System - budget to be spent on services of your choice

Competitive bonus structure

Refer-a-Friend – get a bonus in the employee referral program

Loyalty rewards Flexibility:

Flexible working arrangements (time & place of work) Future:

Wide range of trainings and expert lectures

Regular performance review and career growth possibilities

Ongoing career guidance and mentoring (Global Mentoring Program, Lean In)

Employee share purchase plan Family & Health:

3 extra days off

Sick leave salary compensation (up to 100%)

Home-office equipment

Family oriented benefits (Wedding, Parental and Baby days-off and bonuses)

Employee assistance services (professional psychological, financial and legal help)

Multisport card

About the job
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Physical Security Engineer.

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.

Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action!

Responsibilities

As a Physical Security Engineer your responsibilities are:

Security Policy and Standards
Deploy security technologies in accordance with established requirements, standards, deadlines, and applicable employment law and company policy.
Provide Subject Matter Expertise for security technologies and support high visibility needs of the business on a variety of special projects which often involve expedited deliverables, operational agility, and impact to operational functions.
Collaboration And Partner Experience
Collaborate with peer teams and organizations to ensure alignment with broader strategy and initiatives as well as full support of leadership priorities, focused on helping to reduce costs and complexity, and improve efficiency.
Provide strong partnership and trusted advice to evangelize and represent Microsoft’s datacenter physical security programs, where appropriate.
Manage regular site security system meetings with security operations and facility management teams where current site system health is reviewed, and coordination of services with internal and external service providers is handled.
Data-Driven Analysis and Improvement
Collect and maintain security system data to identify system health, performance trends, system configuration compliance, and recommend repeatable strategies to address issues at scale.
Continuously improve and mature the overall physical security program, including providing expertise on the continuing evolution of existing physical security processes and procedures that produce valid, trustworthy results, support the goals of the business, and remove as many subjective elements as possible.
Security Incident Response
Receive escalation notifications of physical security and business impacting incidents, triage and escalate as appropriate, ensuring leadership and peer teams are informed, and appropriate personnel are managing incident response effectively.
Monitoring and Detection
Manage physical security technologies and systems at Microsoft Datacenters, including physical access control, video surveillance, security networks, radio over internet protocol, key management, and entry systems.
Manage security system life cycle to maintain system health and compliance, including system triage, service escalation, and the oversight of the maintenance and repair performed by vendor support teams.
Other
Embody our culture and values.
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
Experience in software development lifecycle, large-scale computing, modeling, cyber security, anomaly detection, Security Operations Center (SOC) detection, threat analytics, security incident and event management (SIEM), information technology (IT), and operations incident response.
OR Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong experience in software development lifecycle, large-scale computing, modeling, cyber security, and anomaly detection.
OR Master's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
Lenel Certifications, CISSP, CISA, CISM, SANS, GCIA, GCIH, OSCP, and/or Security+ certification.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Requirements

These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
#COICareers

#COIEngCareers

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

About the job
Job Details

Would you like the opportunity work from home? Then we have a range of outstanding career options that will give you a healthy work life balance and the flexibility to have the lifestyle you've always wanted!

We are offering you the chance to gain corporate work experience with a global organisation and work remotely from home. We have a range of positions that require French speakers who can also speak an intermediate level of English.

We have opportunities in departments such as Purchasing, Finance, Customers Services and HR. These opportunities will suit recent graduates, students taking a year out from their studies and anyone else looking for a career change. This is an excellent opportunity to gain skills in a global organisation whilst working from home.

What We Look For
French and English language skills
Good communications
Excellent organisation skills
A proactive “can do” approach
Ability to adapt to different people
Keen to learn and develop
At Johnson Controls you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting projects in today’s market. Our hardworking people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, results-oriented, hardworking and above all fun.

We believe that diversity and inclusion matter and make a difference. By embracing the true value of diversity and inclusion, getting comfortable with having crucial conversations, and valuing different perspectives, we will be one of the most desirable places to work.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - External Device Interface (m/f/d)
description:
About the job
At CARIAD, it’s our mission to transform automotive mobility for everyone, everywhere, making it safer, more sustainable, and more comfortable in every way.

To deliver on that promise, we’re building a unified technology and software platform, including a vehicle OS and cloud platform, as well as a unified architecture. As a 100% subsidiary of the Volkswagen Group, we’re developing solutions for all of its brands, including Volkswagen, Audi, and Porsche, and will bring our software to over 40 million vehicles by 2030.

Is this an easy task? Not at all! To tackle such a huge challenge, we need a great team. And that’s where you come in. You’ll join more than 5,000 CARIDIANS already working on the latest vehicle features and functions like automated driving, state-of-the-art charging technology, as well as a new digital ecosystem. Together, we’re bringing sustainable change to one of the largest companies in the world.

YOUR TEAMThe Mobile & In-Car Apps department is building apps running on the mobile device as well as apps running on the infotainment system. The feature team Local Command & Control enables innovative features on the mobile device for direct communication with the vehicle. Examples are: Remote Parking (Control parking and pullout maneuver from outside of the vehicle), Personalisation (Automatically login to the infotainment system when approaching the vehicle), Light control (Demonstrate and personalize the exterior light of the vehicle), Holoride (Adapt virtual reality content to the movements of the vehicle), Calendar (Show calendar data from the mobile phone in the vehicle), External device interface (provides access to vehicle interfaces from a mobile device).

External device interface brings both worlds of mobile and in-car apps together: there is a software component on the infotainment system that makes the interfaces available over direct communication channels and there is an API on the mobile device that provides access to those interfaces. External device interface enables vendor specific extensions of CarPlay / Android Auto and controlling vehicle functions remotely from a mobile device from outside or inside of the vehicle.

#Infotainment

What You Will Do

Shape the software for providing access to vehicle interfaces on the infotainment system
Define and develop the software component in the infotainment system to make the vehicle interfaces available for certain use cases
Be actively involved in each step of the solution definition, including the feature definition, the architecture and the design
Collect and analyze requirements from stakeholders and turn them into features of the software component
Perform experiments in test benches or vehicles to evaluate the vehicle interfaces
Implement the software component, perform primal system integration and adapt it to new platforms
Analyze occurring issues along development chain
Be part of the validation and verification of the implemented solution at all levels

Who You Are

Successfully completed studies in the field computer science or an equivalent field
Several years of experience in Android development with Kotlin and/or Java an familiar with software development environments and analysis tools
Habituated in the usage of direct communication channels (Bluetooth Low Energy, WiFi, iAP2, Android VEC) inside Android
Experience in vehicle communication (SomeIP, CAN, …) and Android Automotive (AAOS or AOSP)
Ideally knowledge about the C and/or C++ programming language for native code and open to agile working model (SAFe, Scrum)
European Driving license class B
Fluent English language skills, German language skills are a plus

NICE TO KNOW

Remote work options
Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
Flextime / optional working hours
Company pension plan
Annual professional development
Sabbatical option up to 6 months
30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
Possibility for VW Group car leasing
If you have further questions about the candidate journey at Cariad, talk to Cari, our Cariad Chatbot. Can’t see it? Check your settings or visit our FAQ

About the job
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

Responsibilities:

Perform Privileged Access Management functions
Perform User and Privilege Access Administration functions
Implement and Support the Identity Access Management solutions
Manage applications and coordinate systems integration
Perform user administration on all applications, such as web-based applications and thick client applications etc.
Grant application function access/role to users based on duly authorized requests
Develop procedures to maintain access security and protect systems from unauthorized use, acts of nature and user abuse
Perform Recertification of IDs and Accesses
Initiate user access recertification on a regular basis to ensure no obsolete account or excessive access granted
Involve in projects which include managing vendors, testing, implementation support, etc.
Ensure all security solutions are working and comply with company policy and procedures
Respond and remediate timely on any service outages with customer satisfaction as priority
Operate independently and accomplish engineering and operation tasks within the agreed timeline

Requirements:

Degree in IT/ Computing related field
An understanding of information security, network management, operating systems, software development, database systems and information technology is beneficial
Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills are required
Excellent oral and written communication skills are preferred
Must be highly flexible and adaptable to change
CISA and PMP are considered as a plus

Working at Binance

Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry
Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems
International work environment and flat organisation
Great career development opportunities in a growing company
Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice .

About the job
We bouwen al meer dan tien jaar apps en ons team leert nog elke dag bij. We willen onze processen en technieken voortdurend verbeteren. Het creëren van eersteklas innovatieve en vooruitstrevende apps met slimme oplossingen is onze corebusiness. Draag jij bij aan het vormgeven van de toekomst van Egeniq?

Dit ben jij

Je bent niet zomaar een softwaretester... Je bent geobsedeerd door kwalitatieve apps en kan dat aantonen.
Je hebt de afgelopen 7 dagen iets geleerd wat je nog niet wist.
Als je een geweldige testcase maakt, ben je daar trots op.
Je bent een kei in het begrijpen en testen van eisen, specificaties en ontwerpen.
Je bent bekend met techstacks zoals Charles, Selenium, Azure en Firebase.
Je moet kunnen uitleggen waarom je zo dol bent op het testen van apps, waarom je doet wat je doet en hoe je denkt dat dit ons kan helpen in onze projecten.

Dit ga je doen

Je maakt en beheert uitgebreide, gedetailleerde en waterdichte testplannen en testgevallen.
Je deelt je kennis met anderen.
Je werkt samen met meer dan 35 collega's: op afstand, en één of twee keer per maand in real life.

Desired Skills and Experience
Dit verwachten we van je

Je bent een meester in testautomatisering en/of functioneel testen.
Je hebt informatica of een andere relevante studie afgerond.
Je bent als een spons en neemt kennis makkelijk op.
Je hebt een passie voor het testen van software.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden.
Meer nog dan vaardigheden of ervaring, hechten we veel waarde aan passie voor technologie en in dit geval testen en kwaliteitsborging in het bijzonder.
Dit is Egeniq

Egeniq groeit snel. We hechten veel waarde aan kennis en helpen jou om er alles uit te halen. Als je bij ons werkt, krijg je een Gadget Kit, gevuld met een MacBook Pro, een 5K-scherm en alle apparaten die je nodig hebt om te testen. Houd er rekening mee dat we remote werken. Het grootste deel van de tijd werk je dus thuis. Tijdens een kerst- en zomerevent zien we elkaar in een ontspannen setting.

Herken je jezelf in deze vacature?

Neem dan even contact met ons op. Stuur ons je cv en motivatie via egeniq.recruitee.com, dan komen we snel op je sollicitatie terug. Pas je toch niet helemaal in het profiel, maar lijkt werken bij Egeniq je wel leuk? Bekijk dan gerust ook onze andere vacatures of stuur een open sollicitatie.

About the job
Überblick

Du bist ein erfahrener PHP Developer (m/w/d) und auf der Suche nach einer neuen Herausforderung? Dann habe ich hier vielleicht genau das Richtige für DICH!

Mein Kunde, ein dynamisches und innovatives Unternehmen, welches es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht hat, durchdachte und maßgeschneiderte Kampagnen und Konzepte hinsichtlich Technik, Design und Content zu entwerfen sucht zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt ein neues Teammitglied.

Aufgabengebiet

Gemeinsam mit deinem Team, realisierst du große Webprojekte
Du setzt die technische Konzeption und Implementierung von Webpotalen um
Du schaffst skalierbare Lösungen

Anforderungsprofil

PHP ist deine Leidenschaft
Du bringst Erfahrungen in MVC Frameworks sowie JavaScript mit
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrungen mit TYPO3/Neo und/oder Magento
Du legst einen hohen Qualitätsanspruch auf deine eigene Arbeit
Du bist ein Organisationstalent und arbeitest gerne im Team
Fundierte Deutschkenntnisse

Benefits

Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeit)
Home Office mit der Option 100% remote zu arbeiten
Du wirst mit den besten technischem Equipment ausgestattet
Individuelle Weiterbildung – wähle deinen Karriereweg selber
zahlreiche Firmenevents
Prepaidkreditkarte mit vielen Rabatten
Hunde sind im Office erlaubt
Sportförderung (Firmenfitness & Yoga)
Jobrad

Bewerben

Das klingt nach einer Position ganz nach deinem Geschmack? Dann melde dich gerne bei Jessi unter j.grunwald@staffgroup.com oder ruf mich unter 0171 9345244 an. Bewerben kannst du dich aber auch gerne über den untenstehenden Link.

About the job
Department: Technology

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Germany

Description

Team Internet AG is an online marketing company founded in 2010 and acquired by CentralNic in 2019. With the domain parking platform ParkingCrew.com and the Traffic Marketplace TONIC. We are one of the leading companies in our industry worldwide and want to continue and expand this success in the future. Characteristic for us is the focus on technical solutions and the high degree of personal responsibility of our employees.

Key Responsibilities

Our developers are the owners of their product and therefore the daily work covers the whole range of tasks such as e.g
Further development of front and backend (native PHP)
Further and new development of batch processes for processing big data
Development of future-oriented architectures and solutions based on stakeholder requirements
Expansion of our partially automated release process (continuous integration) and quality assurance (unit testing, code reviews)
Modernization and conversion of the architecture during ongoing operations

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

In order to achieve our future goals, we are looking for people with the best qualifications to continue growing together in a team and to expand their knowledge with us. You should bring the following with you:
Hands-on experience in PHP-OOP
Practical experience in web development including version control (Git)
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g. MySQL) and the basic Internet architectures (HTTP, DNS, IP addresses, domains)
the motivation to approach problems in a structured way and to master them

What we offer
Flat hierarchies and short communication channels
Exciting, dynamic tasks with lots of traffic, large amounts of data and a lot of variety as well as personal responsibility
Well-equipped, modern office in the heart of Munich (S-Bahn Stammstrecke / Tram Isartor) and a technical environment as you wish it
Whether on-site, hybrid or remote… everything is possible for you
Trust-based working hours and more than 30 days of vacation allow a lot of flexibility
Various events offer you the opportunity to get to know our teams even better
Company fitness with 5,000 high-quality sports and health facilities throughout Germany or with online courses
Tax-free lunch allowances conveniently via app and attractive corporate benefits with over 1,500 providers
Individual training courses available online all year round, including one-to-one lessons with native English speakers
Fast-growing, dynamic Online company with agile, motivated teams and a great working atmosphere
#LI_REMOTE

About the job
This is a fantastic opportunity to join an exciting, fast-paced industry in a caring, nurturing, motivational and multicultural environment, that allows for true personal advancement and career progression.

We can offer you:

A value-based culture - all of our employees live by our shared core values which in turn brings everyone together in a collaborative culture with a real sense of community.
We can offer you access to an online learning portal assisting you in progressing and developing your skillset further.
Hybrid working
Benchmarked salary and progression paths.

As an Azure Automation Architect for the Global Solutions Team, you’ll play a key role managing a global team of engineers building a solutions portfolio in a specific area such as Application Innovation, Modern Workplace, Data Protection, etc. The role is expected to design soluions by combining public cloud platforms (Azure, AWS) with ecosystem software vendors (ISVs) and work closely with solutions management team to build solutions with a very high level of Automation tools like Powershell, Terraform, etc... in Azure.

What you'll do:

Work with Platform (TNG) team to accommodate for solutions.
Interact with CoE (Center of Excelence Cloud) to commercially define Solutions.
Work with a global team of Engineers to design and build TD SYNNEX solutions.
Provide reporting to stakeholders.
Interaction with Product Mangement /IT.
Interact with solutions management team to design solutions.
ISV Enablement.

What we're kindly looking for:

Bachelor's Degree with Computer Sciences field of study required.
5 to 8 Years of relevant work experience.
1 to 3 Years of experience directly managing / supervising employees.
Able to interact effectively with all levels of management.
Able to negotiate skillfully, promote/sell ideas persuasively, and close transactions with mutually beneficial results.
Able to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
Able to use relevant computer system applications at an advanced level.

And last… but surely not least:

You will work in an international environment for a fortune Top100 organization.
We are an organization wherein we take our values very seriously and wherein we pay sincere attention to ‘diversity and inclusion’.
An organization where humor and fun are very important. Work hard, play hard.
A very active staff association.
TD SYNNEX is a certified ‘Top Employer’ and proclaimed to be one of the most appealing employers in IT more than once.
Hybrid working (partially from home, partially from the office).
The best coffee. Pretty important.

What’s In It For You?

Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.

Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

About the job
Software Engineering

What drives us?

At Zühlke, you are where innovation happens. We focus on teamwork, agile collaboration, and leading technologies to shape the future and challenge the status quo. We like to break down barriers and explore new territory. This is how we innovate.

Our creativity, our skills and our energy enable us to turn intelligent ideas into valuable solutions – solutions that help our clients bring innovative, effective, and sustainable products, solutions, and processes to the marketplace. At Zühlke, we are driven by «empowering ideas».

How you'll spend your time

As a Java Backend Engineer at Zühlke, you work in interdisciplinary teams and use your know how in complex software solutions, current Java backend technologies and agile software development methods to develop high-quality software systems that deliver long-term value, integrated in their application landscape.

Communication is your strength – to be able to build great software services, you will develop a deep understanding of client domains, their processes and organisations, and the requirements in the project. To achieve this, together with your teammates you closely collaborate with your clients as business partners at eye level.

You want to make an impact - whether it’s modernising the core systems of a financial service provider, codifying decades of medical knowhow into a customisable risk assessment system for health insurances or building a cloud-based fleet management platform for power tools, you develop scalable and reliable systems that bring your clients business processes to the next level.

You have a growth mindset - building on a comprehensive education offering, you continuously keep up to date with state-of-the-art technologies and development practices and apply them in projects to build your expertise.

Empowered by a network of highly skilled peers and experts, we support you in your individual career planning. Whether it's becoming an expert in your field or growing your leadership or consulting skills and progressively take more responsibility in your projects.

What is important to us
After your studies or training, you still have a stable interest in new trends and technologies in Java backend development and have already gained a few years of professional experience.
Through the efficient use of modern technologies, tools, and methods, you contribute to the success of your clients - your focus is on the modern Java stack, but you are also familiar with other software development ecosystems.
You have in-depth experience in your programming language, tools and know how to apply software design principles and integration patterns on-premises and in the cloud.
You are a good communicator and value an open and trustful exchange with your team and your clients.
You communicate confidently in English and have a good command of German or are willing to learn it on a colloquial level.

What Working At Zühlke Is All About

At Zühlke, we encourage a growth mindset and support the success of our employees with continuous training and coaching to further your career, your skills, and your personality. We regularly exchange ideas, give each other feedback, and learn from one another.

From this, you'll gather that we communicate openly with each other, assess ourselves honestly and love working in diverse, cross-functional teams to achieve impressive results together.

Added to this is an attractive benefits package and a shared passion to give our best every day.
Flexible working models
Profit sharing
Family-friendly workplace
Health & Wellbeing initiatives
Self-management & the opportunity to take over responsibility and grow through new challenges
Unique social & team building events

We are all learning all the time

Do you feel that you do not yet meet all the requirements? We would like to know more about you, your ambitions and ideas and look forward to receiving your application!

Sounds like a great way to work?

About the job
We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for Software Developers.

Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud.

Your Daily Work
Working as part of our team of software professionals, building applications that are at the core of our client’s businesses, creating e.g. effective electronic customer service and distribution channels, information services, online stores, and applications for the industrial internet
Helping with technical and architectural planning of the application
Sharing your knowledge among team members and supporting them with their technical challenges
For us, it’s important to find interesting projects matching your career goals, be they more front-end, back-end, or data-heavy. Based on your interests, there are possibilities for various career paths, including team lead, coding cloud applications architect, data-driven developer, delivery or pre-sales support, solution architect, tech ambassadorship, cloud strategy consulting, etc.

Your Skills And Attributes Of Success
At least 3 years of work experience
At least 2 years of work experience in backend technologies: Node.js, Python, C#/.NET, Java, Clojure, or something else
At least 2 years of work experience in frontend technologies: JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular, Vue or Svelte
At least 6 months of work experience with the cloud: AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
We value experience with serverless or cloud-native solutions and container technologies (e.g. Kubernetes or Docker).
You value code that is easily read by humans and efficiently executed by machines
Fluent ways of communicating with the customer and your team members
Motivation to learn new, share your knowledge and grow to the next level
Fluent communication skills in English and Finnish
If you don’t meet all of the desired criteria, but still fit most of the requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Let’s find out together if we are a good fit for each other!

What do we offer in return?
A highly skilled multinational team
Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Finland
Local benefits such as extensive private health care and wellness benefits
Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Finland.

If you’d like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.

About Nordcloud

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It’s a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and it has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects.

Learn more at nordcloud.com

About the job
About IP Fabric

Named Gartner Cool Vendor in Network Automation for 2022, IP Fabric is an emerging technology capturing the minds of critical network infrastructure engineers across Europe and the US by enumerating and modelling the behavior of their entire global networks. We have grown exponentially for four years in a row, now spanning from the West Coast of the US to Prague, The Czech Republic and beyond.

IP Fabric's company vision is to define and lead the technology space of Network Assurance. To realize this vision, we are looking for the sharpest business minds to join us and grow as part of our distributed team.

Primary Responsibilities
Helping to build, maintain and troubleshoot infrastructure and services running Linux and containers, various network emulators and appliances, CI/CD pipelines on bare-metal and in public/private clouds.
PoC-ing new technologies and solutions, documenting and transferring the knowledge.
Providing smooth operation by creating tools, automating, integrating and ensuring proper monitoring of all components.
Ensuring safety and security of the infrastructure and services.
Working with software developers and software engineers to make sure that development follows established processes and works as intended.
Participating in team code reviews.
Assisting with customer support for system parts of the platform.

Requirements
Computer science education or equivalent experience.
Experience owning a project from concept to production, including proposal, discussion, and execution.
Ability to work single-handed as well as in a team.
Proficiency in written and verbal communication in English, ability to entertain technical discussions and convey complex topics.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail and ability to take (calculated) risks.

Technological Requirements
Advanced knowledge of GNU/Linux environments, advanced troubleshooting skills of complex infrastructure issues
Advanced bash scripting and mid-to-high level programming/scripting experience (e.g., Python, Ruby, Go, C or other languages)
Proficiency with git or other version management systems
Experience with DSL configuration management systems (e.g. Puppet, Salt, Chef, ...)
Mid-level networking skills (802.3, 802.11; IP addressing and routing principles, static routing, WireGuard, OpenVPN, VLANs, …)

The Following Is Considered a Plus
Advanced knowledge of NGINX
Experience with public cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP, ...)
Knowledge of administration of virtualization platforms (VMware, Hyper-V, Openstack, ...)
Knowledge of CI/CD tools (Jenkins, drone, various pipeline providers, …) and container orchestration tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Nomad, ...)
Dynamic network routing (OSPF, BGP, ...)

Tools We Are Currently Using (Or Deploying)
Debian GNU/Linux
Puppet
ELK stack
Nginx
Python, Ruby
Prometheus/Grafana
GitLab (we use our own CI/CD workers)
GNS3/Eve-ng
Golang

We love hashicorp tools and when possible we plan to use them (esp. vault, consul, terraform).

We use mostly Hetzner (cloud+bare metal) and have a tiny presence in AWS & Azure.

In not-so-distant future we will be deploying and managing kubernetes.

Our Offer
Direct line-of-sight to fruits of your work in small-ish company
Remote-friendly environment but offering great offices in the center of Prague
Flexible working hours
Direct and open communication culture
Challenging tasks in a dynamic international environment
Freedom to use equipment of your choice
Regular team and company events
Equity for well performing individuals
Other common corporate bonuses, including 5 weeks of vacation and sick days.

Benefits
Growth opportunity at the rapidly growing company.
Support of our leaders and continuous growth of your skills with us.
Top international and local teams, technologies, and great product.
5 weeks of annual vacation.
5 sick days per year.
Very good location of our nice offices in the center of Prague (IP Pavlova).
Remote job possible
Refreshment, beverages, and great coffee in the office for free.

About the job
Why SoftwareONE?

Support Engineer (gn) Microsoft Sharepoint

Vollzeit, unbefristet, Standort: Bundesweit an einem unserer Standorte oder im Homeoffice

SoftwareONE ist ein weltweit führendes Plattform-, Lösungs- und Dienstleistungsunternehmen und unterstützt Organisationen mit innovativen Lösungen bei der Budgetierung sowie Optimierung ihrer globalen IT‐Kosten von On‐Premises- bis hin zu Cloud-Umgebungen. Wir verfügen über umfassende Expertise, Kunden im Sinne einer optimalen Cloud-Strategie zu beraten und Geschäftserfolge durch eine Cloud-Infrastruktur dauerhaft zu steigern. Im Bereich MultiVendor Helpdesk leisten wir Support für 11 Hersteller.

The role

Du nimmst eigenständig Kontakt zum Kunden auf und begleitest ihn bis zur Lösung des Problems
Wenn nötig involvierst du den Hersteller und koordinierst die weitere Abstimmung

Außerhalb dieser Zeit leistest du Rufbereitschaften (Maximal 1 Woche im Monat)

Fehleranalyse und Leistungsoptimierung von SharePoint-Farmen

Darüber Hinaus Bringst Du Die Folgenden Soft-Skills Mit
Du arbeitest kunden- und lösungsorientiert
Du liebst es Dinge zu reparieren
Du kannst komplexe Sachverhalte schnell durchschauen
Du kennst Prozesse und Abläufe innerhalb von Matrixorganisationen
Du sprichst und schreibst verhandlungssicher deutsch und englisch

Das haben wir zu bieten:
Eine Karriere bei einem zukunftssicheren Unternehmen mit einer einmaligen Unternehmenskultur
Eine top Mitarbeiter-Bewertung auf kununu!
Wir bieten die Möglichkeit zum Arbeiten im Homeoffice. Aber auch im Office haben wir keinen Dresscode und du kannst anziehen womit auch immer du dich wohl fühlst.
Eine Vielzahl an Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten die sich an deinen Interessen und Bedürfnissen orientieren

Eine offene Kommunikationskultur sowie vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur aktiven Mitgestaltung und Verantwortungsübernahme
Ein modernes und faires Vergütungsmodell, das sich an deiner Qualifikation, deiner Verantwortung und deinem Erfolg orientiert
Mit unserem Mitarbeiteraktienprogramm kannst auch du finanziell an unserem weiteren Erfolg teilhaben
Umfangreiche Mitarbeiterangebote und legendäre gemeinsame Events
Eine top technische Ausstattung für deinen neuen Job!
Ein erprobtes und solides Onboarding

Interessiert?

job_title: Backend Software Engineer (Application Platform team) - Engagement Pillar
description:
About the job
Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including:
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising
Content, offering a headless CMS
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions

Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com.

We are currently expanding our Application Platform team and we are looking for Backend Software Engineer. Is "security", "curiosity" or "growth" your middle name? Then you are a good fit and you can be one of us. You can work remotely or from one of our local offices. The salary starts at €3,000 based on your experience level.

About your role and the team:

The Application Platform team empowers other engineering teams to build their services effectively and with security and compliance built-in by designing, implementing, and maintaining the magic solid foundations and the core frameworks of the Bloomreach Engagement.

Examples of the initiatives driven by this team are:
Integrated zero-trust authentication and authorization management system.
Platform for collecting and processing audit logs in a distributed environment.
Notification center, which allows other teams to communicate information to customers through a single unified channel (upcoming project).

What you might like about this role:
Wide reach - we deal with teams across the company - product, security, architects, engineers, even customers.
Security perspective will be a key element of your day-to-day work
Developing Cloud Native services consumed by customers as well as other engineering teams

What your typical day might look like:

You start your day with a code review of your colleague’s tasks while sipping a cup of fresh-brewed tea or coffee, looking for any signs of problems and possible optimizations. Then you join your teammates on a quick daily standup, where you discuss what you’re currently working on and the plan for the next few days.

After the meeting, you get into “the zone” and spend a few undisturbed hours working on the new authentication framework while making sure it’s safely covered by a suite of unit tests. With a few clicks you quickly spin up a brand new instance of the system in the development cluster, deploy your change and notify the frontend engineer that it’s ready.

You grab a snack and take a little break from coding. Instead, you help a fellow backend engineer from another team figure out the best way to integrate their new service with the audit logging platform. In the meantime the frontend engineer gets back to you and confirms that all the new endpoints work as expected, so you create a merge request and ask your teammates for a code review. It’s a complex piece of code, so you go through it together.

After your code is approved, you merge it, automatically deploying it to the staging environment where it receives further testing by the QA team and automated integration tests before being released to production.

You end your day in a short meeting with a product manager and the director of engineering, where you flesh out the idea you had over lunch yesterday for a new approach to release management that would make the whole process even faster.

Our tech stack:
Python & Go
MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka
Kubernetes (GKE)
Various Google Cloud Platform services (Pub/Sub, BigTable, DataFlow, ...)
Gitlab CI/CD, Prometheus and Grafana

What we expect of the candidate:

The ideal candidate has:
At least 3 year experience developing in Python or Golang
Designing and implementing production-grade REST APIs
Having experience with operating services in production is beneficial
A working understanding of fundamental web security principles (OWASP), Authentication and Authorization practices
Experience with database systems of different kinds (MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka)

Regional benefits:
Monthly lunch entitlement by up to 110€ per month
Pension scheme or Health insurance depending on region

More things you'll like about Bloomreach:

Culture:
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one.
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication.
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style.
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents.
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead.
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5

Personal Development:
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions.
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins.
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)*

Well-being:
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.*
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.*
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones.
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other.

Compensation:
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.*
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.*
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts.
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!*

(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.)

If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful!

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

About the job
Job Description

Do you want to work in an international development team focused on finding the best solutions for our customers?

We are looking for an Embedded Software Engineer to join our European OEM solutions team based in Aachen, Germany. Our activity is the development of controller products for the heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration industry.

If this sounds like the next challenge for you, then join our team!

Your main responsibilities will be:
Developing control solutions by designing the architecture, coding, and testing software solutions on our embedded and programmable platforms
Taking a customer centric approach to understand needs and work out solutions
Follow the software development lifecycle

Our ideal candidate:
Holds a Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering focused on software development or similar
Solid programming experience in C or C++
Experience on Simulation and Model-Based Design is an advantage (MATLAB Simulink)
Has a good understanding of embedded system programming with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems (Linux)
Other languages like C# in Microsoft .NET environment is an asset
Worked with communication protocols like Modbus, CAN, TCP/IP, BLE
Adequate knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components
Has a strong customer oriented mindset
Demonstrates very good English language skills, both written and verbal (German and any other language is an asset)

job_title: Full Stack Engineer (Ruby on Rails) - Vice President
description:
About the job
iCapital is powering the world’s alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital services approximately $113 billion in global client assets invested in 942 funds, as of January 2022.

iCapital was named Solutions Provider of the Year at the 2020 MMI/Barron’s Industry Awards and selected to the 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021 Forbes FinTech 50, a list of the top 50 innovative financial technology companies that are transforming finance through technology.

About The Role

The Full Stack Engineer at iCapital Network will work end-to-end on new features, enhancements, and defect resolution on one or more of iCapital's software platforms. You will work closely with our Product Management team throughout the software development process, detailing requirements, reviewing work in progress, and addressing issues found via manual test efforts. You will be working with Ruby on Rails for back end and React for front end.

At iCapital, we value expertise in other programming languages and business areas. More than checking the boxes on specific technologies, we are looking for driven team members with technical depth and a desire to deliver end products for our clients. If you are not already familiar with the technologies used at iCapital, you will have the opportunity to pick up these new tools and technologies while on the job—with support from management and mentors.

Responsibilities

Backend feature development in Ruby (2.6.6) and Rails (3.x)
Frontend development in React and Redux
Unit and integration test development using RSpec, Cucumber, and Capybara
Active participation in daily stand up meetings
Active participation in Peer Code Reviews as part of our standard SDLC and Change Management Process

Qualifications

Degree in Software Engineering
10+ years of Full Stack, web-based application development
10+ years of development experience with Ruby on Rails. Python/Elixir would be a good substitute if less expertise on Ruby
10+ years of HTML / CSS development
Team management experience
Demonstrated understanding of relational database concepts and modeling practices
Passion for actively learning new technologies
Ability to work independently or as part of a group effort, as required
Solid problem solving abilities
Excellent communication skills
Collaborative approach to software development
Fluency in English and Portuguese required — written and verbal

Benefits

iCapital offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes a total compensation program consisting of competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and equity for all full-time employees; healthcare with 100% employer-paid health and dental insurance; and generous paid time off (PTO).

For additional information on iCapital Network, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc

About the job
More Than Just A Job, We Offer An Opportunity To Grow! Our project team is exploring to recruiting a Junior/Intern .NET Developer from European Countries and global candidates to build a future in Reiz Tech!

Reiz Tech is Expanding and Hiring Globally! Growth Is In Our DNA and We Will Help You Grow!

About The Role

We are sourcing a .NET developer (Junior/Intern) to work with our client to design, develop, and maintain software. The developer's role will be to produce code using the .NET Framework.

It's one of REIZ TECH internal projects.

Main Requirements

About the job
Job Description

Sales Development – Trainee (m/w/d)

(Vertriebsinnendienst 12-18 Monate als Vorbereitung für weitere Karriere im Innen- oder Außendienst)

Wir, die Cognex Corporation, sind weltweit führend im spannenden und wachsenden Bereich der Bildverarbeitung, in der Entwicklung von Industriekameras und Software für Identifikations- und Bildverarbeitungslösungen. Unsere Produkte sind wesentliche Bestandteile der Automatisierung von Produktionsprozessen, der Qualitätsüberwachung, der Digitalisierung von Logistikprozessen und vielem mehr.

Sie möchten einen ersten Eindruck von uns und unseren Produkten und Systemen gewinnen? Dann sehen Sie sich hier unser Firmenvideo an: https://jobs.cognex.com

Die Sales Trainees in Deutschland werden in drei Phasen in Karlsruhe (12-18 Monate) intensiv an Cognex-Produkten sowie unserem erfolgreichen Vertriebskonzeptes geschult. Sie lernen dadurch, die kaufmännischen wie die technischen Vorteile unserer Produkte richtig zu verstehen. Die Hauptaktivität besteht darin, unser CRM-System zu nutzen und proaktiv potenzielle Kunden zu identifizieren, zu kontaktieren und zu entwickeln, um Vor-Ort-Meetings für den Außendienst vorzubereiten. Die Aufgabe wird hauptsächlich am Telefon ausgeführt, man beantwortet einkommende Anfragen und ruft proaktiv potentielle Kunden an. Ziel des Trainee Programmes ist es, die Teilnehmer auf die Tätigkeit im Außendienst vorzubereiten, aber natürlich stehen bei Cognex darüber hinaus auch weitere Karrierewege offen.

Zum Ende der dritten Phase werden Sie verstärkt mit unserem engagierten Außendienstmitarbeitern Kunden vor Ort treffen, um deren Anforderungen und Bedürfnisse besser verstehen lernen. Somit wird gewährleistet, dass der Übergang in den Außendienst reibungslos erfolgt.

Als Mitglied im European Sales Development Team stehen Sie im engen Austausch mit ihren Sales Trainee Kollegen in anderen europäischen Ländern. Regelmäßige persönliche Veranstaltungen helfen die interkulturelle Beziehungen auszubauen und die Lerninhalte zu vertiefen.

Was suchen wir bei einem Kandidaten?

Interesse an Technik, Lernfähigkeit und Flexibilität

Wir arbeiten mit faszinierenden Produkten, die High-End-Kameras mit erstklassiger Software kombinieren. Sie werden viel über diese Themen lernen und solange Sie neugierig sind können auch Sie diese Welt erschließen.

Fließend Deutsch und gute Englischkenntnisse. Weitere Sprachkenntnisse sind von Vorteil.

Deutsch ist Ihre Arbeitssprache, aber da wir ein internationales Unternehmen sind, stehen Sie auch in engem Kontakt mit Ihren europäischen und amerikanischen Kollegen.

Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise

Der Job erfordert, mit Menschen zu sprechen, und Kommunikation ist die wichtigste Fähigkeit, die Sie in dieser Rolle benötigen: Freundlich und bestimmt, organisiert und flexibel, überzeugend und verbindlich.

Versierter Umgang mit MS Office

Sie werden natürlich viel mit unserem CRM arbeiten, aber Word, Excel und PowerPoint sollten Ihnen schon einmal begegnet sein.

Abschluss eines Studiums, einer kaufmännischen Schule, einer technischen Ausbildung oder ähnlichem.

Bei Ihrer Ausbildung sind wir flexibel, ein technischer oder kaufmännischer Hintergrund wäre natürlich von Vorteil.

Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Ein perfekter Job, um Ihre Karriere im technischen Vertrieb eines schnellwachsenden High-Tech Unternehmen zu starten.
Arbeitserfahrung in einem internationalen Team, das Spaß an der Arbeit hat.
Eine sichere und zukunftsorientierte Karriere.

job_title: Software Developer - PHP - Remote - Russian Speaking
description:
About the job
*Russian speaking candidates preferred

We are Threecolts! A leading software suite for Amazon businesses. We acquire, launch, and grow ecommerce software. We are well capitalized to be able to take our business to the next level. We are scaling quickly and have over 100 team members speaking 17 different languages in over 33 countries across 5 continents who all collaborate together to drive our passion for success.

We're building the tools for online commerce that help new businesses get started, expedite growth for existing companies, and empower sellers to reach new heights.

We are a completely remote team spread across the world, with a deep passion for making the web a more beautiful, usable, and reliable place.

About the job
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Physical Security Engineer.

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.

Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action!

Responsibilities

As a Physical Security Engineer your responsibilities are:

Security Policy and Standards
Deploy security technologies in accordance with established requirements, standards, deadlines, and applicable employment law and company policy.
Provide Subject Matter Expertise for security technologies and support high visibility needs of the business on a variety of special projects which often involve expedited deliverables, operational agility, and impact to operational functions.
Collaboration And Partner Experience
Collaborate with peer teams and organizations to ensure alignment with broader strategy and initiatives as well as full support of leadership priorities, focused on helping to reduce costs and complexity, and improve efficiency.
Provide strong partnership and trusted advice to evangelize and represent Microsoft’s datacenter physical security programs, where appropriate.
Manage regular site security system meetings with security operations and facility management teams where current site system health is reviewed, and coordination of services with internal and external service providers is handled.
Data-Driven Analysis and Improvement
Collect and maintain security system data to identify system health, performance trends, system configuration compliance, and recommend repeatable strategies to address issues at scale.
Continuously improve and mature the overall physical security program, including providing expertise on the continuing evolution of existing physical security processes and procedures that produce valid, trustworthy results, support the goals of the business, and remove as many subjective elements as possible.
Security Incident Response
Receive escalation notifications of physical security and business impacting incidents, triage and escalate as appropriate, ensuring leadership and peer teams are informed, and appropriate personnel are managing incident response effectively.
Monitoring and Detection
Manage physical security technologies and systems at Microsoft Datacenters, including physical access control, video surveillance, security networks, radio over internet protocol, key management, and entry systems.
Manage security system life cycle to maintain system health and compliance, including system triage, service escalation, and the oversight of the maintenance and repair performed by vendor support teams.
Other
Embody our culture and values.
Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
Experience in software development lifecycle, large-scale computing, modeling, cyber security, anomaly detection, Security Operations Center (SOC) detection, threat analytics, security incident and event management (SIEM), information technology (IT), and operations incident response.
OR Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong experience in software development lifecycle, large-scale computing, modeling, cyber security, and anomaly detection.
OR Master's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
Lenel Certifications, CISSP, CISA, CISM, SANS, GCIA, GCIH, OSCP, and/or Security+ certification.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Requirements

These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

About the job
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

BUSD is the top 2 regulated stablecoin that ranks 13th in the overall crypto market and 3rd among stablecoins by market cap. In less than two years since its debut, BUSD has become one of the fastest-growing cryptocurrencies while featuring a variety of utilities, from trading to lending and payment. BUSD has been listed by more than 420+ DeFi protocols 35+ Exchange, 27+Wallets, and with a 3.1+million holders and mass adoption strong ecosystem.Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world? It's the very first time we are expanding the agile team, to jump into a more interesting competition in a bigger market. If you're passionate, dedicated, desperate to join a leading tier of a professional narrative, and a fan of all things challenging, we'd love to hear from you!

What Experience You’ll Love To Have

Work in a rapidly growing team of best-in-class professionals to execute the regulated stablecoin into a scalable and reliable service
Build a leading blockchain company with a $10B market-proven valuation
Build creative microservices that support stablecoin business in these financial services including KYC, account management, payment and settlement, mint and redeem, deposit to earn, APIs, etc
Increase the leading insight and understanding of blockchain
Explore the stablecoin use case on centralized platforms (eg. exchanges, banks, card, and payment companies, etc) as well as decentralized blockchain ecosystems (eg. BNB Chain, Ethereum, Solona, Polkadot, Polygon, etc)

Responsibilities：

Lead the engineering team and collaborate with the product and business team to design, develop, test, and deliver the stablecoin platform and new features, across our Web and Mini program
Take complete end-to-end technical & engineering ownership of one or more applications/product features. Investigate and resolve technical issues
Take a hands-on role in influencing and guiding day-to-day development activities by leading architecture decisions, participating in designs, design review, code review, and implementation
Creatively deliver the integration of the existing features, exchange services, and bank/payment channel services
Build publicly accessible APIs that make it smart, secure, and fast for institutions and counterparties to integrate with KYC, payment, and settlement systems
Extending the stablecoin service based on the mass adoption requirement, to deliver a better user experience process and services.

Preferred qualifications:

5+ years of full-time software engineering experience. Strong plus if has stablecoin, exchanges, payment service, APIs experience. Fluency in English
Experienced in developing web-based applications and microservices using Javascript/ Typescript/Golang and others. (We don't expect everyone to be an expert in all of these, and everyone has their specialties, but the more platforms you're comfortable with, the faster we can move.)
Capable to code with stress and independently, excellent organizing and planning skills
Strong leadership, have experience leading engineering teams and driving large-scale projects and products, in collaboration with product, design, and commercial teams, to succeed, to be able to lead a team of young/ambitious developers
Strong understanding of system performance and scaling. Independent enough to make important technical decisions on your own.
