About the job
Our Client

Our client are actively expanding their operations all across the globe including Germany, US, UK and other areas in Europe. Our client portfolio encompasses companies like Tencent, RUIJIE, Alibaba and they are one of the largest infrastructure suppliers to data centre.

Responsibilities

Handling enterprise users' server issue report or enquiries via phone call, Email and instant messaging tool, etc. including ticket logging, progress tracking, ticket updating(adding logs) and ticket closure according to the client's requirement；
Handling the client's service partner onsite engineers' enquiry and issue report via instant messaging tool, such as DingTalk, RocketChat, WeChat, etc including ticket logging, ticket progress tracking, ticket content update and ticket closure according to the client's requirement.
Assisting new hire or junior level (L1) technical support engineer's enquiry of troubleshooting steps and(or) solution and helping with any other things necessary for solving enterprise user dor onsite engineers' issue reported;
Assisting the team to meet requirement of the SLAs in phone call, email and chat responding, issue solving rate, correct and accurate enquiry answer rate, customer satisfaction, case status tracking or any other SLA requirement Inspur expects for;
To play an important and model role in English/German team to help build up a good team work spirit and to help develop team to be a professional technical support team.

Requirements

Bachelor degree or above with computer science, automation, mechatronic or other engineering related majors is preferred;
Over 1 year's experience in server technical support, especially in server or PC hardware operation or maintenance work;
Familiar with Linux, Windows Server and other major server operating systems;
Candidate must be able to understand English. Candidate who is able to converse in German or Russian is a plus.
Flexibility a plus

Benefits/Salary

Direct employment with our client, form of employment B2B

Paid Vacation (24 days)

Other Benefits To Be Agreed.

Salary 10 000 - 15 000 PLN / month (depending on experience)

About the job
About Polar Analytics

Polar Analytics is a Full-Stack Business Intelligence Solution for Consumer Brands. A powerful, yet simple solution for business users to get the insights they need to succeed and make the right decisions.

Our mission is to empower indie DTC brands worldwide to grow faster and more profitably!

Growth @ Polar Analytics

Getting Stuff Done, Ownership, Excellence, and Agility.

At Polar, the Growth team has a lot of impact by ensuring that we build the best engine to allow the company to scale.

We're a tech-driven team, always experimenting with new no-code and codes. We're doing more with fewer people (we’ll be only 2 to start) by automating everything and monitoring each signals from our leads while maintaining a high level of quality. Our priority is to think scientifically, while also being creative, about how to help sales and Polar grow.

You should join us if you want to be part of this exciting adventure and help build the most innovative growth stack.

Why this role?

As a Growth Engineer, you will have a direct impact on Polar's growth. You will be

putting technology at the service of business growth by working with a large technical

stack to solve very real problems. You will:
Build an exciting and innovative growth engine from scratch: You will have the opportunity to work with a large technical stack to solve real business problems and develop solutions that help the company grow. By building a robust and effective growth engine, you will help establish Polar as a leader in the eCommerce industry and drive the company's success.
Be the first growth engineer and pillar of the future growth team: you will play a critical role in developing the team's strategy, processes, and tools, and you will work closely with other teams, such as marketing, sales, and product, to ensure that the growth engine aligns with the overall business objectives.
Make a maximum impact on the entire company: by developing a robust and effective growth engine, you will attract more potential customers to the brand, increase brand awareness and loyalty, and drive conversions and revenue. Your work will also help establish Polar as a leader in the eCommerce industry, which will enhance its reputation and credibility.

What’s the scope?
Building our engine and all the Growth tools from scratch: you will play a crucial role in developing Polar's growth engine and the suite of tools required to support it. You will work with a wide range of technologies, including web frameworks, databases, cloud infrastructure, and more. This will involve collaborating with other members of the engineering team, as well as stakeholders from marketing and sales, to ensure that the tools you build meet their needs and can be integrated seamlessly into the broader Polar tech stack.
Make the important data accessible to the marketing and sales teams: one of the key functions of the growth engine will be to collect, process, and analyse data from a variety of sources in order to inform marketing and sales decisions. As the Growth Engineer, you will need to ensure that this data is easily accessible and understandable to the relevant teams. This may involve developing custom dashboards, visualisations, or other tools to help stakeholders interpret complex data sets.
Be in charge of the Engineering roadmap of the Marketing Team: as the first growth engineer at Polar, you will have the opportunity to shape the future direction of the company's growth engine.
Have an impact at each stage of the funnel: The growth engineer will be responsible for driving growth across the entire marketing and sales funnel, from lead generation to customer retention.

The job is made for you if...
You have a strong interest in business and marketing issues
Experience building complex Growth Stack from scratch
You already work in a fast-growing environment
Experience working with non-developers
OK to have weeks that are different from each other

Company Perks & Benefits
🌎 Remote-first organisation with a culture built around impact rather than hours
🏖 5 weeks of vacation
💰 Competitive salary & equity (our compensation philosophy targets 60th - 80th percentile in the top 3 European tech markets)
💻 Latest MacBook Pro or equivalent
🩺 Complimentary private health insurance (we use Alan)
😍 Every quarter we organize a company-wide offsite to discuss where we're going and strengthen the social bonds

job_title: MIddle Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

description:
About the job
Water is arguably the most important resource in the world and yet the industry is notoriously slow at innovating and adopting new technologies that allow them to easily automate endless hours of non-productive admin work from skilled workers. The cost of water is rising as an aging workforce is unable to adapt and multi-million dollar infrastructure decisions are being made without the best data. Our mission is about making water better, and it starts with the professionals at the nexus of all water decisions in a community. Klir will be the operating system for water and we have started on that journey by building the first work enablement platform for water. It’s designed to reduce the burden of administration so the experts can dedicate their precious time to solving a critical problem for our species.

Founded originally in Dublin, Ireland in 2018, Klir is a US Headquartered company with offices in the US, Canada and Ireland. Klir is a remote first company and is one of the fastest growing, SaaS companies in the water industry. We are venture backed by some of the highest profile and most reputable funds including Insight Partners, Bowery Capital & Spider Capital.

Location: This position is fully remote.

Role Description

We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer that can help us build compelling insights and visualizations, supporting informed decisions about water.

The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for building visualizations, reports and dashboards that provide insight and perspective to the challenges of water system management. As part of our engineering team, you will work with data from multiple sources to create front end dashboards and reporting visualizations for our product. You have a strong eye for great design, and focus on how to unlock meaning and value from data.

This is an opportunity for the right candidate to make the jump into a product-focussed engineering team, collaborating on a high-performance agile team. Most BI developers are hidden within marketing, finance or consulting organizations. Working closely with support from front-end, mobile and full stack software engineers, this role can upshift a career in data engineer or data science, and provide our team with subject-matter expertise and thought leadership on environmental and operational data.

Responsibilities:

Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:
Implement solutions using Microsoft Power BI tool suite and related technologies
Leverage product and end-user data marts, schemas and models needed for monitoring, compliance and operational analysis and/or reporting and visualization
Perform data analysis that will support and enhance product features
Develop reports, dashboards & scorecards, data exploration and visual analytics
Work independently or as part of a team to design and develop solutions
Build proof of concept examples and break down requested design into clearly defined and manageable work items.
Prioritize and track progress on work items and test completed deliverables to ensure effective deployment and usability.
Act as an innovative problem-solver in aspects of Power BI best practices and recommend technical solutions and options that meet reporting and data visualization related requirements

Requirements:

Essential

Experience with Azure
Effective verbal and written communication in English.
Minimum of 5+ years of experience in utilizing Power BI and exposure to other business intelligence tools like Tableau or Looker
Experience with data preparation, data validation and data quality projects
Experience writing performant, effective SQL with SQLServer or MySQL databases
Portfolio of high impact data visualization work
Knowledge of SSRS, DAX and SSIS family of technologies related to Power BI
Experience with SSIS and other data transformation tools
Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, with a broad base of knowledge in the areas of technology and communications
Work in GMT -4 timezone hours

Desirable:
Proficiency with test management tools like Azure DevOps or JIRA
Experience working in an agile software development team.
Experience in an early-stage start up or proven track record operating in earliest stages of a product.
Knowledge of Javascript, HTML and CSS preferred. Work with responsive or mobile a plus.

Personal attributes:
Active Listener
Builds Relationships
Scrum Values
Data driven
Design sensibility
Follows Processes
Time Management
Meets Commitments

The ideal candidate:
You thrive equally in strategy and execution. You are inventive and resourceful and can turn your ideas quickly into implementations. We move fast, but we are smart about it.
You are entrepreneurial at heart, but methodical in your approach.
You love to learn about your craft and your own personal development.
You get a rush when you’re super busy and getting a lot done. You get a super rush when your efforts land a win.
You would rather just try a new idea than spend days talking about it.
You believe in collaboration and enjoy adding value and getting value by engaging with every department that touches the customer experience.
You’re probably your own toughest critic and have an internal drive to succeed and help others do the same. You never want to be the weak link, but the strongest.
You are passionate about water and ensuring that the developed world has enough safe and secure water needed to sustain our species for generations to come.

Our Commitment To You
We remunerate you well with competitive salary and benefits for your market. Our thesis is in order to operate at your best you can't be worrying about your quality of life at home.
We commit that you have an opportunity to use your talents to leave a factual lasting legacy for our species for generations to come.
By working with a Y Combinator market leading company, we commit that you have an opportunity to challenge yourself to be the best you can be.
We commit to give you the opportunity to work in a team that understands life is far too important to take seriously. Obviously, we are doing a crucial job but we have fun while doing it.
We commit to giving you the opportunity to work with a group of people that value honesty and audaciousness, that stand up straight & stick together no matter what and aspire to be the difference between good and great.
We commit to doing our best to make you successful. The leaders sense of purpose is to help you to be the best version of yourself. We achieve this with fearless feedback, focus on growth and transparency.

About the job
Job Title: Software Engineer

Location: EU (Hungary / Poland / Czech) (Remote)

Job Type: Long Term Contract

Your Responsibilities

As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for contributing effectively to projects by preparing and getting agreement on designs and hands-on software development. You will ensure that decisions related to your area of responsibility are taken promptly and effectively. Your responsibilities will include:
To analyse requirements, perform impact analysis, Application / Component design, build and unit test the code.
Conducting analyses, designing, preparing code reviews, estimating tasks, and developing software
Carry out Peer Reviews to ensure that quality goals are met around project deliverables.
Proactively Identify risks / issues & communicate.
Handling technical issues and resolutions
Reporting and involving management in case of high severity issues
Communicating and reporting status actively to a varied audience
Support implementation activities.
Work with suppliers / vendors on designated areas
Enable technical knowledge sharing across team

Skills You Need

Front-End
Web fundamentals like HTML 5, JavaScript, and CSS
CSS preprocessors like Sass or LESS
JavaScript frameworks with strong exposure to React.js, Redux and JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and Bower
Libraries like jQuery or Backbone.js
Front-end (CSS) frameworks like Foundation or Bootstrap
AJAX
Back-End
API design and development
CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
RESTful Services
Web fundamentals like HTML 5, JavaScript, and CSS
Server-side languages like Java and JavaScript
Database technologies like Oracle with good exposure to PL/SQL.
Web server technologies like Node.js, J2EE, Apache, Nginx, ISS, etc.
Frameworks related to their server-side language of choice like: Express.js, Ruby on Rails, CakePHP, etc.

job_title: Data Engineer | Python, Airflow, Aws | Scale up de production de vidéos | Paris ou full remote
company_name: Octopus IT - Expert du recrutement tech
description:
About the job
La société

Créée en 2016, cette start-up en hyper-croissance révolutionne la création et l'optimisation de contenu vidéos pour les réseaux sociaux.

Après une ascension fulgurante elle s’est rapidement imposée comme l’un des créateurs et distributeurs de contenus vidéo les plus dynamiques et créatifs de sa génération. Leur technologie d’optimisation entraîne une croissance massive de l’audience sociale des créateurs et génère de nouvelles sources de revenus tout en amplifiant la monétisation.

Avec 1000 collaborateurs répartis à travers le monde (Europe + US), ils sont à l’origine de 10 des plus grands créateurs de réseaux sociaux et collabore avec plus de 500 créateurs influents comme Fabien Olicard, MrBeast, Bailey Sarian etc.

Pour faire simple leur solution optimise, exploite et distribue du contenu vidéo créé par des créateurs sur Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok et YouTube.

Au sein de l'équipe tech ils sont environ 200 personnes.

Pour poursuivre leur croissance et leur internationalisation, nous recherchons plusieurs Data Engineer pour intégrer leur équipe Data et participer au renouvellement de leur architecture data.

Le poste

Intégré au sein de l'équipe infra composée d'une douzaine de personnes dont 5 Data Engineers et 5 Cloud Engineers, votre rôle sera de :

Participer au renouvellement de leur infra
Mettre en production des Model Ml
Mettre en place des librairies Python facilitant le travail des Data Scientists
Développer et optimiser des pipelines de données complexes
Monitorer la plateforme d'exécution des jobs Data.
Code a refactorer
Améliorer les process et la stack technique data (migration vers une solution full dockerisée, mise en place d'un framework de calcul distribué)

La stack actuelle

Ingestion : Fivetran
Data warehouse: Snowflake
Analytics: Metabase for self-service, Tableau for advanced reports
Backend : Python / Rust / NodeJs / Express.Js
Hébergement : AWS
Données : Redshift, Kinesis Stream, Kinesis Firehose, Aurora Mysql, ElasticSearch, ElasticCache-Redis, S3, Glue, Athena, etc.
Orchestration de jobs : Airflow
Automatisation: Terraform & Ansible
CI/CD : Gitlab

Votre profil

Une expérience minimum 3 ans au sein de startup ou scale up
Très bonnes compétences sur un orchestrateur de jobs
Vous savez créer des pipelines de donnée
Bonnes connaissances en Python, Sql et sur le cloud

Le salaire & avantages

50-65 K€ selon expérience
Full remote possible France et Europe
Mutuelle ALAN
Pass Navigo / Billets d'avion
Petit déj d'équipe et Team building

Et plus encore…

Ce qu’on préfère

Être impliqué à fond dans une aventure avec de nombreux challenges techniques
Très bonne ambiance, équipe solidaire et orientée partage d’informations
Beaucoup de workshops en interne
Un CTO expérimenté

About the job
Project Description
Our client develops innovative solutions, which are geared towards its customers' requirements in terms of performance, efficiency and investment reliability. Covering markets like Transportation, Energy, Oil&Gas, Manufacturing, our client has become the leader in data communication and automation systems offering high quality, high availability line of industrial networking devices and systems. Our projects are including the full cycle of software development, for the entire line of products: starting with BSP and driver development for new HW components, OS integration (both Linux and VxWorks), feature development and integration (L2-L3 Ethernet-based communication protocols or Industrial Protocols), bug fixing and support ending with manual or automated testing using an internal in-house developed framework. Runs on cutting-edge HW platforms designed in-house using the newest technologies from Broadcom, all the software is developed under Agile methodology using a modern continuous integration approach. The local team consists of 65 members organized in 7 Scrum teams. Each team can either take the responsibility of an entire release, including management or work with several teams to the same product line or software release.
Responsibilities
Feature developing and bug fixing for Client's Industrial Switches Platform family
Skills
Must have
- Experience in embedded software development, preferably for network equipment
- Experience with C programming on VxWorks/Linux/Unix environments
- Experience with cross compilers, debuggers, etc.
- Good understanding of Ethernet and IP networking
- Familiarity with git
- Knowledge of RTOS application development (VxWorks / NetBSD / Linux)
- Understanding multi-process system software architectures
- Experience with one or more of the following: POSIX threads, SNMP, XML
- Shell Scripting
Nice to have
-Agile/Scrum experience
Languages
English: B1 Intermediate
Seniority
Regular

About the job

Job Description & Summary
The ServiceNow Application Portfolio Management team supports the PwC global territories, by enhancing and managing the ServiceNow platform in support of the company's Business application strategy. We are a global team that supports innovative technology to reduce operating costs, manage risk, and maximize the value of the APM service to the firm.


As a ServiceNow Developer, you will,

Engage with stakeholders to understand user stories and determine requirements
Provide guidance on what is configuration vs customization with a focus on solutions that remain as close to out of box functionality as possible.
Customize and develop ServiceNow applications and support rollout of new applications and modules.
Configure Application UIs and Workflows
Demonstrate understanding of application modules including Incident, Problem, Change, Release, Asset, CMDB, Knowledge, and Self-service Portal.
Create custom reports and dashboards with supporting metrics and KPIs that adhere to best practices and have a high focus on impact to instance performance
Collaborate with other ServiceNow administrators and developers to develop effectively with a global focus
Be diligent in maintaining consistency in code alignment across instances and in clean code in update sets
Proactively identify system deficiencies in the ServiceNow instances and provide solutions to remediate
Ensure that configuration is consistent across development, testing, and production environments.


The Candidate

We are looking for the following experience and skills:

3+ years of experience working in a development role for a ServiceNow Platform
2+ years of experience as a ServiceNow administrator
Preferred experience with ServiceNow CSDM (Common Services Data Model) as well as Application Portfolio Management or Strategic Portfolio Management
Experience in transitioning technology from locally focused to centralized technology service organization.
Experience with ITSM functions and modules within ServiceNow
Understanding of RESTful Web Service and APIs.
IT and Security management best practice (ITIL, COBIT, ISO standards).
Experience developing workflows and supporting service technology teams
Experience in developing solutions in JavaScript and Glide



Desired Certifications:

ITIL Foundations Certification
ServiceNow Developer Certification(s)



Essential Skills:

Conceptual skills
Ability to articulate and document the desired business outcome
Ability to remove ambiguity from requirements
Service orientation with a focus on quality and customer satisfaction
Unit and regression testing to strive for first time right deployments
Troubleshooting and Diagnostics
Conceptual skills
Communication skills (verbal and written)

About the job
Ort / Branche

Remote - IT-Dienstleistung

Du willst selbst bestimmen wie Dein Arbeitsalltag aussieht?

Dann bist Du bei Cegeka genau richtig: Du bestimmst selbst, wie Du Dich strukturierst. Unsere Projekte, Kunden und Mitarbeiter sind sehr vielfältig, es bleibt also immer spannend. Wir unterstützen Dich in allen Belangen – ohne ständiges Controlling Deiner täglichen Arbeit.

Unser Ziel: Dich zu inspirieren, denn wir blicken gerne über den Tellerrand hinaus. Wer weiß, vielleicht hast Du Dein volles Potenzial noch nicht entfalten können?! Bei Cegeka sind Dir keine Grenzen gesetzt!

Unsere DNA: Aspire to more! Ganz ehrlich, Diensthandy, Laptop und moderner Arbeitsplatz – das ist eigentlich selbstverständlich. Viel wichtiger dabei: Deine Work-Life-Balance solltest Du bei allem Erfolg nicht aus den Augen verlieren, deshalb sind flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice ein must-have!

Beginn / Dauer

Jederzeit und unbefristet in remote

Aufgaben
Design, Modellierung, Implementierung und Dokumentation von komplexen Softwarelösungen.
API-Design für einfache und flexible Schnittstellenbeschreibungen.
Betreuung innovativer Kundenlösungen und Unterstützung bei technischen und fachlichen Fragestellungen.

Qualifikation
Du bist im Front- und Backend mit den gänigen Technologien vertraut.
Du hast mehrere Jahre praktische Erfahrung als (Senior-) Entwickler mit Java, sowie idealerweise mit aktuellen Frameworks.
Du bringst mehrjährige Berufspraxis in der Softwareentwicklung mit.
Du kennst das agile Arbeiten.
Ausserdem sprichst Du fließendes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.

Unser Angebot
Langfristig denken: Dich erwartet ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit spannenden Aufgaben.
Arbeitszeitkonto: Bei uns machst Du garantiert keine unbezahlten Überstunden.
Flexibilität: Ein dynamisches Team und eine flexible Arbeitsumgebung mit modernsten Technologien.
Individuelle Entwicklung: Regelmäßige Fortbildungen und Zertifizierungen, damit Du immer up-to-date bist.
Kommunikation: Eine ausgeprägte Open-Door-Mentalität für neue Ideen.
Weitsicht: Eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge, weil wir auch an Deine Zukunft denken.
Danke sagen: Attraktive Prämienprogramme für gute Arbeit, gute Ideen und Deine eigenen Projekte.
Nimm Dein Büro mit – egal wann: Unser Equipment ist modern und Du bestimmst, wo Du arbeitest.
Vertrauen ist uns wichtig: Arbeite, wenn Du kreativ bist – nicht, wenn Du musst. Gleitzeit ohne Kernarbeitszeiten!
Nice to have: Ständig verfügbare Power-ups für Deine Leistungsfähigkeit: Kaffee, Tee, Wasser, Softdrinks und frisches Obst auf unsere Kosten.

Kontakt

Cegeka Deutschland GmbH

Matthias Gabriel

Martin-Behaim-Straße 22

63263 Neu-Isenburg

Email matthias.gabriel@cegeka.com

Wir möchten Dich selbstverständlich auch in Corona-Zeiten persönlich kennenlernen. Aber uns liegen die Gesundheit und das Wohlergehen aller sehr am Herzen. Daher möchten wir Dir hier unsere wichtigsten Regeln im Rahmen des Bewerbungsprozesses nennen.

job_title: Embedded Software Developer for DCDC Converters Job
description:
About the job
Who We Are

In our Embedded Technologies department, we are focusing on client projects in the Automotive sector. The top-class services we provide consist mostly of software development and testing solutions for products such as Instrument Clusters and Head-up Displays, Control Units, Active and Passive Safety Systems (with a particular focus on Advanced Radar Systems) or even Low Level Drivers.

We are a friendly and distinguished community where colleagues are empowered to act, can choose their future development path and are great team players that truly care about the work they do in the industry.

What You'll Be Doing

Create and update Basic SW configuration by using specific tools (DaVinci)
Implement SW Components needed for DCDC power transfer using Embedded C
Develop according to MISRA rules, correct deviations after static code analysis is performed
Create and update SW Requirements

What You'll Bring Along

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field
Min 2-3 years of experience in an Embedded SW development position
Able to work independently in a structured and process oriented way
Good knowledge of Microcontrollers, Drivers, Sensors, Communication/Diagnostics Protocols (CAN, UDS), OBD, Motor control, Bootloaders
Knowledge of Rhapsody and AUTOSAR (Vector solution preferred) is considered a plus
Good communication skills and proactiveness in communication with different stakeholders
Good written and oral skills in English

Document

What’s In It For You

✔ New beginnings can be a challenge. We promise a smooth integration and a supportive mentor

✔ Pick your working style: choose from Remote, Hybrid or Office work opportunities

✔ Early bird or night owl? Our projects have different working hours to suit your needs

✔ Nobody is born an expert. Sharpen your tech skills with our sponsored certifications, trainings and top e-learning platforms

✔ We want you to stay healthy! Enjoy our Private Health Insurance ⁠– it’s custom-made for you

✔ A clear mind is a healthy mind. Attend individual coaching sessions or go one step further by joining our accredited Coaching School

✔ Make the most of our epic parties or themed events – they’re lovingly designed for our people and their families

NTT DATA Romania is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants regardless to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees.

Should you have any queries, we are happy to hear from you at ro.start.career@nttdata.com. Not the job for you? Perhaps you have a friend who would be a perfect fit. Send them this link!

About the job
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do
Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

About the job
Think of multi-billion record data sets. Waiting to provide game-changing insight for the betting industry. Add a spice called real-time data ingestion. Now think of building insights reports that change the game for internal users and show them immediately what they need. Managing reporting needs, creating complex visualizations, and embedding them within the operations platform. All to bring the biggest impact and seamless user experience. Sounds interesting?

We're looking for someone who:
Has solid experience with analyzing large samples of data - SQL is a plus
Have experience in creating reports and visualizations within BI tools (Tableau, Power BI…)
Knows how to visualize the data so that the end-user can immediately see what the visualization is about
Has "a thing" for improving customer experience and sharing knowledge and insights from data
Knows how to squeeze information from business users to find out the last detail about their needs

Bonus points if you are:
Familiar with the betting industry and some specifics
Familiar with Tableau

What you'll be doing:
Creating reports in top-end tools in order to have an easy overview of the product
Easing up the life of trading and operation teams by providing insights and not just data
Communicating with product owners and understand the product's long-term vision and where the process can be optimized by proper insight ingestion within the platform
Communicating with other data analysts and data engineers in order to prioritize new data acquisition, but also to share and get knowledge about other parts of the data ecosystem
Taking over complex tasks, introduce new technologies and influence changes in data architecture, and negotiate data model design,...

Buscamos profesionales que tengan motivación por crecer y desarrollar una carrera profesional en el area de Big Data. Formarás parte de un equipo multidisciplinar, donde trabajarás en proyectos estables y punteros, acompañados de un plan de carrera personalizado y horario flexible.

About the job
Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do
Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who You Are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

About the job
Presentación de la compañía

Fossil is on a mission to create great watches, jewelry, handbags, small leather goods and wearables by investing in technology and long-term value creation. We do this by living into our core values - Authenticity, Grit, Curiosity, Humor, and Impact - each and every day, continually powered by purpose and our people. We thrive on diversity, innovation, uniqueness, and inclusion. Will you join us?

Detalles del empleo

If you have a passion for data analysis and helping improve the quality of data that business users depend on to make decisions, then this may be the role for you. Working for a dynamic and global company, you will be supporting the Fossil Group Analytics team in their quest to be data driven and customer-centric.

You Will Be Expected To

Take responsibility for measuring and managing data quality for systems used throughout the enterprise
Champion data quality and data standardization best practices
Be a key part of the team that defines data management best practices and strategy
Educate the organization on existing data assets and how they can be used
Perform data exploration, analysis, and stewardship activities
Catalog new and existing data sources
Support data governance efforts to establish and enforce guidelines for data collection, integration, and data management
Collaborate with business users, IT staff and data scientists
Required Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or a related area
3+ years of experience and high level of SQL language proficiency
2+ years of experience in architecting, developing or QA database systems
2+ years of experience in data analysis with strong data quality background
Good understanding of extracting data from relational, dimensional database systems, CSV or XML files
Significant data analysis and DQ assessment experience
Experience using FTP, SFTP & SSH to move data between platforms
Demonstrated competence in multiple data analysis techniques and tools
Understanding of data protection and classification rules and methods
Analytical and naturally curious mind
Excellent communication skills, including written and verbal proficiency in English
Preferred:

Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or a related area will be highly valued
Experience working with multiple database platforms such as BigQuery, Netezza, DB2, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle
Experience working with Data Quality and/or Data Catalog tools like Informatica, Ataccama, etc. will be highly valued
Experience using APIs to pull data from various sources
Customer data analysis experience, especially retail
Hands-on experience with one or more common data integration tools such as DataStage, Informatica, Azure Data Factory, BODS, Alteryx or SAP PO
Experience visualizing data through tools like Tableau, Google DataStudio or Power BI
Experience using tools such as Postman, WS FTP, MOVEit
Python or similar programming language experience
Experience working with Agile and Waterfall methodologies
Experience with Salesforce products such as Commerce Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Service Cloud
Exposure to CDPs such as Segment or Amperity
Why Analytics at Fossil?

Come be part of a unique, creative fashion company, known for its style, friendliness, humor, and fun! Help lead the company’s transformation into a data driven modern retail and digital powerhouse. We are hiring the best analytical talent to transform the company from a traditional retailer to an omnichannel, insights driven company over the next 5 years. Top data scientists, digital analysts, data engineers and market researchers are coming together to produce insights that will transform the way people buy, sell, and make products. As part of the Global Analytics Team, you will work with some of the best minds in the business, recruited from the top universities in the world. You will sit at the intersection of technology and retail, bringing the two industries together with innovative solutions that work at scale. You will be inspired by experienced industry leaders and work on open-source platforms in the fast-paced, diverse environment that is Fossil. Our Analytics Team has won industry awards that recognize the cutting edge quality of our work from the American Marketing Association and the Association of National Advertisers.

At Fossil, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in all employment practices without regard to age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion, sex and sexual orientation.

Life is Short, Work Somewhere Awesome

Full Time

Departamento

Global Analytics

About the job
At Prima we are revolutionizing the insurance world, starting with two fundamental pillars: data and the technology to harness it.
The speed and dynamism of the industry in which we operate requires us to continually make real-time decisions, such as pricing coverage for a specific user or the need for a fraud check for a reported claim. Almost all of these decisions are made automatically by dynamic systems and artificial intelligence engines that estimate the probability of future events and define the best possible action for Prima and its customers.

As a Data Scientist you will aim to teach our platform to make the best decisions in a variety of different contexts and, in general, to extract as much value as possible from our data assets. Your work will directly impact the growth and sustainability of our company, contributing to the achievement of our strategic goals.
At Prima you will find the right environment to grow, learning a lot from colleagues and having the opportunity to make your mark. You will quickly gain operational autonomy and full recognition for your efforts.

Requirements
You are our ideal candidate if you meet these requirements:

Excellent academic achievements
You have earned a master or doctoral degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering Mathematics, Engineering Physics, Statistics. No prior work experience is necessary, we will invest in your talent and education.

Quantitative, logical and analytical skills
You quickly master very complex topics, whatever the field. You have great attention to detail and can intuit and model the mathematical dynamics that drive the phenomena around you, grasping the cause and effect relationships between the forces at work. In Prima you will find stimulating and varied challenges that will test all your skills.

Curiosity, passion and pragmatism
You take a critical look at the world around you and always ask "why?" You think about how to improve things and fight to realize your ideas. You have a practical result-oriented spirit and can identify the most effective way to achieve it. We will encourage you to pursue common goals in an original and innovative way, advancing your ideas and proactively generating value.

In addition to the basic requirements, we will pay special attention to these characteristics:
You have had international experience and speak fluent English
You have a solid foundation in programming and algorithm implementation, especially machine learning
You know how to create and manipulate datasets using data mining languages (such as MySQL or Redshift)

Research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn't align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!
Benefits
We will give you everything you need to express your talents and work at your best:
Innovative, informal environment
State-of-the-art devices and tools
Ongoing training (internal and external)
Welfare plan and company benefits
Team building events
We will evaluate salary and duration at the interview stage to ensure you receive an offer that matches your experience and expertise.
Working hours are Full Time and our contracts are regulated by the CCNL of Commerce.
Our office is in Piazzale Loreto 17, 20131 Milano (MI), but we also consider Full Remote hiring from other European countries and for our offices in Rome, London and Madrid.
-
Prima offers equal employment opportunities and is oriented toward diversity and inclusion in the workplace. The company prohibits discrimination of any kind based on race, color, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

About the job
Webentwickler C# (m/w/d) überwiegend remote



Unser Kunde ist seit über 70 Jahren ein Familienunternehmen und einer der führenden Fachverlage Deutschlands. Mit Hauptsitz in Herne und aktuell 280 Mitarbeitern ist das Unternehmen im Aufbau des internen agilen IT-Teams. Unterstützen Sie das interne Entwicklungsteam in Herne als „Webentwickler C# (m/w/d) überwiegend remote" in Vollzeit, unbefristeter Festanstellung und in der Direktvermittlung!

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie:

Konzipierung und Weiterentwicklung der Kundenplattform auf Webbasis von ASP.NET und Visual Studio
Kontinuierlicher Ausbau der Systeme, Einsetzen neuer Ideen als aktiver Impuls- und Inputgeber, keine langweilige Maintenance-Arbeit
Ganzheitliche Beteiligung am Entwicklungsprozess - von der Anforderungsanalyse und Implementierung bis zur technischen Dokumentation und Prüfung


Was Sie mitbringen:

Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Webentwicklung mit C#, ASP.NET, Visual Studio (offen auch für Quereinsteiger, Studium etc. ist kein Muss, Hauptsache praktische Berufserfahrung vorhanden)
Vertraut in der agilen Arbeitsweise
Fließende Deutschkenntnisse erforderlich


Hiervon profitieren Sie:

Unbefristete und krisensichere Festanstellung in einer familiären Atmosphäre
Attraktive Vergütung nach Tarifgehalt mit 13,5 Gehälter bis zu 70.000 € p. a.
36 Stunden/Woche, flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie überwiegend remote möglich (ob 1x in der Woche vor Ort oder alle paar Wochen vor Ort flexibel einteilbar)
Flache Hierarchien sowie kurze Entscheidungswege
Duz-Kultur mit viel Wertschätzung, hauseigener Feelgood-Manager, der die Benefits stetig ausweitet und modernisiert
Möglichkeit eigene Ideen einzubringen und selbstständig zu arbeiten
Spannende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten durch regelmäßige Fort- und Weiterbildungen und Wachstum des Teams, sodass man mittelfristig sich in Richtung Teamlead von aktuell 4 Leuten entwickeln kann
Weitere Benefits, wie berufliche Altersvorsorge, strukturierter Einarbeitungsplan, E-Bike-Leasing Möglichkeit, E-Tankstelle vor der Tür, Zuschüsse für Gesundheitsleistungen Bahnticket etc.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann bewerben Sie sich unter Angabe der Referenznummer 118968 per E-Mail mit Ihrem aktuellen Lebenslauf (ohne Anschreiben). Ihre Ansprechpartnerin für diese Position ist Frau Kim (hee-jin.kim@goodmanmasson.de).

About the job
Sweep is hiring a Software Engineer In Test to work on our enterprise climate programme software.

Climate change is the defining issue of our time. By empowering companies with technology that helps them manage their climate impact, we believe Sweep can make a meaningful contribution to a better future for all of us.

Ok, sounds promising. What will I be doing?

As part of the engineering team, you will work on ensuring the best quality of our SaaS tool that allows companies to measure and track their greenhouse gas emissions, set reduction goals and report on progress towards a cleaner future. You will also work on the Sweep marketplace that allows companies to make contributions to cutting edge climate solutions.

To be more specific, this includes:
Build for quality 🔍
Implement and improve quality assurance tools, standards and procedures
Create detailed and comprehensive test plans and cases
Write and maintain automatic tests (Cypress, Rails, Jest)
Be a team citizen 👫
Participate actively in the team meetings (standup, planning, etc)
Stand as a quality gate keeper of your team
Collaborate on the technical design of significant features
Keep an eye on things 👀
Monitor, document and track bugs
Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

That sounds just right for me. What do I need to bring?

Glad you asked. This is who we're looking for:

Qualifications 🏆
Proven work experience in Saas quality assurance
Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
Experience with agile development methodologies
Excellent technical knowledge in JavaScript and Ruby
Proficiency with command line tools and unix/linux environments
Familiarity with with AWS cloud services

Qualities 🧠
You value quality over quantity
You have a passion for solving problems, developing the solutions and building products
You are enthusiastic, self motivated and autonomous
You bring all-round communication skills and an ability to work collaboratively
You are a team player
You care about our mission of creating a better future for all of us

Copy that. And what's in it for me?

You will be joining an exciting young business that wants to change the world. With a proven track record in starting companies, we're hitting the ground running and aim to have an impact fast. Joining this journey allows you to grow with us, own your role, and really help shape our path.

You will join a dynamic team of engineers, business minds, creatives and carbon experts spread across Europe and beyond. We're a fun bunch of people that want to work hard and enjoy ourselves while doing so. We believe in creating a calm environment that knows that life is not just work, and we'll all be doing better work because of that.

We're big believers in creating successful businesses that are good for everyone, including society and the planet. That's why we're an "Entreprise à Mission" and a Certified B Corp.

We think this might be the ride of our lives. And hopefully yours, too.

About the job
This engineering role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development, you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.

The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across five engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are deployed to millions of machines worldwide.

The first area of responsibility is centered around security. We develop and operate Ubuntu Pro and Livepatch backend services that support the authentication, authorization, and delivery of Extended Security Maintenance (ESM) at scale to a wide range of devices spanning from individual systems to large enterprise fleets running in cloud environments.

On the distributed systems front, we develop an open source identity manager Candid and a Juju multi-controller manager JIMM (Juju Intelligent Model Manager), that enables organizations to centrally manage operations across many Juju controllers deployed to public, private, and hybrid clouds. The majority of our systems are deployed to Kubernetes clusters.

The third major area is related to internal business operations. We develop and operate a data warehouse, including data ingestion pipelines, that are relied on by operations and data analytics teams. In addition to that, we help internal business units to automate processes across many software solutions and integrate SaaS solutions to ensure a smooth flow of data.

Lastly, we have a dedicated team of Salesforce engineers and administrators who take care of our Salesforce implementation and integration crucial to our sales and business operations. This team configures Salesforce and implements business processes that facilitate efficient operations.

We are looking for new colleagues with strong background in Go or Python, who have the drive and energy to deliver and operate solutions at scale with the highest engineering quality, continuously develop their skills, and work with us on defining the future of open source.

We expect you to have
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related engineering field.
Experience as a software developer in a high-level language - preferably Go or Python.
Experience building, deploying, and operating distributed systems and APIs.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders, remain highly motivated, productive, and organized in a fully remote environment.
Ability to travel to international destinations for one week at a time, approximately 2-4 times per year. Locations prior to the global pandemic included New York, Seattle, London, Cape Town, Budapest, Berlin, Montreal, and Brussels.

Nice to have
Experience developing and deploying for Ubuntu Linux in public clouds.
Experience integrating authentication & authorization, financial, public cloud or marketplace systems.
Experience with Salesforce development/integration or APEX.

We offer
Learning and Development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel
Flexible working option

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Experiencia en el desarrollo de pipelines de datos, desarrollo de ETLs, frameworks de orquestación

About the job
LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a Conversational AI company creating digital experiences that are Curiously Human. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview:

We are looking for an experienced Cloud Engineer to work with our engineering team to Design, implement, optimize, and maintain cloud-based solutions. You will be responsible for Design deploying and debugging Cloud native solutions that will ensure smooth transition from On-Prem Environments to the cloud, educating teams on new cloud initiatives, and ensuring the security of the cloud infrastructure.

To be successful as a Cloud Engineer, you should be able to identify the most optimal cloud-based solutions for our On-Prem environment and maintain cloud infrastructures in accordance with best practices and company security policies. A top-notch cloud engineer should have excellent troubleshooting skills, stay current with industry trends, and should be a team player.

You will:
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modifying and improving existing systems.
Educating teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Designing, developing and deploying modular cloud-based systems.
Developing and maintaining cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensuring efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions in accordance with company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identifying, analyzing, and resolving infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly reviewing existing systems and making recommendations for improvements.

You have:
At least 3 years of experience in the field of cloud computing.
Azure, AWS, and GCP certifications preferred.
Experience using DevOps tools in a cloud environment, such as Ansible, Artifactory, Docker, Gitlab, Github, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Cloudformation.
Must Have Solid scripting skills (e.g., shell scripts, Python, Powershell)
Troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Good communication and collaboration skills.

Benefits:
Health: medical, mental, dental, and vision
Time away: vacation, dependent care, holidays, wellness days, and more
Family: parental leave, maternity support, fertility services
Development: tuition reimbursement, native AI learning
Additional: 24/7 access to professional counselors, voluntary ins. coverage, exclusive perks and discounts

Why you'll love working here:

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

Belonging at LivePerson

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.
