About the job
Security Joes is a cyber security firm specialized in Incident Response and MDR services, sided with a unique and proprietary enrichment technology hidden in its chambers. The company was established by world-renowned security researchers to first and foremost generate resilience against highly complex cyberwarfare incidents. Based out of Israel, we are now a house for best-of-breed incident responders and malware analysts from all over the world!
Joining us will give you the opportunity to work with high-end clients in some of the most interesting industries out there. While our entire staff is working from home, we are all close and get the chance to meet at security conferences and company events around the world.
About the Role:
As a SecDevOps Engineer you will be helping us choose our DevOps technical stack which will make our work faster and more efficient, utilizing state-of-the-art tools along-side researching for new innovative techniques. You will implement automation, effective monitoring, and infrastructure-as-code. Join our research team in further developing our infrastructure, along with internal proprietary technologies that boosts our detection and prevention capabilities on top of commercial products. It will also become your privilege to inspire and promote DevSecOps culture and train research teams about secure development and secure SDLC in cloud environments.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field
At least 5 years of experience in security and DevOps
Strong knowledge of cloud computing platforms, such as AWS or Azure
Experience with DevOps tools, such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet
Experience with containerization technologies, such as Docker or Kubernetes
Experience with scripting languages, such as Python or Bash
Strong knowledge of security concepts, including threat modeling, encryption, and access controls
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to display roadmaps and plans to senior management of the company

About the job
DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent, and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally.

Currently, we are looking for:
Junior Big Data Platform Specialist

Job location: hybrid (Warsaw) or remote (Poland)
The successful candidate will be part of a growing Data Analytics delivery Team located in Poland, focusing on various DB, ETL, and Big Data technologies. Providing projects and services to international customers, clients, and teams from France, the UK, the US, Germany, the Philippines, India, and other parts of the world. He/she will participate in end-to-end project implementations delivered in a dynamic and young environment that encourages innovative solutions.

Main Tasks Will Be:
Using the latest technologies ensure successful data delivery for customer's data scientist and analytics
Continuously improve platform effectiveness and implement cost cutting solutions
Reacting on customer changing expectations and needs adapting solutions accordingly, setup variation of them or develop new ones
Taking needed actions on occurring events disruptive expecting results and planned processes
Ensuring Big Data Hadoop/Cloud platform can effectively meet performance & SLA requirements

We require:
at least 12 months of relevant experience (IT industry)
good Unix/Linux skills
aware of public cloud platform concepts – AWS, Azure, or GCP
fundamentals of networking
solid problem solving and analytical skills
strong focus on teamwork
eagerness to learn
adaptability to changes
good command of English and Polish

We appreciate:
Hadoop,
Kafka,
Ansible,
Kubernetes,
GitHub,
ITIL framework,
Python,
JIRA

We offer:
full-time employment contract with a compensation package, adjusted to your experience and qualifications.
package of social benefits, including medical care, Multisport, relax corner, sport communities, technical and soft skill training, life insurance and many others.
training and certifications opportunities provided by our DXC Partners: Microsoft, AWS, Google
opportunity to be a part of fast-growing, innovative, and high-performing within a multicultural organization.
challenging projects, clear career path, and professional training opportunities enabling personal development and growth.
friendly atmosphere, independence, and flexible working hours

Don't miss the opportunity to develop your professional career with us!

About the job
Docker is a remote first company with employees across Europe and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We continued to see exponential revenue growth last year. Join us for a whale of a ride!

At Docker, we simplify the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. Docker helps developers bring their ideas to reality by conquering the complexity of app development using containers and collaboration tools. The Environments team develops and maintains the popular open source Docker Compose project which is used and loved by millions of developers. They are also working on collaboration tools like Docker Dev Environments to help developers work together in teams.

The successful candidate is comfortable working with product managers and designers to develop, maintain and evolve product features. They have experience working on or contributing to open source projects. They are constantly seeking ways to improve the reliability and monitoring of product releases as well as CI/CD workflows to ensure they maintain a high level of quality.

Responsibilities:
Enhance and maintain open source code bases
Develop our new products
Interact with other teams within Docker, as well as with upstream open source communities and our users

Qualifications:
2+ years of professional software development experience using Golang, Python, C, C++, or Rust
Good verbal and written English communication skills
Experience using version control tools like Git
Experience using a CI system like GitHub Actions

What to expect in the first 30 days
Meet the team
Understand the team mission
Start diving into a part of the code base
Ship a small change

What to expect in the first 90 days
Feel comfortable in a part of the code base
Meet people across the company
Ship a more major change
Demo something you worked on at the internal Product Development demos

What to expect in the first year
Have autonomy/ownership over an area (level dependent)
Help shape the direction of Compose and Dev Environments (level dependent)
Work with other teams at Docker on delivering an end to end feature

Perks:
Freedom & flexibility; fit your work around your life
Variety of virtual and in-person social events to build connections and have fun
Home office setup; we want you comfortable while you work
Generous maternity and parental leave
Technology stipend equivalent to $100 net/month
PTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoy
Whaleness Days: companywide day off each month
Quarterly, company-wide hackathons
Training stipend for conferences, courses and classes
Stock Options; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the company
Docker Swag
Medical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by country

Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

EU Salary Ranges by Country

Germany - €75,000 - €100,000

UK - £64,000 - £86,000

Netherlands - €72,000 - €98,000

France - €63,000 - €85,000

Spain/Portugal - €48,000 EUR - €64,000

Poland - zł253,000 - zł343,000
Salary range can change depending on level

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

About the job
Canonical is seeking experienced Python developers to build the world's best open source portfolio of integrated, secure and reliable software to the telecommunications industry. Work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.

Experience in the telco field is desirable but not required. Bring your experience with Python, Linux and Kubernetes to help us transform the future of network orchestration and automation.

Help the growing engineering team at Canonical bring the cutting edge of open source software into the telecommunications sector. As an engineer on the team, you'll bring significant software development experience, public cloud and Kubernetes experience and a keen eye for software design and architecture.

You will be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in "hackfest" events, webinars and conferences.

What you'll do
Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
Write high quality Python code following best practices to create new features
Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
Review code produced by other engineers
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Participate in community events such as "hackfests" and "webinars"
Work from home with global travel 6 to 8 weeks for internal and external events

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

About the job
Enartia is looking for a Technical Support Representative. The best candidate should be passionate, highly motivated, familiar/expert with web hosting, and ambitious about a career in customer service and technical support. This person will join the Support Team, in-house or remotely, in order to enhance the quality of support offered to Enartia’s customers.

job_title: Arquitecto de datos, especializado en Elasticsearch (100% remoto)
description:
About the job
🚀 ¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo!

Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer con más de 30.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 30 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías.

🔎 ¿Qué buscamos?
Para colaborar en diversos de nuestro cliente, estamos buscando un Arquitecto de datos, especializado en Elasticsearch.
Se incorporará como arquitecto de Datos especialista en Elasticsearch, y formará parte de un equipo para el desarrollo de un proyecto en una gran cuenta de referencia del sector asegurador.
La duración de la colaboración es de 5 meses, con posibilidad de ampliación.
Colaboración 100% remota desde cualquier provincia de España.

📧 Funciones:
Implantar Elasticsearch como base de datos central para la indexación y explotación de grandes volúmenes de logs (100 Gb/día).

Será el responsable de:
Arquitectura y diseño de la solución.
Diseño del modelo de datos (índices, shards, etc.)
Configuración de Elastic Search en todos los entornos.
Pruebas de carga y estrés de Elastic para asegurar que el rendimiento es el esperado en producción.

💡 Requisitos mínimos:
3-4 años de experiencia en el diseño de modelos de datos e índices y sharding.
2-3 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de pipelines de ingesta.
1-2 años de experiencia en la optimización del rendimiento de Elasticsearch.
Conocimientos de seguridad de Elasticsearch.

🎩 Requisitos deseados:
Diseño de arquitecturas de ingesta de datos desde orígenes hasta Elasticsearch.
Desarrollo de planes de pruebas de tolerancia a fallos, carga y estrés.
Despliegue de Elasticsearch en entornos cloud.

💰 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?
-✈️ 23 días laborables de vacaciones y el 24 y 31 de diciembre.
-❤️ Numerosos beneficios sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al teletrabajo, seguro de vida y seguro de accidentes).
-🍴 Programa de Retribución Flexible (tarjeta comida, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online, seguro médico para tu familia…).
-🎓 Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación.
-🚀 Estabilidad y carrera profesional.
-🚶 Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas.
-🔗 Posibilidad de elección de percibir tu salario en 12 o 14 pagas.
-🏡 Medidas de conciliación (horario flexible, teletrabajo, asesoramiento de especialistas (psicólogo, nutricionista, entrenador personal), jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano según proyecto).
-🎁 Plataforma UST Club descuentos y descuentos en gimnasios.

📧 Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición ¡Te estamos esperando!

About the job
Kehittäjä/ Integraatioasiantuntija

Front AI Oy on vahvasti kasvava ja kansainvälistyvä yhtiö, jonka palveluksessa on yli 20 henkilöä Suomessa, Ruotsissa ja Tanskassa. Olemme alan premium-toimittaja tekoälyn käytössä asiakaspalvelun tukena. Toimitamme asiakkaille ratkaisuja tukeutuen sekä omiin että muiden kehittämiin teknologioihin.

Haemme nyt joukkoomme kehittäjää/integraatioasiantuntijaa. Kehittäjän roolissa työskentelet Front AI:n omien tuotteiden parissa, joilla valloitamme maailman. Integraatioasiantuntijan roolissa varmistat, että toimittamamme ratkaisun eri palaset keskustelevat keskenään järkevästi, luotettavasti ja ylläpidettävästi. Ennen kaikkea olet IT-alan generalisti, joka tarttuu pelotta mihin tahansa tehtävään ja opiskelee sen, mitä ei vielä osaa.

Teknologiatiimimme on vielä pieni, mutta kasvussa, ja meillä pääset myös vaikuttamaan siihen, miten töitä tehdään. Tavoitteenamme on rento ja avoin työympäristö, jossa sekä yksilöiden että tiimin kehitykseen panostetaan.

Työpaikkana voit käyttää toimistoamme Ruoholahdessa, mutta töitä on myös mahdollista tehdä vaikka 100 % etänä.

Haemme ensisijaisesti henkilöä, jolla on jo muutaman vuoden työkokemus. Tästä voidaan joustaa, jos sinulla on tarpeeksi muuta näyttöä osaamisesta kuten omia projekteja.

Mitä odotamme sinulta:
• Soveltuva IT-alan tutkinto tai vastaava määrä käytännön kokemusta
• Kokemusta B2B-asiakasrajapinnassa toimimisesta
• Sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa

Tärkeimmät teknologiset osa-alueet, joiden parissa teet töitä:
• Node.js
• AWS, Azure
• Web-devaus

Jos sinulta löytyy osaamista, voit päästä työskentelemään myös näiden parissa:
• DevOps, CI/CD
• React
• Web-maailman lait ja standardit (GDPR, saavutettavuus yms.)
• UI/UX suunnittelu

Yleistä:
• Etätyö/Hybridityö Helsingissä
• Työaika joustava
• Kattavat työsuhde-edut
• Vakituinen työsuhde
Kiinnostuitko?
Voit lähettää hakemuksesi ja CV:si palkkatoivomuksineen sähköpostiin techjobs@front.ai. Paikka täytetään heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä, joten älä aikaile! Lisätietoja tehtävästä saat laittamalla meiliä CTO Tomi Päiväniemelle, tomi.paivaniemi@front.ai.

Tunnetko henkilön, jota tämä voisi kiinnostaa? Meillä on tilaa useammalle työntekijälle, joten voit vapaasti jakaa tämän verkostosi kanssa!

About the job
🚀 Who we are?

Founded in 2013, Housecall Pro helps home service professionals (Pros) streamline every aspect of their business. With easy-to-use tools for scheduling, dispatching, payments, and more, Housecall Pro enables Pros to save time, grow profitably, and provide best-in-class service.

Housecall Pro’s brand portfolio includes BuildBook, construction management software for builders and remodelers, and CONQUER, a business coaching solution for home services businesses. Our brands are united by a singular mission to champion our Pros to success.

We support more than 25,000 businesses and have over 1,000 ambitious, mission-driven, genuinely fun-loving employees across the United States and all over the world (including Poland 🇵🇱).

If you want to do work that impacts real people, supported by a team that will invest in you every step of the way, we’d love to hear from you.

Compensation: 5 000 - 7 000 USD (B2B)

🚀 We Also Offer
Flexible time off policy (26 days doesn’t have to be a limit)
Flexible work hours
Equity shares in a rapidly growing company backed by top-tier VCs
A culture built on innovation that values big ideas
Working in Central European Time
Newest MacBook + Setup Fee ($500)
🚀 The Role

We’re looking for a Product Manager to help us build products that make our home services professionals more successful. As a Product person at Housecall Pro, you will be empowered, along with your Designer and Engineering Manager, to Think (identify strategic opportunities), Explore (craft elegant and simple solutions), Plan (set and communicate timing), Build (execute on your ideas), and Launch & Learn (measure and iterate quickly).

Our Product people deeply know our customers through in-depth primary research, our industry through competitive and market research, and our business through data analysis. As a Product person at HCP, you will have significant leadership responsibility not only within your area of the product, but also through collaborating across the business. By joining our team, you will be signing up to grow personally and professionally through our robust coaching program and will be responsible for helping others grow as well.

The essence of a Product person at Housecall Pro is someone with curiosity, emotional intelligence, who wants to make an impact, is really smart, with an internal engine that drives them, is adaptable, is decisive, and is nice to spend time with.

🚀 Joining Housecall Pro Means
Building a product that really improves users’ lives (70k users, 4.6 rates at App Store) - 🎥 learn more about how we help our users!;
Being a part of the Polish team of product builders, who put the highest priority on the user experience;
Being in direct contact with the community of users, who are eager to share their feedback;
Working with a mature, interdisciplinary dev team (almost 100% of the Polish squad are seniors);
Having a real impact on product decisions and strategy;
You are committed to your work, open to feedback, and eager to share your knowledge, just like us - 🎥 learn more about the Housecall Pro culture!
🚀 Your Responsibilities As a Product Manager
Develop deep knowledge of our customer, industry, and business
Think . Place all work in the strategic framework for the product org and HCP overall, understand risks, use data to inform conclusions
Conduct in-depth interviews, surveys, and competitor research
Analyze customer and business data
Write and present strategy and product 1-Pager documents
Explore . With the triad (PM, Designer, Eng Mgr), develop and validate compelling solutions to the problems/opportunities in their product area
Support Product Designers with good design instincts and clear thinking
Co-Create Event Models and user flows
Collaborate with Design and Eng Manager to develop wireframes
Collaborate to conduct user testing to validate solutions
Plan . Effectively plan how to go from idea to delivered product and communicate that plan to others
Create, update, and communicate roadmap
Plan day-to-day operations of the product team
Build . With the triad (PM, PD, Eng Mgr), drive the execution of building features and functionality by doing whatever is needed to keep momentum going
Launch & Learn . Work collaboratively cross-functionally (e.g., Analytics, Product Marketing, Front-line teams) to pull together everything needed to effectively launch the product, measure it, learn, and iterate quickly improve the product
Create measurement plans to monitor feature adoption and usage
Co-Create go to market plans and collaborate with Marketing to execute them
Rapidly develop post-launch product iterations
🚀 Join Us If You Have
4+ years of experience in product management in SaaS companies
Aptitude or previous experience managing other Product Managers
Deep understanding of Product Management processes
Experience in highly performing product organization
🚀 Additional Assets Will Be
Passionate about working and partnering with product design to create delightful user experiences
Demonstrated ability to be resourceful, innovative and creative
Has had success launching impactful product features to customers
Experience with redesign/rebrand or impactful product release with customer migration
This role is open to candidates inside Poland. The specific salary for the successful candidate will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills and experience.

Housecall Pro celebrates diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.

About the job
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is the 3rd most-cited and 6th largest research publisher and we publish groundbreaking discoveries by the world's top experts.

Scientists empower society and our mission is to accelerate scientific discovery by making science open. We place the researcher at the center of everything we do and enable the research community to develop the solutions we need to live healthy lives on a healthy planet.

Join the publishing revolution.

About The Role

The Audience Strategy team is seeking strong Data Analysts with an interest in commercial/ marketing insights and a strong background in (social) data science to understand, build and optimise our growth strategies and support the marketing automation effort across the company.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in allowing us to create value from our different data sets, by way of in-depth analysis of marketing data, visualisation of results, segmenting and understanding our audiences so we can tailor the perfect experience to them.

You will be turning data into actionable insights according to business and marketing requirements, analyzing customer behaviour, touch points and providing integrated dashboards. All while ensuring data quality to provide improvement to business processes and impact decision-making.

What You Will Be Doing
Work with data streams to bring in the needed data and insights to our CRM and our campaigns.
Query our database to create new audience segments and coordinate with the journey team to create customer journeys for them.
Implement and optimize CRM audience segmentation for growth.
Define and conceptualise scoring and tagging systems.
Work with the Marketing Automation teams to build successful campaigns and create a seamless researcher experience.
Manage data analysis and reporting of our marketing automation and CRM integrations.
Support measurement and campaign effectiveness, generating audience insights using closed-loop reporting between our marketing automation platform, data reporting tool and Salesforce.
Monitor the performance (dashboards and publishing monitoring KPIs), forecast performance through predictive analytics, and recommend remedial actions through prescriptive analytics.
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, defining measurement requirements.

About You

Must haves:
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a data analytics, business intelligence or similar role, ideally working on marketing projects.
Experience building audiences for retargeting, nurturing and growth.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL (BigQuery) and working with large data sets.
Expert knowledge of Tableau and other data visualisation tools, preferably in the Salesforce ecosystem.
Strong understanding of the marketing tech stack (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CDP, Pardot, Google 360, Advertising Studio…).
Strong understanding of how databases work, types of data, types of relations…
High level of personal initiative and very good strategic and analytical skills.
Excellent communications skills and ability to simplify advanced statistical concepts for a layman audience.
Ability to produce clear and concise data-driven reports and presentations.
Ability to liaise with data engineers.
Fluency in verbal and written English.

Preferable:
Desirable 3+ years of experience working with digital marketing data and marketing automation platforms (Pardot, Marketing Cloud, Advertising Studio).
Basic experience with data sources integration with Salesforce Customer Data Platform.
Basic knowledge of Saleswings and Google Analytics 360 for behavioural analysis.
Working knowledge of integration and data flow between marketing systems and Salesforce.
Working knowledge of APIs, data connectors, and other pipelines.
Experience in marketing operations for technology products.
Data modelling capability with large data sets leveraging an established BI solution (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, CRM Analytics).
Certified in Einstein Analytics is a nice to have.

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

About the job
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, and web services at scale. We are building the next generation management solution for Ubuntu in the enterprise - on premise and on the public cloud - to enable large estate observability, telemetry, security, compliance and operations. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Landscape is the leading management tool to deploy, monitor and manage fleets of Ubuntu systems, including package and repository management, health and security monitoring, hardware inventory, and automation. As Landscape software engineer you will be responsible for contributing on a distributed development team participating in all facets of the development process.

What you'll do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high-quality code to create new features, fix bugs and modernize the Landscape codebase
Demonstrate your strong commitment to code quality and automated testing
Participate in the engineering process with code and architectural reviews
Take personal ownership of problems and design and deliver solutions
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
Assist with release management during each development cycle
Collaborate with devops for Landscape SaaS, Canonical's hosted Landscape

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python.
Experience with Python and web frameworks such as Flask and Django.
Experience with databases, and ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus)
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

#stack

About the job
The Role

We are looking for a virtual PMO Group Leader that will be part of the management team of the Solera Global Project Management Office (PMO) and lead a team of project management professionals that will specifically have a focus on projects related to products that Solera markets to its clientele internationally (i.e., outside of North America). The team that this individual will manage may act in traditional project and portfolio management roles and will be comprised of individual of varying levels of experience and seniority in this field. The projects that they will manage will consist largely of technology projects that include a heavy emphasis on all aspects of a software development lifecycle in an agile development environment. In this role, the PMO Group Leader will be responsible for assignment of staff to projects requiring PMO support at any given time, and as such providing the best match of skillsets within the team with the needs of each project and balancing workloads of the team to optimize utilization of staff. In addition, the PMO Group Leader will establish a hierarchical project management structure that will facilitate multiple levels of project status reporting and issue escalation including, at minimum, project, portfolio, and group level. As such it is critical that the PMO Group Leader is highly skilled, experienced, and competent in acting in a group-level oversight role of multiple project portfolios and thus can act in an effective role of oversight, advisement, selective intervention to assist in issue resolution where needed, and as a final point of escalation of issues within the group to attempt to resolve with escalation further up the management chain only on rare occasion when necessary. These job requirements necessitate an individual with several years of successful hand-on experience in managing projects consisting of varying business needs, technologies, stakeholders, levels of complexity, and problem-solving. The PMO Group Leader will require a history of competency and accomplishment in the exact roles of the team members, as they will depend on their manager for expert-level guidance, direction, advisement, and support in successfully managing their own projects. The PMO Group Leader’s overall mission is to manage a group that consistently demonstrates and is reputable in an ability to deliver critical projects of various types, meeting business expectations, and most importantly successfully delivering the intended and expected results, with solid communication and transparency every step of the way.

What You’ll Do
Assume administrative leadership of a group of project management professionals
Drive standard processes, tool usage, and best practices for consistency and reliability of project delivery from group that conforms to corporate-level standards that are propagated globally across Solera
Be part of a PMO management team that is charged with competency, consistency, precision, & success of project delivery on a global scale across Solera
Be able to speak in a thorough, substantive, and accurate manner about the projects under the group’s management responsibility and serve as an effective point of communication of status, as well as escalation of issues to leadership outside the group as needed
Act as an effective backstop for issue resolution and problem-solving related to projects under management responsibility of the group, ensuring that escalations beyond the group on only on rare occasion – the PMO Group Leader should be able to advise, direct, and assist as needed to resolve the majority of issues that are raised for any given project
Collaborate with other PMO leadership to formulate new processes, reengineer existing ones, as well as define and propagate best practices and standard procedures related to project management across Solera
Collaborate with other PMO leadership as needed to establish an effective management model for PMO resource sharing and cross-utilization, as well as resource accountability not only to their direct manager but also a dotted line to their stakeholders (e.g., portfolio managers, product managers, etc.)
Act as a point of escalation for stakeholders regarding any projects within the management responsibility of the group
Serve in administrative management capacity to team members, collaborating and advising them in career planning and management, as well as performance evaluations, and recognition of accomplishments

What You’ll Bring
Bachelor's degree (BS/BA) in a related field of study; Masters in a related field is a plus
10+ years experience of project, program, and project portfolio management experience, particularly in software and information technology in a wide breadth of size & complexity
5+ years experience in the design & definition of project management processes, procedures, and standard practices for an organization
5+ years experience in an agile development environment
5+ years of industry-standard tool usage related to project management and agile development
PMP Certification preferred; agile methodology certification is a plus

Demonstrated ability to:
Be results driven – period – and manage your team to be the same
Communicate effectively and transparently in a clear and concise manner with colleagues, direct reports, and all levels of management
Be collaborative in nature with employees, management peers, customers, stakeholders, and all levels of management
Be oriented toward making clear agreements in every aspect of the job, with employees, management, peers, and stakeholders
Create structure where this is none and articulate and establish it in an effective manner so it is recognized and adopted
Lead the team and teach them how to effectively lead – not chase – their projects
Base decisions and judgments strictly on facts – not conjecture, supposition, or hearsay – and perform the legwork to get the facts needed for every situation
Resolve conflict or disagreement among team members, peers, management, stakeholders in a respectful fashion and with the perspectives in mind of not just yourself but of all those involved
Be proactive in problem-solving; treating risk management as the key to minimal problems, obstacles, & blockers that can occur in project execution and teach the team to think and to act in that fashion and modeling the behavior for them
Be accountable, trustworthy, direct, and objective in fulfillment of job expectations, deliverables, performance, and results of the team that they are in charge of
Be able to operate and thrive in an environment that is challenging and can change frequently with aggressive objectives to meet and complex problems to overcome
Manage employees in a fair, consistent, transparent, objective, and constructive fashion, with a genuine interest and investment in their success and career growth, as well as the benefit of your years of experience and insight
Be process oriented and recognize the importance of standardization for repeatability, consistency, and maturity of our project management capabilities across the organization
Be calm and collected under pressure, and as a result keep your employees also calm and collected
Be a team player and have the company’s and its employees success as the main underlying goal driving your actions and leadership

About the job
About Us

GKN Aerospace is the world’s leading multi-technology tier 1 aerospace supplier. With 38 manufacturing locations in 12 countries, we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers. We design and manufacture innovative smart aerospace systems and components. Our technologies are used in aircraft ranging from the most used single aisle aircraft and the largest passenger planes in the world to business jets and the world’s advanced 5th generation fighter aircraft.

About The Opportunity

GKN Aerospace is a global engineering business. Every time you travel by air almost anywhere in the world, it is likely that GKN is helping you on your way. We design, manufacture and service systems and components for original equipment manufacturers around the world. We are continuously evolving, pioneering new technologies and reinventing existing ones, stretching ourselves to be better in everything we do.

We are looking for people who want to make a difference, talented members with the skills and passions to become the best of the future in what they do.

Job Summary

The Program manager is responsible for the execution of the business case and contract in line with requirements and the agreed scope.

Supports the Program Director with NPI activities up to and including Lifecycle Gate 7 and with on-going management activities of the program from Lifecycle Gate 7 and beyond. Supports the Program Director with Change Control Board activities.

Job Responsibilities

Supports the execution of the program (including changes) to comply with all the business case and contractual requirements for their products.

Responsible for continuously monitoring the performance of the allocated programs, managing off-track items and for reporting progress through the PPS.

Creates Program Improvement Plans including cost improvement, pricing initiatives, enable Zero Defects Manufacturing, redesign initiatives, gaining agreement with relevant stakeholders.
Provides input to make, move, buy decisions and strategic procurement decisions.
Supports the PD / VP in defining the vision, strategy, budget for the program to optimize cash flow, profitability and growth.
Adheres to all program management standards and policies in accordance with the GKN Aerospace Program Management framework and contribute to process development.
Actively executes Risk, Issue and Opportunity Management to control and mitigate the risk exposure and take advantage of opportunities.
Responsible for planning and performance of Life Cycle Gate, including preceding Reviews.
Responsible for updating Sales / Demand Plan and initiating demand management for serial purchase orders.

Job Qualifications

Has the ability to create, manage and execute a project plan.

Has strong communication skills and the ability to achieve by influencing others.

Experience in commercial, engineering or operations within the Aerospace industry.
Ability to build relationships with customers and other external stakeholders.
Financial acumen and understanding of the business models within Aerospace.
Either completed or registered for acknowledged Program Management Certification.

Whats in it for you?

Besides an innovative and international work environment that offers you a good work-life balance

We offer you opportunities to learn and grow, a competitive salary (Grade M/N) pension plan, 29 vacation days / 13 ADV days and travel allowance (from 10 km single journey) as well.

How To Apply

Are you interested in this position and does your background meet the requirements? Please use the Apply Now button.

Questions? Please contact our Recruiter Mark Streep on mark.streep@fokker.com.

Diversity Inclusion and Belonging (DIB)

As a global engineering company, innovation is what differentiates us from our competitors and is central to our success.

A balance of cultures, ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN. We need people of different backgrounds, with different skills and perspectives to spark originality, imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world.

GKN is an equal opportunity employer.

We treat all our employees and applicants fairly and are committed to ensuring that there is no discrimination or harassment against any employee or qualified applicant on the grounds of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

About the job
Aufgaben
Entwicklung von automatisierten End to End Tests in unserer agilen Softwareentwicklung
Entwicklung von webbasierten Frontend-Tests in JavaScript
Durchführung von technischen Aufwandsschätzungen für Testumsetzungen in unseren Scrum-Teams
Dokumentation der Testergebnisse und Nachverfolgung der Fehlerberichte
Integration von Produktspezifikationen in Testszenarien
Durchführung manueller Tests nach Bedarf
Das Bringen Sie Mit
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (angewandte) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung in der Testautomatisierung und in der Entwicklung von webbasierten Frontend-Tests
Know-How im Bereich der Softwareentwicklung und im Umgang mit JavaScript, C#, HTML und CSS
Sicherer Umgang mit Ticketsystemen
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mindestens C1)
Das Erwartet Sie
Für Sie - sicherer Arbeitsplatz in einem zukunftsstarken mittelständischen Unternehmen
Für die Begeisterung - abwechslungsreiche und interessante Tätigkeiten mit eigenen Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten
Für Wissensdurst und Tatendrang - individuelle Fort- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Für die persönliche Balance - flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, auch in Teilzeit mit Homeofficemöglichkeit
Für Anerkennung - attraktive, leistungsbezogene Vergütung und Treuebonus
Für die Sicherheit - betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Für das gute Gefühl - angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre mit flachen Hierarchien, kostenfreier Parkplatz (Hasselfelde), Feedbackkultur, familiäre Atmosphäre, einem sympathischen Team und viel frischer Luft
Die RR Software GmbH ist ein dynamisch wachsendes Unternehmen mit mehr als 60 Mitarbeitenden, das seinen Kunden maßgeschneiderte Softwarelösungen für das Bildungsmanagement anbietet. Unser Erfolgsprodukt ANTRAGO nutzen Hochschulen, Seminaranbieter und Bildungseinrichtungen in Deutschland und Österreich.

Verstärken Sie unser Team und sichern durch den Einsatz von individuellen und standardisieren Testwerkzeugen die Qualität unserer Softwareentwicklung.

Unsere Firmenphilosophie ist auf eine dauerhafte und partnerschaftliche Zusammenarbeit mit Mitarbeitenden und Kunden ausgerichtet. Wir planen langfristig mit Ihnen!

Sie sind neugierig sowie aufgeschlossen für neue Webtechnologien und möchten unser Team mit innovativen Ideen und Konzepten bereichern? Dann senden Sie uns Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Angaben zum möglichen Eintrittsdatum sowie zu Ihren Gehaltsvorstellungen.

Mit der Zusendung Ihrer Bewerbungsunterlagen geben Sie uns Ihre Einwilligung, diese und die darin enthaltenen personenbezogenen Daten zum Zwecke der Bearbeitung Ihrer Bewerbung zu verarbeiten.

About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
[CRS.CTECH – Electronics – Grow It] At UL, we know why we come to work. Na UL, nós sabemos porque viemos para o trabalho diariamente. Milhares de nós ao redor do mundo acordamos todos os dias com um propósito em comum: tornar o mundo um lugar mais seguro e sustentável. A ciência está em nosso DNA; nós somos infinitamente curiosos e apaixonados para procurar e falar a verdade. Nos sentimos felizes em saber que nosso trabalho oferece contribuições que tem importância para a sociedade, e temos orgulho em ter uma cultura centrada na integridade, colaboração, inclusão e excelência. A UL está à frente do avanço tecnológico e continuamente nos desafiamos a adotar novos caminhos de incentivo a inovação e a mudança positiva. Satisfatório? Sim. Emocionante? Com certeza! What you’ll learn & achieve: Desenvolvedor de Software Junior

100% Remoto terá a oportunidade de trabalhar em times ágeis, e fazer parte da equipe de desenvolvimento. Estamos a procura de candidatos com sólida experiência com desenvolvimento (front end e back end usando JAVA , Spring , Angular, Mysql ), boas práticas de programação visando manter uma alta qualidade do código. As principais atividades:
Participar das cerimónias ageis (exemplo: daily, refiniment, planning, review... )
Participar do refinamento das histórias e identificar as regras do negócio
Atuar suportando as aplicações existentes e desenvolvendo novas features
Fazer estimativa das histórias
Eventualmente possuir contato com clientes para levantar as necessidades do produto/serviços e propor soluções What makes you a great fit: Requisitos Básicos
Superior Completo preferencialmente Engenharia da Computação, Ciência da computação, Análise de sistemas e outros
Inglês Avançado/Fluente pois atuará com times internacionais
Minímo de 2 anos de experiência em desenvolvimento de software
Experiencia comprovada com conhecimento JAVA , Spring , Mysql
Conhecimento de design patterns, clean code, SOLID
Experiência em Angular é um diferencial
Experiência / vivência com metodologias ágeis é um diferencial
Conhecimento em arquitetura de projetos é diferencial
Experiencia com cloud é diferencial What you’ll experience working at UL:
Missão: Para a UL, responsabilidade social e corporativa não é algo novo. Fazer do mundo um lugar mais seguro e sustentável tem sido nosso modelo de negócio por 125 anos e está enraizado em tudo o que fazemos.
Pessoas: Pergunte a qualquer colaborador(a) da UL o que ele(a) mais ama sobre trabalhar aqui. Você sempre irá ouvir: “as pessoas”. Ir além do que é possível

é padrão na UL. Nós somos capazes de entregar o melhor porque contratamos os melhores.

Trabalho interessante: Todos os dias, vivenciamos algo diferente aqui e estamos ansiosamente antecipando a próxima inovação que nossos clientes desenvolvem. Nós somos inspirados a iniciar desafios que irão transformar como as pessoas vivem, trabalham e se divertem. Como uma empresa global, em diferentes posições, você terá a oportunidade de vivenciar uma experiência internacional, trabalhando com colegas de diferentes países do mundo.
Crescimento: Nós aprendemos, trabalhamos e crescemos juntos, tendo programas direcionados para desenvolvimento, recompensa e reconhecimento, além de nossa própria Universidade UL, que oferece extensos programas de treinamento para colaboradores em todas as etapas, incluindo uma faixa de treinamento técnico para as funções aplicáveis
Total Rewards: Salário e beneficios competitivos Learn More: Trabalhar na UL é uma jornada emocionante que muda diariamente. Nós prosperamos nas reviravoltas e nos deleitamos nas curvas. Este é o nosso todos os dias. Este é o nosso normal. Curioso(a)? Para saber mais sobre nós e o trabalho que realizamos, visite [UL.com](https://www.ul.com/)

job_title: Data Engineer | Python, Dbt, Fivetran, Snowflake | Solution SaS/Hypercroissance | Fullremote
company_name: Octopus IT - Expert du recrutement tech
description:
About the job
La société

Cette start-up en hyper-croissance révolutionne le secteur de la restauration !

Comment ? Grâce à un logiciel de gestion complet qui permet aujourd’hui à plus de 4000 restaurateurs et commerçants de gérer leur affaire comme un vrai business.

Plus de simple de caisse enregistreuse mais un véritable écosystème novateur à destination de tous les entrepreneurs (restaurants ou commerces diverses).

Prise de commande sur place, commande en ligne, gestion de stocks ou encore réservations : la solution propose une suite d'outils clés pour la réussite des commerçants.

Cette start-up vient d'intégrer une licorne de la tech européenne et compte maintenant 2000 personnes réparties dans plus de 60 pays.

Une équipe dynamique, soudée, un CTO avec 30 ans d'expériences dans de belles entreprises, une équipe internationale, du full remote possible !

Avec une stack Data mature et au vu de leur gros volumes de données, ils cherchent à renforcer leur équipe Data.

Le poste

Avec une équipe Tech de 30 personne tu rejoindras une équipe Data de 4 personnes, tu contribueras aux produits et solutions, en osmose avec des équipes techniques et business.

Vous travaillerez sur les sujets suivants :

Développer des pipeline de données from scratch
Conduire des projets d'intégration entre les différentes entités de l'entreprise et le coeur de l'infra actuelle
Travailler sur une stack Modern Data Infrastructure
Construire des model de data en Sql et Python
Simplifier et améliorer le process de collecte et report de données afin d'automatiser le workflow et éliminer les dépendances manuelles
Implémenter et maintenir un process scalable pour transformer la data au sein de leur data warehouse.
Echanger avec des équipes métier à l'international pour mieux comprendre leurs enjeux
Participer aux choix et bonnes pratiques de l’équipe

La stack actuelle

Ingestion : Fivetran
Scheduler: Airflow
Data warehouse: Snowflake
Analytics: Metabase for self-service, Tableau for advanced reports
Backend : Python / NodeJs / Express.Js

Votre profil

Une expérience de minimum 3 ans d'expérience au sein de startup ou scale up
Vous connaissez les stack Data du marché et avait déjà travaillé dans un environnement Modern Data Infrastructure
Solides compétences en data modeling
Capable de conduire un projet avec différentes entités (différentes parties prenantes)
Vous maîtrisez Sql et avez des compétences en architecture de model data et optimisation des performances d'une requêtes
Une expérience réussie avec des outils BI tels que Tableau, Looker ou autre
Anglais bon niveau

Le salaire & avantages

50-65 K€ selon expérience
Full remote possible France et Europe
Mutuelle ALAN
Pass Navigo / Billets d'avion
Petit déj d'équipe et Team building

Et plus encore…

Ce qu’on préfère

Être impliqué à fond dans une aventure avec de nombreux challenges techniques
Très bonne ambiance, équipe solidaire et orientée partage d’informations
Beaucoup de workshops en interne
Un CTO expérimenté

About the job
Job Details

What You Will Do

Is Azure your top environment? Are you delivering PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions? Join our international team, and support Azure Data Lake now and Azure Snowflake in the future!

How You Will Do It
Proactive administration & support of Azure Data Lake Platform including admin, incident management & troubleshooting
Be the point of contact for Azure PaaS services including Data Factory, ADLS, Databricks, Synapse & DevOps – Capacity/Cost tracking
Support & Maintain – Big Data Cluster – based on HD Insight, Azure Synapse & Hive
Define standards & best methodologies with Technical Architects & ensure they are implemented or maintained
Liaise with Microsoft Support & SMEs in the escalation & resolution of platform issues
Collaborate with partners of all levels to coordinate, maintain & support Data platforms along with ETL Jobs using Azure Data Factory (ADF)
Design & implement solutions in the Azure cloud platform & related technologies for various enterprise applications
Build solutions to monitor, trace, log & address any concerns in cloud-based data platform architecture
Required

What we look for
3+ years hands-on experience using various methodologies to deliver robust PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions using Azure Cloud technologies
Database technologies i.e. Azure SQL and Azure HD Insight
Overview of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Snowflake, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Security Management with Ranger policies
PowerShell or other scripting languages
Technical troubleshooting, log analysis & performance optimization experience
Preferred
Degree in Software Engineering/Computer Science or similar
The expertise of Azure cloud-based data platform architecture
Expertise in Big data platforms, HIVE & Enterprise data platform
Azure Synapse, ARM Template
Azure DevOps – Repo’s, CI/CD with multiple services integrated
Programming skills using Java, Python, .Net
Excellent stakeholder management, communication & influencing skills
Understanding trends, industry standards & new concepts in Data & Analytics space
Our Benefits

Besides working in an international environment, you will receive a regularly monthly bonus after your first six months, meal vouchers, a recreation allowance and retail discounts. Additionally, our flexible benefits program will allow you to customize benefits from a selection of 3500 products and service such as gym membership, medical cover, a multi-sports card plus many more.

Our onsite facilities at our Bratislava based office includes a fitness center, canteen, nursery and coffee machines located on every floor.

If you are relocating to Bratislava to join Johnson Controls, you will be eligible to receive a housing allowance to help you setup your new life in Slovakia.

The gross monthly salary for this position starts from 2500 EUR per month, plus a monthly bonus that starts after your first 6 months. Please note this is a minimum salary and our compensation packages are based on your professional experience and qualifications.

Our culture

At Johnson Controls you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting projects in today’s market. Our hardworking people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, results-oriented, hardworking and above all fun.

We believe that diversity and inclusion matter and make a difference. By embracing the true value of diversity and inclusion, getting comfortable with having crucial conversations, and valuing different perspectives, we will be one of the most desirable places to work.

About the job
Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.
We are currently looking for a Field Service Engineer (m/f/d) to provide onsite support to our metrology instrumentation customers in Europe. You will be part of the EMEA service team, who provide support for wide range of metrology tools including AFM, nanoscale infrared spectrometer, white light interferometry, 3D optical profiler, stylus profiler and nanomechanical instruments.
The position is home-based in the UK or Germany. It involves frequent travel domestically and internationally on short notice.

Responsibilities
Perform site surveys, pre-installation, installation of Bruker instrumentations (e.g. AFM, nanoscale infrared spectrometer)
Perform corrective maintenance and preventive maintenance
Provide technical support, basic application support, and customer training
Build strong relationship with key accounts
Serve as a supportive and effective communication link between the customer and Bruker to ensure customer service satisfaction
Timely complete and submit all required paperwork
Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadline
Become a trusted advisor and support service contract and new tool sales
Other duties as assigned
The ideal candidate should enjoy a dynamic and fast-pace business environment, have strong communication skills, capability to understand complex electro-mechanical systems and strong technical problem-solving skills..

Qualifikations
Degree in physics, electrical engineering, materials science, chemistry or a related discipline.
Good communication skills. Business-fluent English.
Experience in using standard tools such as oscilloscope and multimeter.
Good computer literacy, including familiarity with data system hardware and industry standard operating systems.
Able to independently troubleshoot and solve problems.
Able to conduct trainings. Experience in writing documentation.
A current driving licence in the EU.
Able to work in production floor, cleanroom & laboratory environments
Experience with AFM or optics preferred.
Please send your CV in English.

About the job
Service Engineer

Field based any location in Netherlands

Location: Netherlands

Frequent Travel Required Across Netherlands

Highly Competitive Salary + Excellent Benefits + Career Enhancement

Reporting to National Service Manager, NL

Become part of one of the fastest growing med-tech companies globally.

Due to the rapid expansion of Mindray’s success, Mindray Medical Netherlands needs a true service professional, technically proficient in the troubleshooting, repair, and calibration of Electronic Medical equipment, or demonstrating experience in working on similar electronic equipment within the medical devices industry preferably, based in Netherlands for this role combining both field services and workshop work.

The Service team supports our customers with their engineering and technical requirements. The team ensures our customers receive the best possible service support and service is consistently of the highest quality. This person focuses on providing professional technical service support for Mindray products in accordance with established National Service policies and procedures. Additionally, they serve as a technical resource to support our customers, their team, and the Field Service Engineers throughout Netherlands, both from customers and sales demonstration units, for our products.

Responsibilities Include

Provides technical service support on the maintenance, repair, inspection, and calibration of Mindray products for customers within Netherlands
Respond to customer calls and emails during office hours, Monday to Friday. Maintain positive, professional communications with customers, and service team members
Take responsibility for the effective management of your designated area, maintaining a clean and tidy workspace as per the Workshop 5s Standards
Maintaining tools and test equipment properly and liaising with the Service Manager to ensuring they are calibrated
Install, repair, check, PM of our systems at customer sites across the Netherlands
Handling of orders self-administering, in time and in communication with our customers
Responsible for tracking and maintaining both spare parts and device loaner inventories allocated to them
Modification and upgrade of Mindray equipment in Mindray’s EU warehouse in Hoevelaken
Makes decisions based on company policies and procedures. Discusses and refers unresolved service issues with the Service Manager
Other tasks or responsibilities designated by the Service Manager

What are we looking for in you?

Educated to Degree level or equivalent (HND/HNC) in Electrical Engineering/Electrical Engineering Technology with relevant experience in servicing electronic equipment
Experience in medical capital equipment industry will be given preference
Fluent in Dutch, with strong business English – both written and spoken
Technically proficient in the troubleshooting, repair, and calibration of Electronic Medical equipment, or demonstrate experience in working on similar electronic equipment
Customer-oriented, with good interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Well-organized in workshop facilities and in field services
Able and willing to travel 40% of working time
Good knowledge of IT networks and related components
Full, clean driving licence
Ability to work in Netherlands without the requirement of company sponsorship

What’s in it for you?

As an field and technical service expert, this is an outstanding position for candidates that are really looking for a role with autonomy, accountability and responsibility, you are going to be critical in the success of our delivery through your phenomenal influencing and negotiation skills at a senior level, brought to Mindray, you get a ‘seat at the table’ and play a truly instrumental role, for this you will be well rewarded with a strong work / life balance, competitive salary, excellent benefits, a highly inclusive and diverse environment and opportunities for future career development in many areas.

Mindray Europe, as part of the global Mindray business, offers a wide selection of bespoke benefits dependent on your location, along with a competitive compensation package and a commitment to a long-term working relationship. With industry leading training and development available to you, you are sure to have a highly rewarding and mutually beneficial, career with Mindray, in a culture that values honesty and fun!

Our goal is to continuously improve and sustain an inclusive culture in which diversity provides deeper customer insights and creates a competitive advantage in the markets we serve. By attracting, developing, and engaging the best team of diverse, empowered associates, we help build success for ourselves and our customers.

Tweet us on Twitter

Check out our

As English is our business language - please submit your CV and application in English.

About the job
Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.

Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.

Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.

As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.

We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.

Planet is a global company with employees working remotely world wide and joining us from offices in San Francisco, Washington DC, Germany, and The Netherlands.

About The Role

As a security operations engineer you will play a role in all aspects of corporate security, SOC operations, incident handling, user education, and work with the application development teams during design and implementation of the system. You will help manage select critical security systems managed by the Corporate Engineering team. In the role you may also help with other corporate security related work as needs (or interest) arise. This is a hybrid role needing a range of technical and interpersonal skills.

The candidate will need a solid technical software background. This position requires working with different stakeholders, occasional code reviews, and working with developers in addressing security vulnerabilities. The candidate will have knowledge of cryptographic concepts, and be comfortable researching specific topics as needed for the task at hand. Familiarity with networking and Cloud computing systems like GCP or AWS is preferred.

Impact You’ll Own

Run, maintain, monitor, and enhance SIEM, network, server and applications monitoring
Responding to security incidents and Planet’s bug bounty program
Automate workflows and develop solutions to increase the efficiency of the team
Product security reviews
Drive processes and systems to support the success of Planet's products Core Area of Impact 1

What You Bring

Bachelor or a Master of Science degree in an Engineering discipline with a focus on Information Security
Candidates must have a computer science, software engineering, or equivalent technical background, and security concepts including cryptography
Experience developing security requirements at a cross-system level
Experience leading or participating in projects
Experience with SOC operations
Familiarity with network and application penetration testing

What Makes You Stand Out

At least 4-5 years of professional experience in a security focused role
Solid interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Experience with ELK stack
Solid development experience in Python, Go, Ruby, or equivalent in a similar language, and interested to learn other languages as needed

Benefits While Working At Planet

Additional company winter holidays and regular global days off
Remote friendly work environment and flexible working hours
Contribution to our growth by offering equity options for employees
Giving back to the community - one day per quarter for charitable work
Learning and Tuition Reimbursement
Regular hack-weeks and meetup events to exchange knowledge
Home office budget
Employee Resource Groups providing empowering spaces for connection and mentorship

Why We Care So Much About Belonging.

We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.

EEO Statement

Planet is committed to building a community where everyone belongs and we invite people from all backgrounds to apply. Planet is an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Accommodations

Planet is an inclusive community and we know that everyone has their own needs. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation during the interview process, please call Planet's front office at 669-214-9404 or contact your recruiter with your request. Your message will be confidential and we will be happy to assist you.

About the job
SEA/ is an intelligent marketplace for fixing freight. Setapp delivers custom software development services for maritime industry clients. Together we are the centre of maritime excellence.

About Your Role

We are looking for a proactive and curious junior analyst to join our team to help identify intelligent insights for our products. Your insights will help digitise the shipping industry and provide charterers, brokers and ship owners the relevant information they need to negotiate successful contracts for carrying freight around the world. You will collaborate with the Product teams to understand the insights customers need, understand and combine data from a multitude of data sources that are the envy of the industry, and learn from our data engineers and architects to make the most of our cutting-edge Azure data platform.

AS A JUNIOR DATA ANALYST, YOU WILL

Deliver actionable insights that intelligently enhance internal processes and customer-facing products
Test hypotheses around product enhancing features
Support the development of proof of concept algorithms, models and metrics
Present results back to the team and stakeholders
Support our existing products to ensure the data is correct and complete
Build and maintain reporting dashboards in PowerBI
Work collaboratively within a team of analysts to share and develop knowledge
Engage with the Centre of Data team to understand our data and tools
Embody a data-driven approach to decision making and development

Requirements

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Understands the basics of a programming
Excellent attention to detail with a strong focus on accuracy.
Communicates effectively and can translate data into relevant visualisations and language.
Self-starter with a strong work ethic, driven and a desire to learn.
Ability to work to tight delivery timescales and to take on new information working with a remote team.

Nice To Have

Experience of the shipping, aviation or rail industry
Experience working with Azure and/or Databricks
Experience working with PowerBI

What You Can Expect

Despite our dynamic growth, we managed to maintain a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere of a tightly-knit team that can implement complex projects comprehensively and effectively. Each of us knows what is expected from us and has adequate space and freedom of action.

Benefits

That’s why we provide a wide range of benefits to all of our employees

The actual work is important, but it’s also essential for us at Setapp that we all stay happy, relaxed and motivated.

Training budget
Private medical care (Luxmed)
Voluntary group life insurance
MyBenefit or Multisport card
Language courses (English and German)
Mentoring program and numerous internal pieces of training
Employee referral program
Paid days off from services (B2B)
A paid day off to care for your health - “Dzień na U” with Fundacja Rak'n'Roll. Wygraj życie!
Integration events, joint company trips, birthday celebrations and many other

What We Offer

Salary: 6 000 to 11 000 PLN/month
Flexible working hours
You choose how you work - from our office in Poznań or remotely from home, or like most of us, work hybrid :)
Strong focus on growth, interesting projects & people who enjoy working with each other! :)

About the job
Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

We are seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to work on a variety of company reporting requests. The ideal candidate for this role displays extreme passion for data and problem solving and is driven to ask the right questions to surface up business insights.

Your Role In Action
