About the job
Wil jij zelf de keuze hebben bij wat voor opdrachtgever je gaat werken en wil je uitgedaagd worden door complexe datavraagstukken?
Als Data Engineer bij DataDolphins heb je zelf de keuze welk project het beste past bij jouw ervaring en ambitie!

Wat ga je doen?
Je gaat jouw expertise voor bepaalde tijd inbrengen bij één van onze opdrachtgevers en je gaat ze helpen een concreet datavraagstuk aan te pakken. Voor jou als ervaren Data Engineer zijn dit uiteraard uitdagende projecten met een grote ontwikkelcomponent. Onze opdrachtgevers zijn over algemeen de grotere

Zo biedt DataDolphins jou de mogelijkheid om vanuit één baan geregeld te wisselen van werkomgeving én te zorgen voor een continue en steile leercurve.

Dit krijg je bij ons
Bij DataDolphins werken we volgens het midlance-model. Dit betekent dat je een eerlijke en bovengemiddelde beloning krijgt. Maar ook de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn uitstekend geregeld, zoals: onbeperkt verlof , onkosten- en reiskostenvergoeding en we investeren samen in opleiding en training. Naast aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden krijg je bij ons veel vrijheid en regie op je eigen carrière. Wij zoeken geen collega bij een project maar wij zoeken een passend project voor onze collega's.

Waar staan wij voor?
Bij DataDolphins maak je onderdeel uit van een warme, informele, en platte organisatie met gelijkgestemde vakgenoten waarin jouw belang en ontwikkeling voorop staat.
Dat doen we door veel kennis te delen, ons gezamenlijke netwerk te gebruiken om nieuwe projecten en collega’s te vinden en natuurlijk plezier met elkaar te hebben. Ieder kwartaal is er een informeel uitje en afgelopen september hebben we met hele bedrijf ons uitgebreid gevierd op Texel.

“Ik voel me heel vrij bij deze club vakgenoten. Het contact met de Business Managers is goed want er wordt geregeld tijd vrijgemaakt voor een lunch om bij te praten. Daarnaast is het salaris ook zeker niet verkeerd.”

Klinkt goed! Wat verwachten jullie van mij?
We willen graag dat jij als Data Engineer succesvol wordt bij DataDolphins, daarvoor zijn een aantal zaken essentieel:

Je hebt een hbo- of academisch werk- en denkniveau
Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in data engineering
Je hebt ervaring met talen als Python en/ of SQL
Je hebt kennis van/ ervaring met één of meer van de cloud platformen Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services en Google Cloud
Je vindt het interessant om te werken met moderne technologieën als Spark, Kafka, Kubernetes, Docker en Snowflake
Je hebt uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Je bent enthousiast over jouw vakgebied en vindt het leuk om daar over te vertellen
Je bent flexibel en je houdt van afwisseling
Je vindt het belangrijk om je te blijven ontwikkelen

Ik wil meer weten, hoe gaat het in zijn werk?
Bij DataDolphins zijn de lijnen kort, ook in de sollicitatieprocedure. Nadat we jouw CV hebben ontvangen neemt één van onze Business Managers, binnen 2 werkdagen contact met je op. Als jouw cv ons aanspreekt plannen we direct een persoonlijke kennismaking met je in.
Liever eerst even contact? Neem dan contact op met Annelien Gijzen via 06 45412403, een appje sturen mag ook. Hopelijk tot snel!

About the job
At ICON, it’s our people that set us apart. Our diverse teams enable us to become a better partner to our customers and help us to fulfil our mission to advance and improve patients’ lives.

Our ‘Own It’ culture is driven by four key values that bring us together as individuals and set us apart as an organisation: Accountability & Delivery, Collaboration, Partnership and Integrity. We want to be the Clinical Research Organisation that delivers excellence to our clients and to patients at every touch-point. In short, to be the partner of choice in drug development.

That’s our vision. We’re driven by it. And we need talented people who share it.

If you’re as driven as we are, join us. You’ll be working in a dynamic and supportive environment, with some of the brightest and the friendliest people in the sector, and you’ll be helping shape an industry.

As a Clinical Research Associate at ICON, you’ll work within a large-scale, fast-paced environment alongside a close-knit team of highly qualified CRAs to identify, select, initiate and close-out investigational sites for clinical studies in phases II – IV, ensuring adherence to applicable regulations and principles of ICH-GCP.

The role:

Independent, proactive work to set up and monitor studies, complete reports and maintain documentation
Submitting protocol, consent documents for ethics/IRB approval, as well as preparing regulatory submissions
Balancing sponsor generated queries
Taking responsibility for study cost efficiency
Preparation and review of study documentation and feasibility studies for new proposals
Potential to assist in training and mentoring fellow CRAs

You will need:

18 months+ of monitoring experience in phase I-III trials as a CRA
College degree in medicine, science, or equivalent
Previous monitoring experience in medium-sized studies, including study start-up and close-out
Knowledge of ICH-GCP guidelines and ability to review and evaluate medical data
Excellent written and verbal communication
Ability to work to tight deadlines
Availability to travel least 60% of the time (international and domestic -fly and drive) and should possess a valid driving license

Benefits of Working in ICON:

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours.

We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.

But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.

Omnicell is empowering health systems and pharmacies to radically transform the way they manage medications, so they can achieve the vision of the Autonomous Pharmacy. You’ll be joining an organization whose culture encourages individual development, rewards intellectual curiosity, and embraces an inclusive environment. Join our growing company and help shape the future at Omnicell!

Test Engineer I

Omnicell is looking for a Test Engineer I for our Engineering organization. Test Engineer I designs laboratory tests according to standard procedures, records and analyzes verification and validation results, also applying statistical methods.

Responsibilities
Constantly update working knowledge of several IV Solutions products.
Design complex test routines, test scenarios and test cases following standards and regulations for IV Solution products.
Analyse test requirements and ensures proper test coverage exists based on requirements and design specifications.
Identifies and manages the critical path of testing, overseeing test execution.
Analyse retrieved data and prepare reports applying a statistical method.
Reports test results to engineering and management where appropriate.
Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide .

About the job
Persönliche Entfaltung in der BI Welt von morgen!

Unserem Leitspruch «experience the sense of tomorrow» verpflichtet unterstützen wir zukunftsorientierte Kunden dabei, aus der Vielzahl ihrer Daten businessrelevante Informationen zu visualisieren und zuverlässige Unternehmenssteuerung in ein erfolgreiches Morgen zu ermöglichen. Wir bieten Dir eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem professionellen und marketingorientierten Unternehmen an, welches die Digitalisierung vorantreibt und Dir die optimale Basis für eine zukunftsorientierte Entwicklung im Consulting ermöglicht. Bei uns kannst du visionär mitgestalten mit viel Eigenverantwortung in einem motivierenden und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsumfeld. Du arbeitest in abwechslungsreichen Business Intelligence Projekten bei namhaften Kunden in verschiedensten Branchen. Deine Begeisterung für Daten, Selbständigkeit und Berufsstolz sind bereits gute Voraussetzungen, um mit uns ins Gespräch zu kommen.

Innerhalb unserer Wachstumsstrategie suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine hochmotivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit für unseren Standort in Deutschland. Der Arbeitsort ist flexibel und grösstenteils arbeiten wir in Deutschland remote, es sollte aber eine gewisse Reisebereitschaft vorhanden sein.

Deine Aufgaben

Beratung von Kunden in vielfältigen BI-Themen im Zusammenspiel mit verschiedenen Quell- und Umsystemen
Unterstützung unseres Sales Teams bei der Gewinnung von Neukunden und dem nachhaltigen Ausbau unseres Kundenstamms
Mit Deinem koordinierten Vorgehen ermittelst Du den Informationsbedarf aus der Sicht unserer Kunden und bist entweder verantwortlich für die Beratung, Konzeptionierung, Planung, Entwicklung sowie der nachhaltigen Betreuung von BI- und Datawarehouse Lösungen auf der Basis von Microsoft Power Plattform und Data Integration (SQL-Server, Synapse, SSIS etc.) on Premises, Azure oder in HybridClouds oder von BI-Lösungen auf der Basis von Qlik und Jedox
Selbständige Durchführung von Projekten und Koordination mit dem Kunden

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung im Datawarehouse- und BI-Umfeld mit Microsoft Produkten insbesondere Power-BI und Synapse oder Erfahrung mit Qlik
Du verstehst Daten und sprichst SQL
Vorkenntnisse im Bereich SAP BI, SAP BW etc. sind ein Plus
Du hast eine hohe Kundenorientierung, gehst Herausforderungen gezielt an und es macht Dir Spass Projekte lösungs- und budgetorientiert mit und für Kunden umzusetzen
Du fühlst Dich wohl dabei, eine hohe Kommunikationskultur innerhalb von Projekten und Kundenbeziehungen zu etablieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland und der Schweiz

Unser Angebot
Eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem spannenden, modernen Spielfeld und einem starken, erfahrenen Team. Es erwarten Dich ein moderner Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, spannende und herausfordernde Projekte. Bei uns kannst Du etwas bewegen!

Bist Du unsere Verstärkung? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen.

About the job
The Role

The Marketplace Technical Analyst is a key member of the marketplace team who collects data on the real time health of Wob’s marketplace account. By collecting this data regularly and adding it to reports, they can find issues quickly and work with the team to drive proactive solutions before the issues become critical. They will also be ready, with the rest of the team to respond quickly to any query from a marketplace Wob trades on, to ensure Wob’s good relationship with the marketplace is maintained.
This particular analyst will also have goal of working with Wob’s Centre of Excellence to find, report, and prevent fraudulent orders on the marketplace. This will be done by using a combination of basic data analysis and by finding anecdotal use cases (i.e. a single case that may be typical of other cases) to flag suspicious patterns to the rest of the team.
The analyst will use this process to become familiar with marketplaces, so that they build a skillset that will allow them to independently create projects to improve Wob’s trading on marketplaces in the future.


Main responsibilities

Organised and detail oriented, able to follow processes consistently and suggest ways they can be improved
Curious to learn new skills sets and become familiar with new tools
Able to perform basic data analysis and internal searches to find orders or patterns of orders which may be fraudulent
Familiar with commonly used e-commerce platforms (Amazon / eBay), preferably from the business side, but at least as a customer
Interest in developing a project management skill set
Flexible to react to the changing priorities quickly as the needs of the business change and to quickly react when critical issues surface
Able to summarize complex issues for leadership who have limited time


Person specification

The person we are looking for is someone who is looking for a role in IT where he/she can grow and take on more. In this position we ideally imagine someone with an admin skillset but with a motivation to gain technical knowledge. Be able to work together with software developers on a daily basis, understand how they work and also understand business requirements.


Skills and abilities

Be able to understand and analyze data
Understand business requirements
Be able to communicate with the development team at a technical level
Speak fluent English
Be able to present results to the leadership team and make them understand quickly
Be able to make deep dive and root cause analysis based on the collected data


Nice to have

Experience in SQL
Experience working in IT

About the job
We're an Advanced Tier AWS Partner operating in Europe, the US, and beyond 🚀. Everyone here lives and breathes AWS; it's the main and only thing we do. Our mission is to help startups scale with Amazon Web Services (AWS). One half of our DNA is AWS; the other is startups.

Right now, we're looking for a Front-end developer to join our team and help us grow at an even greater speed!

Curious? Read on. 👇

What Will You Do

You will work first with our internal systems. We are constantly growing our client base and with this, we have to own the best tools to manage them. You will be responsible for our internal system development.

Based on your profile, Your main tasks will be related to the following
Be responsible for writing clean, tested, and well-documented code that delivers
Implement new features and functionalities needed for the company
Troubleshoot, test, and maintain our core applications

We want to do even better; that's where you and your talent come in 💪!

2+ years of experience in Frontend development
Demonstrable experience in developing tools and features mainly using PHP
Excellent relational database skills with MySQL
General hands-on experience with foundational web technologies such as HTML, CSS, APIs, Responsive design
Strong sense of code quality and user experience
Experience working as a member of a small agile software development team
Experience with OctoberCMS, and NGINX would be an advantage
Experience with Ruby (Rails) and JS (Vue.js) would be an advantage
Curiosity to find out how things work

Can't tick all the boxes? No worries, we believe enthusiasm can compensate for the hard skills. 😉

What we can offer:
Competitive fixed compensation package (gross salary 2800 - 3500 EUR, depending on seniority).
A strong engineering culture, continuous growth & learning environment: Yearly training budget, and company-paid technical training on everything related to AWS and nearby technologies. We're happy to invest in your education and further professional development.
Possibilities to test new ideas and strategies, succeed (or fail is also an essential part of the process), learn from that, and grow together with the company.
Growth environment: share your experience and level up your expertise with a community of skilled professionals in our Technical Sessions.
Remote work (Cloudvisor is a fully remote company) - we honestly don't care about where and how you do your work if you manage to deliver!
A cool product to work with - AWS is the No. 1 public cloud in the world!
An awesome and international team to work with. Yes, the best team you have ever seen. To keep the strong bond between all Cloudvisorians, we do online Team Lunches; we also do some traveling around to meet face to face in our yearly company retreat, and an Engineering team's retreat to keep growing together.
Work-life balance: 28 days of paid vacation leave per year + your location's public holidays.
Workspace improvement support - An allowance to change your work equipment or environment to make your life better and work easier.
Well-being allowance - We truly believe in a healthy work-life balance. You can use it for anything related to your hobbies, health, and well-being.

Why us?
Cloudvisor = people. We believe your personality and soft skills are more important than just several hard competencies.
Cloudvisor = growth. We take on the challenges ahead and keep up with an ever-changing environment, becoming the best professional version of ourselves with no hidden agenda.
Cloudvisor = culture. We are partners. We believe that working together should not be limited to the actual work! We care about all of you, your background, what makes you tick, your reality, and your diversity!
Cloudvisor = startup. We live in a fast-developing world and are making our way into it. You will find a result-driven space where you can develop your best ideas. ****

Do you think you are the perfect fit for our team? We have discovered our ideal profile – we call it a true Cloudvisorian!

About the job
Sophos is a worldwide leader in next-generation cybersecurity, protecting more than 500,000 organizations and millions of consumers in more than 150 countries from today’s most advanced cyberthreats. Powered by threat intelligence, AI and machine learning from SophosLabs and SophosAI, Sophos delivers a broad portfolio of advanced products and services to secure users, networks and endpoints against ransomware, malware, exploits, phishing and the wide range of other cyberattacks. Sophos provides a single integrated cloud-based management console, Sophos Central – the centerpiece of an adaptive cybersecurity ecosystem that features a centralized data lake that leverages a rich set of open APIs available to customers, partners, developers, and other cybersecurity vendors. Sophos sells its products and services through reseller partners and managed service providers (MSPs) worldwide. Sophos has major hubs around the globe. More information is available at www.sophos.com

The Sophos Artificial Intelligence (Sophos AI or SAI) department is looking for Software Engineers to join our development team.

This position focuses on developing and supporting AWS cloud-based big data tooling and analytics.

As a member of our team, you will work on the development and maintenance of our internal test systems to ensure the superior quality of deliverables used by Sophos products to provide protection to all our customers.

To succeed in this role you will be passionate about developing high-quality deliverables, continuous improvement, and cooperation between global teams and keen to use your excellent skills to contribute to the success of the Sophos Artificial Intelligence team.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Software Development. – Innovate, design, develop and deliver features into the Sophos AI automated systems area, focusing on ML systems taking it to an industry leading next generation position.
Continuous Improvement – Identify key metrics, put measurement in place and work on to meet them. Do this using the Agile Software development framework of SCRUM.
DevOps – Implement CI/CD, operational metrics and monitoring for Sophos AI systems and support them.

What You Shall Bring

Experience in Agile software development
Proven track record of designing & developing reliable, maintainable, high-quality code that’s well unit-tested
Minimum 2 years experience in Python
Minimum 1 year experience in some (R)DBMS and SQL
Experience with AWS services would be great, but not a must
Experience in portable C & C++ development is an advantage
Proficient in using development tools (source control, static analysis, issue tracking, etc. )
Have good problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Able to work in small groups but also independently if needed
Not afraid to share your opinion on how to get things better
Fluency in English

What SOPHOS AI Provides

Working flexibly from home (home office) with equipment and support provided
Opportunity to interact with all of our teammates, working on multiple projects
Global mobility: Sophos has offices all over the world, in case life takes you somewhere else
Support for wellbeing; including team events, catering and free time activities in our communities
Employee-led diversity and inclusion networks that build community and provide education and advocacy
Annual charity and fundraising initiatives and volunteer days for employees to support local communities
Global fitness and trivia competitions to keep our bodies and minds sharp
Professional and social skills trainings to train & improve your skills by yourselves

#B2

What's Great About Sophos?

Our people – we innovate and create, all of which are accompanied by a great sense of fun and team spirit
Employee-led diversity and inclusion networks that build community and provide education and advocacy
Annual charity and fundraising initiatives and volunteer days for employees to support local communities
Global employee sustainability initiatives to reduce our environmental footprint
Global fitness and trivia competitions to keep our bodies and minds sharp
Global wellbeing days for employees to relax and recharge
Monthly wellbeing webinars and training to support employee health and wellbeing

Our Commitment To You

We’re proud of the diverse and inclusive environment we have at Sophos, and we’re committed to ensuring equality of opportunity. We believe that diversity, combined with excellence, builds a better Sophos, so we encourage applicants that can contribute to the diversity of our team. All applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, sex, gender reassignment, marital status, race, religion or belief, color, age, military veteran status, disability, pregnancy, maternity or sexual orientation. We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know.

Data Protection

If you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos. If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights. If you have any questions about Sophos’ data protection practices, please contact dataprotection@sophos.com.

About the job
About Us:

Consensus is a top place to work due to the incredible culture our employees have created. We strive to provide an opportunity to work with a great team with a compelling product with the objective that adding value in your work life fuels the rest of your life. We know that a winning company is built on the efforts of its people, and that’s an environment we foster at Consensus. We encourage every employee to bring their authentic self to work and take ownership of their position and their career. We strive to give our employees everything they need to make meaningful contributions to the overall success of our company. We’re looking for go-getters that are excited to thrive in a company going through an exciting growth phase!

We are a fast-growing SaaS company based in the United States. We are changing the way the world buys enterprise software. We do this by providing intelligent demo automation software that helps you scale Presales. How does this work?

We believe buying enterprise software should be simple, pleasant, and fast instead of complex, painful, and slow (which is how it is today). Buyers now want instant access to presales (sales engineering) resources throughout the buying experience but they find it harder and harder to get what they need. Using Consensus, a sales engineering team builds a library of reusable interactive video demos that Sales sends out on-demand. Consensus automatically personalizes the experience and tracks engagement as the prospect shares the demo with other stakeholders in the buying group, bringing the entire buying group to live demos better educated and ready to talk specifics.

This not only reduces unqualified demos to near zero and can double the presales team’s productivity, it also removes the "demo lag time" for prospects and shortens the sales cycle by as much as 68%.

Our Values:

Our values are extremely important to us and we hope that they mean something to you too. We want everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We hope you can help us continue to grow without having to be perfect, but willing to put your name on something knowing it is a “version one”. Everyone here takes total ownership and accountability, because owning our outcomes means making a real contribution. We also believe in a “no peacemongering” principle. We know our path to success is hard and we don’t hesitate to ask hard things of others. We are respectfully confrontational to one another and ask direct accountability questions.

Check out all of our values on our careers page !

About the Role:

We are seeking a programmatic and declarative developer who wants to expand their coding skills by working with a passionate Salesforce team in a growing company. You might be excited to use or learn to use Salesforce CPQ, Experience/Sales/Service Clouds, API’s.

What You'll Do:
Primary developer of our Salesforce code base
Improve our development process to reduce the time to market and increase quality by applying modern engineering principles (tests automation, frequent releases, static analysis, etc.)
Work with our product team to collect the requirements
Perform code review with other developers
Coach and mentor other developers

What We're Looking For:
5-7 years of development experience
3-4 years of Salesforce experience
Demonstrated expertise with Salesforce administration and development, security, standard objects, reports/dashboards, data management, and sandbox environments
Demonstrated knowledge with advanced Salesforce.com development tools and techniques such as Apex language, Lightning Components, and Visualforce pages
Experience with Salesforce CI/CD and release management process & tools

Preferred Qualifications:
Salesforce certifications such as Platform Dev 1 & 2 or App Builder
Version Control experience (Git)
Experience working within an Agile team
Knowledge with micro services platform
Solid understanding of programming languages such as JavaScript, Java, or SQL
Working knowledge of UI frameworks like AJAX, jQuery, or JSON

At Consensus, you'll get:
13th salary
Flexible/Remote work environment
Company provided best-in-class equipment (we give you the budget and you choose the equipment you want to work with)
Professional Development program
Every third Friday of the month off

About the job
Company Overview

Wynshop is a fast-growing technology company pioneering the future of online grocery. Launched in early 2020, Wynshop has quickly established itself as a market leader enabling the world’s largest independent grocers to compete with technology and retail giants by using Wynshop’s grocery-specific digital commerce platform.

We are a diverse team of energetic individuals who think big, challenge the status quo, and strive for excellence in our personal and professional lives. Our potential, like our customers’ success, knows no bounds. At every level, we provide endless opportunities to produce meaningful work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. We maintain a startup vibe, but with the resources and security of an established “corporate” company. Our global headquarters is in Miami, Florida.

Position Overview

We seek a C# engineer to join an agile team responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our fulfillment solution which is part of our market-leading e-commerce platform for groceries.

Our e-commerce platform is built from the ground up on MACH principles and deployed on Kubernetes in Google Cloud. We leverage Microsoft .NET core to build Microservices leveraging Mass Transit, Rabbit MQ, Docker, and persistent stores including Event Store, Elastic, Mongo, and Redis to support high-scale customers.

We welcome all candidates anywhere in Ireland. This is a fully remote role.

What You'll Be Doing

Work within an agile team to build a world-class consumer application
Write clean and scalable code that others can work on
Analyze requirements and design
Debug and troubleshoot production issues
Provide input for software and technological innovations

What You Bring To The Table

Strong understanding of C# and OOP principles
Experience with developing software on the Microsoft .NET platform
An interest in learning and using the latest development techniques
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies
Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
Experience with REST APIs
Experience with code versioning tools
Experience with Kotlin, Docker, or Kubernetes a plus

What You’ll Get In Return

Directly influence the adoption of new technologies that are transforming the digital commerce landscape
The opportunity to gain versatile skills, and be part of a high-energy, high-impact team
The freedom to pave your career path and accelerate your growth in an organization that is flat and nimble

Benefits And Other Perks

Hybrid office policy with remote working capabilities

Vacation paid time off

Access To Company's Medical Benefits Scheme

Pension Scheme with company match

Education & Learning stipend for personal growth and development

Cycle to Work Scheme

Commuter Tax Saver Scheme

About Wynshop

Wynshop is the pioneer Cloud-based e-commerce solution specifically designed for grocers. The company was created by ambitious developers and grocery retail experts who identified a gap in the technology available for grocers to launch, scale, and win online. Wynshop is relentlessly committed to retail technology innovation. We are constantly evolving to provide simple, scalable, and sustainable solutions to our customers’ industry-specific business problems.

Must be legally authorized to work without visa sponsorship for employment.

Wynshop is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

No phone calls, please.

job_title: eDiscovery Data Conversion Specialist - Night Shift (Remote)
description:
About the job
Job Description

KLDiscovery, one of the largest national eDiscovery providers, is currently seeking a eDiscovery Data Conversion Specialist. This role manages (repairing, extracting, converting) data which relate to pending/potential litigation, investigations, and various other types of matters.

Kindly note this is not a data science role.


The ideal candidate will ensure that projects are adequately handled, tracked, and responded to in an efficient and accurate manner. This position requires a wide array of technical competencies as it relates from moderate computer use through advanced level of computer repair and scripting. The core of the role is Data Conversion.

Remote, work from home opportunity.

Evening shift schedule: Saturday - Wednesday 10:00 PM - 6:00 AM Local Time.

Responsibilities

Ensure that processing requirements are met as determined by both the customer, project manager(s), and operations management.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects with similar deadlines.
Primary support for eDiscovery processing and Project Management departments
Evidence handling, duplications, and Chain of Custody procedures
Data culling & collections
Involving data repair/manipulations/conversions
Process data requests, consistently update and track request tasks using proprietary and COTS software
Business problem-solving skills and judgment necessary to analyze, troubleshoot, and problem-solve issues and provide proposed solutions.
In-house collection work involving various types of data, encryptions, devices; ability for field work available
Coordinate efforts between various internal business units to complete data processing requirements.
Assist in developing, documenting, and refining necessary procedures to accomplish discovery process requirements.
Miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by manager.
Internal and External (position relevant certification) training available.

Qualifications

Must be self- motivated, yet must be able to work in a team
Creative problem-solving capabilities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A keen level of attention to detail
Proven ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines
Ability to work flexible shifts (when needed)
Proficient in the use of Text Editor Applications, MS Excel and like Office productivity applications
Must be experienced with designing and maintaining spreadsheets
Working knowledge of Windows, Linux/Unix, and Mac operating systems
Demonstrated ability to provide customer service and support to internal and external contacts

Preferred Qualifications

Various Forensic Analysis Application experience (EnCase, FTK, WinHEX, NUIX, Stellar, Paraben, Cellebrite, etc.)
General understanding of (Robo/Rich) copy tools, BAT (PowerShell) scripting, and Active Directory
Some experience with scripting, programming/coding, database languages (SQL, VB, HTML, Access)
Experience trouble shooting applications and communicating results to support teams
Experience in the litigation support industry vendor/law firm

What We Offer

A friendly and welcoming team-oriented environment
The opportunity to work 100% remotely
Opportunities for career advancement and growth
Fantastic benefits which include life insurance, disability insurance and health insurance for both you and your eligible dependents.
Very competitive salary

Our Cultural Values

We Seek Team Members Who Are


Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision.

Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients’ needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses
Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact
Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients


Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers.

Who We Are


KLDiscovery provides technology-enabled services and software to help law firms, corporations, government agencies and consumers solve complex data challenges. The company, with offices in 25 locations across 16 countries, is a global leader in delivering best-in-class eDiscovery, information governance and data recovery solutions to support the litigation, regulatory compliance, internal investigation and data recovery and management needs of our clients.


Serving clients for over 30 years, KLDiscovery offers data collection and forensic investigation, early case assessment, electronic discovery and data processing, application software and data hosting for web-based document reviews, and managed document review services. In addition, through its global Ontrack Data Recovery business, KLDiscovery delivers world-class data recovery, email extraction and restoration, data destruction and tape management.


KLDiscovery has been recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in North America by both Inc. Magazine (Inc. 5000) and Deloitte (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500) and CEO Chris Weiler has been honored as a past Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year™. Additionally, KLDiscovery is an Orange-level Relativity Best in Service Partner, a Relativity Premium Hosting Partner and maintains ISO/IEC 27001 Certified data centers.


KLDiscovery is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About the job
We’re looking for a Mid level Software Engineer to join our growing CRM team at Repath. You will be working closely with the team on client projects, you’ll bring to the table a drive for impact, a curious and tenacious approach and a relentless desire to help our clients optimise their processes through CRM and Marketing Automation Solutions.

What you’ll do:

Design custom integrations with 3rd party services
Provide expertise in software deployment lifecycle phases from concept & design to testing & implementation.
Creating and contributing to technical specs and testing/rollout plans
Mentoring and supporting teammates to help them grow
Drafting and creating Software documentation

What You Bring To Us

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Coding skills – ability to code in one or more languages (Python, JavaScript, Java)
Experience with at least one relational database (MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server etc.)
Solid knowledge of RESTful webservices
Solid understanding of JSON and XML
Ability to design and implement solutions with minimal supervision;
Ability to communicate in English (both verbally and written)
Knowledge of agile methodologies.

What we bring to the table

Competitive Salary and bonuses
A strong team spirit
A pleasant working environment
Work-life balance
Ongoing training, certification and development
The option to work remotely
Long term cooperation perspectives

What we stand for

We strive to improve our client’s performance building long lasting relationships and focusing on quality and business excellence. This is why we never stop thinking and testing tools and methodologies that will make our clients to revolutionize their business. We support diversity in our workforce by bringing different minds under one roof and honing their talents is one of our fortes. We try to get the best from a team with the right mix of expertise.

About the job
Overview: G-Net 3D is a leading multi-disciplinary company specializing in Architectural Visualisation, Animation, CGI and Verified Planning Photomontage Imagery. We are seeking a talented Daylight and Sunlight Analyst to work with us to deliver daylight & sunlight assessment reports for AEC sector planning purposes. Responsibilities & Requirements:The candidate should be able to demonstrate:
Understanding of daylight and sunlight analysis in accordance with the BRE guidance. An excellent understanding of CAD (through qualification or previous experience) and will be responsible to produce 3D solid AutoCAD models to support said daylight and sunlight assessments, visualisations, and final reports. Experience and knowledge in the following software packages a distinct advantage -Autodesk Revit, Autodesk 3ds Max, Autodesk CAD. Intermediate level of knowledge and experience in Adobe suite (Photoshop & In-Design). A demonstrable portfolio of working with 3D assests and planning guidelines is an advantage A cursory understanding of other high-end rendering techniques and postproduction is beneficial to the application
Candidates must be able to manage a Daylight and Sunlight Analysis from start to final production of the full report. A genuine team-player who can lead and work with others while meeting the demands of the job and maintaining project deadlines. Good Verbal & Communication skills. Benefits:Full-time, permanent position with remote working from our Cork studio but willing to consider accomplished freelancers Attractive salary (negotiable). Further education financial support. Nice location with easy transport access. Exciting, creative team environment. See: https://www.gnet.ie for examples of our work.

About the job
Simbec-Orion is a responsive and agile full-service CRO, with wide therapeutic experience and specialist expertise in clinical pharmacology, oncology and rare diseases. Perfectly structured, we provide full-service clinical development solutions for small and mid-size drug developers – headed up by a centralised leadership team.

With a focus on tailormade and scalable solutions, we’ll adapt our delivery style, communications and operations to suit the demands of the project, helping clients achieve their clinical and commercial objectives. Because our goal is the same as theirs; to improve patients’ lives.

THE ROLE

We are looking for a Clinical Research Associate II to join our Clinical Operations team where you will be responsible for conducting site visits independently. You will monitor the progress of clinical trials with investigators onsite or remotely to ensure clinical trials are conducted, documented and reported in accordance with the protocol, standard operating procedures (SOPs), all applicable regulatory requirements and ICH-GCP.

Key Accountabilities

Contribute to site identification and feasibility activities.
Responsible for all aspects of study site management. (eg. Training site staff, ensure supply of study material, IMP and trial documents, recruitment updates, etc.).
Responsible for collection and assessment of essential documents and perform reconciliation of Investigator Site File.
Conduct pre-study visits, site initiation visits, site monitoring visits and site closeout visits.
Assesses IP accountability, dispensation, and compliance at the investigative sites.
Prepare accurate and timely visit reports in accordance with the monitoring plan and/or SOPs.
Demonstrates working knowledge of applications and Systems (e.g. CTMS, eTMF, IVRS/IWRS and EDC).
Facilitates site audits and audit finding resolutions.
May supervise work of, or mentor, less experienced CRAs.
Serve as an observational visit leader.

Essential

SKILLS REQUIRED

Bachelor’s degree in Nursing, Life Sciences or Medical Sciences or equivalent work experience
Experienced Clinical Research Associate or equivalent relevant experience
Excellent communication skills
Proficiency in written and spoken English and fluent in host country language
Good knowledge of European clinical research regulations and ICH-GCP

Desirable

Advanced degree (Masters, MD, PhD)
CRA II experience in a CRO or Pharmaceutical setting
Strong presentation skills
Ability to establish/maintain good working relationships with colleagues and clients
Proven ability to gain in-depth protocol knowledge

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

Simbec-Orion is growing fast. To keep up with demand, we’re looking for the best people, from all areas of clinical development, to join our team.

We’re dedicated to bringing the latest advances in science to market. Exposure to truly innovative new drugs in patient populations with serious unmet medical needs is what drives our company – and your reason to be a part of it.

With experts from all disciplines under the same roof, you’ll work alongside some of the industry’s best. So if you’d like to further your career within challenging therapeutic areas in rare disease, oncology, or at our clinical pharmacology site, or laboratory services. We’re waiting to hear from you. our clinical pharmacology site, or laboratory services. We’re waiting to hear from you.

About the job
🚀 Who we are?

Founded in 2013, Housecall Pro helps home service professionals (Pros) streamline every aspect of their business. With easy-to-use tools for scheduling, dispatching, payments, and more, Housecall Pro enables Pros to save time, grow profitably, and provide best-in-class service.

Housecall Pro’s brand portfolio includes BuildBook, construction management software for builders and remodelers, and CONQUER, a business coaching solution for home services businesses. Our brands are united by a singular mission to champion our Pros to success.

We support more than 25,000 businesses and have over 1,000 ambitious, mission-driven, genuinely fun-loving employees across the United States and all over the world (including Poland 🇵🇱).

If you want to do work that impacts real people, supported by a team that will invest in you every step of the way, we’d love to hear from you.

Compensation: 5 000 - 7 000 USD (B2B)

🚀 We Also Offer
Flexible time off policy (26 days doesn’t have to be a limit)
Flexible work hours
Equity shares in a rapidly growing company backed by top-tier VCs
A culture built on innovation that values big ideas
Working in Central European Time
Newest MacBook + Setup Fee ($500)
🚀 The Role

We’re looking for a Product Manager to help us build products that make our home services professionals more successful. As a Product person at Housecall Pro, you will be empowered, along with your Designer and Engineering Manager, to Think (identify strategic opportunities), Explore (craft elegant and simple solutions), Plan (set and communicate timing), Build (execute on your ideas), and Launch & Learn (measure and iterate quickly).

Our Product people deeply know our customers through in-depth primary research, our industry through competitive and market research, and our business through data analysis. As a Product person at HCP, you will have significant leadership responsibility not only within your area of the product, but also through collaborating across the business. By joining our team, you will be signing up to grow personally and professionally through our robust coaching program and will be responsible for helping others grow as well.

The essence of a Product person at Housecall Pro is someone with curiosity, emotional intelligence, who wants to make an impact, is really smart, with an internal engine that drives them, is adaptable, is decisive, and is nice to spend time with.

🚀 Joining Housecall Pro Means
Building a product that really improves users’ lives (70k users, 4.6 rates at App Store) - 🎥 learn more about how we help our users!;
Being a part of the Polish team of product builders, who put the highest priority on the user experience;
Being in direct contact with the community of users, who are eager to share their feedback;
Working with a mature, interdisciplinary dev team (almost 100% of the Polish squad are seniors);
Having a real impact on product decisions and strategy;
You are committed to your work, open to feedback, and eager to share your knowledge, just like us - 🎥 learn more about the Housecall Pro culture!
🚀 Your Responsibilities As a Product Manager
Develop deep knowledge of our customer, industry, and business
Think . Place all work in the strategic framework for the product org and HCP overall, understand risks, use data to inform conclusions
Conduct in-depth interviews, surveys, and competitor research
Analyze customer and business data
Write and present strategy and product 1-Pager documents
Explore . With the triad (PM, Designer, Eng Mgr), develop and validate compelling solutions to the problems/opportunities in their product area
Support Product Designers with good design instincts and clear thinking
Co-Create Event Models and user flows
Collaborate with Design and Eng Manager to develop wireframes
Collaborate to conduct user testing to validate solutions
Plan . Effectively plan how to go from idea to delivered product and communicate that plan to others
Create, update, and communicate roadmap
Plan day-to-day operations of the product team
Build . With the triad (PM, PD, Eng Mgr), drive the execution of building features and functionality by doing whatever is needed to keep momentum going
Launch & Learn . Work collaboratively cross-functionally (e.g., Analytics, Product Marketing, Front-line teams) to pull together everything needed to effectively launch the product, measure it, learn, and iterate quickly improve the product
Create measurement plans to monitor feature adoption and usage
Co-Create go to market plans and collaborate with Marketing to execute them
Rapidly develop post-launch product iterations
🚀 Join Us If You Have
4+ years of experience in product management in SaaS companies
Aptitude or previous experience managing other Product Managers
Deep understanding of Product Management processes
Experience in highly performing product organization
🚀 Additional Assets Will Be
Passionate about working and partnering with product design to create delightful user experiences
Demonstrated ability to be resourceful, innovative and creative
Has had success launching impactful product features to customers
Experience with redesign/rebrand or impactful product release with customer migration
This role is open to candidates inside Poland. The specific salary for the successful candidate will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills and experience.

Housecall Pro celebrates diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.

description:

About the job
Some info about us:

Created over 30 years ago and based in more than 30 countries, ALTEN Group supports its customers’ development strategies in the areas of innovation, R&D and technological information systems. ALTEN works with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defense & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.
ALTEN Delivery Center Eastern Europe (ADC Eastern Europe) is part of ALTEN Group’s offshore delivery centers network, together with centers from other regions such as Morocco, India, Mexico, and Spain.

At the moment, ADC Eastern Europe has 400 employees, three sites (Iasi, Bucharest and Gliwice) and offers engineering and IT consulting services for international clients from the automotive, aero, energetic, finance or life sciences sectors. Our team focuses on cultivating a feeling of belonging to a technical environment based on creativity and constant innovation.



Passionate about the aerospace industry & eager to learn new things about it?

Then...maybe, this activity will be interesting for you. Find more details below here 👇


ALTEN Delivery Center is looking for an Aircraft Maintenance Analyst ready to take on this challenge & be part of our Support Services team!


Required skills:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or any other field
Data Management knowledge (spreadsheet / formula / macro)
Aircraft background may be desired
Fluent in English
Good communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team environment
Proactive and results driven
Customer-oriented mindset


Your main responsibilities:

Managing damage reports and providing repair solutions to the customers
Researching and analyzing information to develop complete and correct repair forms
Completing regulatory documents concerning safety issues
Communicate with stakeholders and monitoring their results with the objective to provide the appropriate maintenance solutions
Overseeing, analyzing and evaluating the entire repair process in order to prevent any blocking points
Identifying and addressing problems
Making improvements to existing processes, tools etc.


Benefits:

Hybrid way of working
Continuous learning and opportunities

Apply & let’s meet!

About the job
Department: Information Security
Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time

About Us:

The payments market is the most exciting technology market in the world today for good reason. McKinsey values it globally at over $2 trillion and it’s growing between 13-15% year-on-year. Some of the largest most dynamic brands are investing in this sector; Apple has ApplePay, Google has GooglePay, Amazon has AmazonPay, and it’s not just the Silicon Valley brands. Tencent owns WeChatPay, Alibaba owns Alipay and digital disruptors like Square, Stripe and Adyen all invest millions to grow the payments market.

Planet are a technology company that’s transforming payments by putting the customer experience first. We help our customers deliver a better experience for guests, shoppers, and consumers everywhere. We operate in a market that continues to evolve and expand, partnering with the world’s most prestigious brands across Retail and Hospitality, and with a network of Financial Services partners worldwide.

To meet consumer demands, payments must be simple, safe, and invisible. The only way to do this is to fully embed payments in the software that runs business. By combining software and payment technology, Planet’s creating a world of connected commerce, that makes payments feel good.

We’re growing organically, and with strong Private Equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we’ve the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisition.

Function Overview:

The Planet technology team is driving the modernization of the core infrastructure that is revolutionizing how the global hospitality, retail and connected commerce industry operates. We work with the latest technologies using modern design, development, and delivery practices. Our teams excel at being on the forefront of transforming the connected commerce industry.

Role Overview:

Reporting to the VP, Database Operations you will be part of a global team of DBA's responsible for the 24x7x365 (once every 5 or 6 weeks) support, administration and management of Planet’s global database platforms, deployed in on-prem and cloud environments. You will be part of a diverse and well respected technical minded team that support the transaction processing and back office teams within the Planet payments business. This role will also require candidates to be hands on but at the same time be involved in wider team project life cycles by supporting the application development teams.

What you will do:

The Database Administrator’s role is to administer primarily MySQL database servers and related components to ensure high levels of availability and security of the supported business applications. Experience is Microsoft SQL Server would also be preferable. You will also:

Install, configure and troubleshoot MySQL and SQL Server databases
Maintain database security hardening
Perform and test data backups and scripting
Monitor and tune system performance
Database patch/upgrade management
Create and maintain procedures
Participation in the 24x7 on-call rota (once every 5 or 6 weeks)

Who you are:

A creative and well rounded candidate with 2-4 years of relevant work experience
Have had demonstrable MySQL and SQL Server administration and troubleshooting experience
Technical with a good grasp of systems and networks
Someone who can work autonomously as well as collaboratively with a global team.
Excellent communication skills and able to work under pressure and independently
Ability to perform Root Cause Analysis of problems in a complex environment and to provide effective solutions quickly and reporting of same.

Why Planet:

At Planet we love to see faces in the office but understand some of life’s competing priorities; and that’s why Planet’s flexible working policy means employees have the autonomy to manage their working time to welcome flexibility in juggling their work/life balance. We are all about the quality of work being delivered on time, not the quantity, so how you get there is up to you (and your manager).


Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce. We would love to hear from you – Apply now.

About the job
Join a team of experts on a mission!

Your Role And Responsibilities

Within our company, we have created a new division that focuses on building an HR Data Engine, where we want to give our client insights on talent hiring and retention. In a strongly growing market, where competences are becoming more and more important, we are looking for someone who can contribute to advanced analyses, by investigating influences (e.g. what is the impact of inflation on retention rates) and by being able to extract useful and actionable information from natural language written content. DETAILS:
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will solve AI challenges (Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning & Deep Learning) through a problem/solution oriented process
Mining of texts in both Dutch and English languages for structured information extraction.
Implement simple and advanced NLP pre-processing and text similarity techniques.
Advice and guide our clients about the expected data format to feed our engine.
Variable selection and validation of machine learning algorithms to predict factors related to human behavior.
Axialite the UI/UX personnel about the available insights to be shown to the client.
Write production-level code and build scalable NLP models in multi-cloud environments (IBM, Azure, AWS, GCP) or on-prem (decision is not made)

Required Technical And Professional Expertise
We are looking for experienced professional 5+ years of Data Science (preferably NLP) experience to become full-time (senior/architect) data scientist.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, proven by previous work and other relevant courses or certifications
You are curious and eager to learn new technologies and methods continuously and is always looking for new (and better, of course) ways to solve the problems that you have your hands on.
Ability to adapt to fast-paced and changing environments and contexts
Expertise in translating business requirements into a technical framework
Ability to explain complex analysis to a non-technical audience with your storytelling and data visualization skills
Experience with basic NLP text pre-processing, summarization, similarity measurement and named entity recognition.
You have expertise with Python programming language, OOP and RESTFUL API Building.
Creativity in data representation and problem modeling for machine learning tasks.
Fluency in English

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise
Real-world experience with NLP solutions in a production environment.
Master's or Phd degree in Computer Science approaching a relevant machine learning problem (NLP problem is a plus).
Applied experience working with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Keras or PyTorch and NLP libraries such as NLTK, Gensim and spaCy.
Machine learning versioning, deployment, monitoring and retraining (MLOps) in Azure Machine learning
Machine learning fairness and explainability
DevSecOps
Experience with transformers and knowledge graphs.
Experience with Hugging Face AI Infrastructure.
Applied experience with software engineering principles like versioning, CI/CD, packaging and distribution
Real-world applied experience with people analytics and HR data.
Fluency in Dutch Language would be a big plus

Location Statement

Summ.link wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

We Are

We started the company in 2016, so fun is our trump card. Through our matrix structure, our focus is on knowledge, and empowering each developer is close to our hearts. So do you want to be part of a new adventure, where flexibility but also a very personal relationship between employer and employee is important, then definitely contact us. We are not a traditional company, as there are many. People want to work for us if they want to become top in their field! How we do this? Check our offer..

We Offer
First principles: People First, Remote First, Digital First
A lot of attention is paid to further training and personal growth, we give our internal employees an average of 10 to 20 working days of training!
Each quarter a technical boot-camp, sharing is caring.
Flex office in the style of the New World of Work
High degree of flexibility (eye for work/life balance, homeworking possible, trust)
Young and dynamic team with a positive mindset
Fun@Work with sports activities, after-works, tastings, Hercules Trophy and fun weekends.
Weekends. Even in this age of corona, we ensure solidarity and fun among colleagues in other ways. and fun among colleagues.
Of course, the salary package is also important! We will be happy to explain it to you during a personal conversation.

About the job
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help us improve the quality, scalability and resilience of our data-intensive applications in the company.

The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience designing data-intensive applications and big data solutions, and we also expect a good knowledge of all types of data storage: structured files, relational databases, documental databases, graph databases, etc.

The Role
Understand the functional requirements for defining the best data models and data flows between our applications, services, data storages and synchronization mechanisms
Integrate, transform, and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems into structures that are suitable for building analytics solutions
Ensure that our data applications/processes are scalable, reliable, secure, extensible, traceable, available and manageable.
Design, implement, monitor, and optimize our data platforms
Support the different SW development teams in the modelling, design, construction, evolution, and decommission of their data-intensive applications and data models
Understand and promote the best Data frameworks and solutions, technical standards and key technologies, to effectively support existing and future business requirements

Key Responsibilities
Work closely with IT Architects to provide overall consistent and reliable data solutions for all the applications ecosystem
Create a partnership with Scrum teams and POs, understanding the application and business requirements, and helping them understand the data through exploration, building and maintaining secure and compliant data processing pipelines
Collaborate closely with Machine Learning and Data Science Team to improve the performance of our ML pipelines.
Create models and prototypes that validate your ideas, before bringing them to the development team
Create and maintain up to date the documents describing the Data strategy of your applications domain, as well as all relevant guidelines and standards

Tech Stack & Key Requirements
Python
Spark and PySpark
Excellent understanding of parallel processing and data architecture patterns
Solid knowledge on DataBricks,
ElasticSearch and DeltaLake are a nice-to-have
Experience on building Data Lakes
Expertise in data processing: data ingest and transformation, batch processing, streaming data processing, distributed processing, monitoring, optimization, logging
Experienced in troubleshooting data processing and data storage
Knowledge of data security standards
Knowledge of serving layer design: star schema, dimensions, incremental loading, stores
Knowledge of physical data storage structures: compression, partitioning, sharding, redundancy, distributions, archiving

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis.

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

job_title: Senior SAS Programmer – Fast Progression – Remote Working
description:
About the job
Senior SAS Programmer – Global CRO – Fully Remote

Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer / Senior SAS Consultant / Clinical SAS Programmer

Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.

Looking for an experienced Statistical Programmer who will be fully responsible for leading multiple complex projects across oncology and other therapeutic areas – phases I-III.
You will remain the point of contact for all client meetings/queries and dependent on your experience level will also be responsible for leading/managing the project teams.

Role Responsibilities:
Project lead clinical studies
Develop and maintain project timelines
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and Pharma industry

We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.

Desired Skills:
3 years’ experience in SAS Programming
Some experience Co-leading / Leading Projects and Studies
Experience mentoring and supporting a team of SAS Programmers.
You have Good SAS programming and CDISC standards knowledge
You possess excellent interpersonal skills

Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working

Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.

Title: Senior Statistical Programmer

Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.

Please apply below or email your CV to Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com

Associated Keywords: Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer Senior SAS Consultant / United Kingdom / London / Manchester / Remote / Home based / CDISC / ADaM / STDM / CDASH / TLF / SAS Certificate / SAS Certification / Clinical SAS Programmer / Clinical SAS Programmer / SAS Programming / Statistical Programming / Submission / Specifications / Regulatory Authorities / Good Clinical Practices (GCP) / Data Manipulation

About the job
Job Details

What You Will Do

Is Azure your top environment? Are you delivering PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions? Join our international team, and support Azure Data Lake now and Azure Snowflake in the future!

How You Will Do It
Proactive administration & support of Azure Data Lake Platform including admin, incident management & troubleshooting
Be the point of contact for Azure PaaS services including Data Factory, ADLS, Databricks, Synapse & DevOps – Capacity/Cost tracking
Support & Maintain – Big Data Cluster – based on HD Insight, Azure Synapse & Hive

Collaborate with partners of all levels to coordinate, maintain & support Data platforms along with ETL Jobs using Azure Data Factory (ADF)
Design & implement solutions in the Azure cloud platform & related technologies for various enterprise applications
Build solutions to monitor, trace, log & address any concerns in cloud-based data platform architecture
Required

What we look for
3+ years hands-on experience using various methodologies to deliver robust PaaS & IaaS based analytics solutions using Azure Cloud technologies
Database technologies i.e. Azure SQL and Azure HD Insight
Overview of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Snowflake, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Security Management with Ranger policies
PowerShell or other scripting languages
