Preferred
Degree in Software Engineering/Computer Science or similar
The expertise of Azure cloud-based data platform architecture
Expertise in Big data platforms, HIVE & Enterprise data platform
Azure Synapse, ARM Template
Azure DevOps – Repo’s, CI/CD with multiple services integrated
Programming skills using Java, Python, .Net
Excellent stakeholder management, communication & influencing skills
Understanding trends, industry standards & new concepts in Data & Analytics space
Our culture

At Johnson Controls you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting projects in today’s market. Our hardworking people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, results-oriented, hardworking and above all fun.

We believe that diversity and inclusion matter and make a difference. By embracing the true value of diversity and inclusion, getting comfortable with having crucial conversations, and valuing different perspectives, we will be one of the most desirable places to work.

About the job
Black Peak Talent is a high-profile managed services and recruitment company, backed by the proven international expertise of its founders. We built high-profile and expertise pipelines of candidates, who will help leveraging your career.

Our client, a growing IT services company, truly adhere to the rule that great software development requires deep industry expertise. And that it is about understanding client specific needs and delivering tailored solutions that support the business growth.

The teams specialise in Software Development, DevSecOps, and Software Automated Testing, using the latest technologies to build software that is reliable, scalable, and easy to maintain. If you want to join a team of highly skilled software engineers with a passion for delivering innovative solutions, this Python opportunity is for you.

Requirements:

• Strong programming experience with Python
• Knowledge of SQL relational databases (MySQL, MSSql)
• Knowledge of Python testing frameworks (preferably pytest) and how to write unit/integration test suites using them
• Experience creating APIs using Python (Django, flask is a plus)
• Experience building and deploying solutions on Cloud Platfor

Benefits:

• An attractive remuneration package depending on your seniority
• Annual budget for home office equipment
• Flex benefits (Health insurance including dentistry and the possibility
to include family members, Food vouchers, Multisport Card, etc.)
• A good work-life balance, with a flexible working time
• Great company and team atmosphere where you can feel job secured and appreciated

About the job
At ICON, it’s our people that set us apart. Our diverse teams enable us to become a better partner to our customers and help us to fulfil our mission to advance and improve patients’ lives.

Our ‘Own It’ culture is driven by four key values that bring us together as individuals and set us apart as an organisation: Accountability & Delivery, Collaboration, Partnership and Integrity. We want to be the Clinical Research Organisation that delivers excellence to our clients and to patients at every touch-point. In short, to be the partner of choice in drug development.

That’s our vision. We’re driven by it. And we need talented people who share it.

If you’re as driven as we are, join us. You’ll be working in a dynamic and supportive environment, with some of the brightest and the friendliest people in the sector, and you’ll be helping shape an industry.

As a Clinical Research Associate at ICON, you’ll work within a large-scale, fast-paced environment alongside a close-knit team of highly qualified CRAs to identify, select, initiate and close-out investigational sites for clinical studies in phases II – IV, ensuring adherence to applicable regulations and principles of ICH-GCP. We pride ourselves on our amazing company culture, where we work as one team to achieve industry-leading results.

The Role

Completes onsite and remote monitoring activities in accordance with all ICH-GCP guidelines, applicable regulations, SOPs and study processes. Activities include qualifying potential investigative sites, initiating clinical trials, maintaining study files, providing instructions to site personnel and study close out.
Verifies the protection of study participants by confirming informed consent procedures and protocol have been performed in accordance to applicable regulations.
Ensures the integrity of clinical data and that the study is conducted in compliance with approved protocol, GCP, applicable regulations and SOPs.
Manages the investigative site staff to facilitate trial deliverables, e.g., subject enrollment, data deliverables.
Verifies proper management and accountability of Investigational Product (IP).
Writes and submits reports of investigational site findings and updates applicable tracking systems. Escalates observed deficiencies, issues, and corrective and preventative action plans as appropriate.
Manages essential documents as required by local regulations and ICH-GCP guidelines before, during and after a clinical study; assists with resolution of investigational site/data queries.
Performs key risk assessment and management responsibilities throughout the project, including key risk indicator and site health analysis, site process evaluation, and project escalation.
Participates in audit preparation and follow-up activities as needed.

What you need

18 months+ of monitoring experience in phase I-III trials as a CRA
Knowledge of ICG GCP guidelines and expertise to review and evaluate medical data
You will possess excellent written and verbal communication in German and English
Ability to produce accurate work to tight deadlines within a pressurized environment
You will be asked to travel at least 80% of the time (international and domestic -fly and drive) and should possess a valid driving license

Benefits of Working in ICON:

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours.

We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.

But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.

ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.

job_title: Business Developer Junior - logiciel SaaS F/H
description:
About the job
Solinki, 1er réseau de consultants indépendants en recrutement en France. L'expertise de consultants indépendants formés et experts de leur domaine appuyés par la force d'un réseau national bénéficiant des meilleurs outils technologiques et de la possibilité d'intervenir sur tous vos besoins de recrutement partout en France.

Nous recrutons pour une startup qui a l'ambition de révolutionner le secteur de la beauté en créant une réelle communauté digitale !

Présent dans plus de 15 pays, leur équipe de 800 collaborateurs européens accompagne plus de 50000 clients et est en croissance forte.

Nous recherchons donc leurs futures pépites ! Tu intégreras une équipe de commerciaux dynamiques et surmotivés pour révolutionner le marché de la beauté.

Véritable pilier de leur développement commercial en France, tu auras pour mission de développer un secteur géographique afin de convaincre des professionnels du secteur de nous rejoindre et d'utiliser notre logiciel afin de développer leur activité. C'est une grande responsabilité et une très belle opportunité.

Tu souhaites parfaire tes techniques de ventes/prospections acquises lors de tes précédentes expériences avec un service innovant auprès de clients exigeants La satisfaction des clients fait partie de tes priorités Ce poste est fait pour toi.

Tes missions :

Effectuer une veille concurrentielle

Prospecter de nouveaux professionnels de la beauté et du bien-être via téléphone, réseaux sociaux ou directement sur le terrain

Développer ton secteur géographique pour atteindre un objectif déterminé

Prendre des RDV, effectuer des démonstrations du logiciel et gérer ta vente jusqu'au closing

Effectuées des remontées du terrain

Effectuer un reporting journalier sur nos outils et CRM

Atteindre les KPIs fixés mensuellement

Analyser tes KPI et améliorer en continu ton impact et tes résultats

Les + :

Dès ton arrivée tu seras pris en charge par un manager pour intégrer l'école de vente : 2 semaines de formation pour apprendre les techniques du métier et montrer en compétence rapidement : connaissance du secteur, prospection, phoning, négociation commerciale, formation à nos outils et CRM.

Tu deviendras un(e) véritable expert(e) de la vente de SaaS dans le secteur de la beauté et du bien-être.

Package (Fixe + variable déplafonné)

Véhicule de fonction selon la localisation

Carte ticket restaurant

Carte cadeau mensuelle

Package de 28 jours de vacances

Ordinateur portable et téléphone professionnel

Une formation et un accompagnement sur-mesure

Une superbe ambiance et des teams

Tu aimes l'univers start-up, l'esprit d'équipe, le challenge. Tu souhaites être managé par un directeur commercial agile, bienveillant et efficace.

Tu possèdes une première expérience en prospection et négociation B2B. Tu es un(e) chasseur(se) dans l'âme. Tu sais t'adapter à un environnement en continuelle évolution.

Tu es particulièrement à l'aise oralement et en négociation. Tu as un excellent relationnel et tu es de nature ambitieuse. Ta bonne humeur est contagieuse.

Tu as une super communication à l'écrit comme à l'oral. Tu sais exprimer vos idées, les synthétiser, les vulgariser parfois, les communiquer et convaincre. 14862253-55584

About the job
Summary
We are looking for a talented Frontend Developer with a passion for UX Design to join our team. You will be responsible for developing, testing, and deploying the front-end user interface of our applications and websites to meet the needs of our business and its customers.

Who we are
Topflight Travel Group is a privately-owned travel company. We specialise in arranging ski holidays, package summer holidays and crafting unique holiday experiences to key European destinations. We have offices in Dublin (Ireland), Brighton (United Kingdom) and Bourg-Saint-Maurice (France). Topflight Travel Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace where talented people want to come, stay and do their best work. While this role offers remote working, we will only be accepting job applications at this time from candidates who are permanently resident in Ireland.

What will you be doing?
Your main role will be the continued research and development of the company's travel platform which includes an enterprise web-based travel booking platform with backend tools, customer facing websites, API's, reporting and automation. You will also be involved in an exciting journey to modernise our enterprise platform, moving from our existing stack to modern web technologies and cloud architecture.

Key Responsibilities
Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and improve the user experience
Develop user interface components using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other front-end technologies such as React.js and Next.js
Collaborate with a cross-functional team to implement UI/UX design elements and ensure that the user experience is intuitive and engaging
Ensure that web applications are responsive and optimised for different devices and screen sizes
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code that adheres to software development best practices and standards
Conduct thorough testing of user interface components to ensure an engaging user experience is provided to our platform users and customers
Troubleshoot and debug issues that arise during development or after deployment
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in front-end development and bring new ideas and innovations to the team

What we are looking for?
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a Computer Science or Design related field
At least 3 years working in a cross-functional software team
Experience with UX design principles, methodologies, and tools – we would love to see a portfolio to show off your design skills and your process
Proficiency in Javascript and/or Typescript
Proficiency with HTML5 and CSS3
Familiarity with UI/UX and product design tools such as Figma or Sketch
Experience with front-end frameworks such as React (preferred), Angular, or Vue.js
Strong understanding of responsive design and web accessibility
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
A team player with strong communication and collaboration skills
Willingness to 'roll up one's sleeves' and assist wherever needed.

What we offer...
Top salary DOE
Bonus
Flexible Hours
Remote working
Company Contributory Pension Scheme
Company Share Scheme
27 Days Paid Annual Leave
Educational Assistance Programme
Substantial staff discount on holidays
New laptop (your choice)
Sound Employer ;-)

About the job
We are JATO Dynamics, the market-leading automotive data provider!

We are currently expanding our remotely based Data Research team in Czech Republic. If you are a car enthusiast with a passion for data, this may be the role for you!

As an Automotive Data Researcher, you will work within a virtual team and will contribute to deliver the most accurate research of different sets of automotive data (price lists, specifications, public incentives, etc) to our clients!

We are looking for people who enjoy focusing on detailed information, with a strong focus on collaboration and willingness to continuously develop their skills and knowledge.

You MUST have a good command of written and spoken English. Any of the following second European language is an advantage:
German
French
Italian
Spanish

Key Responsibilities
- Monitor the events of the automotive market (s) allocated and collect the relevant and required information to then enter into our proprietary software, following company procedures and guidelines
- Update and publish required changes using JATO proprietary software against relevant quality standards, procedures, and business requirements
- Review documentation to gather details of specific changes and align against relevant JATO definitions, data structure and existing vehicle data
- Successfully resolve customer issues as a part of The JATO experience customer support/escalation process
- Stay up to date and execute the latest, ongoing procedure changes
- To implement corrections and changes into the database as guided and required by the Data Operations management and Centre of Excellence team

Key Requirements
- Higher level of education or proven experience in collecting processing and analysis of data
- Interest and/or working experience in the automotive sector is preferred
- Fluent in English (spoken and written), and knowledge of any of the following second European language is an advantage (German, French, Italian, Spanish)
- The ability to focus on detailed information and to work with large amount of data long hours keeping highest attention
- Being inquisitive combined with a proactive attitude
- Ability to meet multiple deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced environment
- Proficient Knowledge of Microsoft Office packages, Advanced Excel

#automotivedata #dataentry #english #german #french #italian #spanish

Please note all CVs must be submitted in English in order to be considered for the role. You must have the right to work and live in the Czech Republic.

About the job
Our mission? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we’re passionate about creating the best product, so if you’re looking for an ambitious team that’s revolutionizing an old-fashioned industry, get in touch!

Our journey: Alexandre and Steve launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has earned the trust of more than 350,000 customers and opened offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona. Last summer, we joined forces with Penta, a market leader based in Berlin and Belgrade, forming a united team of 1000+ Qontoers. We also made it to the Top 3 of LinkedIn Top Startups France !

Our values:

Ambition | We tackle big challenges. No matter what.

Teamwork | We create momentum by working together, at the same speed.

Mastery | We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day.

Integrity | We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other.

You can find out more about the Qonto Way here .

Our beliefs: Diversity brings success. We actively recruit people from a range of backgrounds, employ inclusive hiring techniques; and work with our external partners to continually increase and improve our DEI initiatives. As a result, we obtained a rating of 89/100 in 2022 for the annual Index of professional equality and are happy to say that 44% of our teams are women.

At Qonto the mission of the CRM team is to drive users through the entire lifecycle to improve satisfaction and value using the relevant communication channels with the best message and timing.

The Analytics CRM Team is in charge of turning the CRM data (opening rate, CTOR, conversion..) into value in order to continuously improve the impact of all the actions taken by the CRM team on the company’s targets and revenue.

As a Digital Marketing Analytics Expert, for the Analytics Team, you will be responsible for analyzing and reporting CRM performance to show how our strategies have driven value for both our customers and our business so that we can continuously improve.

You will join a team of 10 Qontoers specialized in CRM and be part of the CRM subteam in charge of analyzing our performance, measuring our impact, and driving continuous improvement on our existing actions. You will directly report to Coralie , our Senior CRM Lead.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻 As a Digital Marketing Analytics Expert at Qonto, you will:
Design our monitoring system and our processes, so that you can analyze, report, and improve our performance
Understand and manage unexpected changes in the performance of our automated actions, or any ad-hoc sendings
Build knowledge and continuously improve our actions by analyzing and sharing A/B testing results and defining the next steps
Measure the marketing pressure, and its impact on our performance and give recommendations (channels, sending time...) for continuous improvement

🤝 About Your Future Manager
Their background: Coralie started her CRM career in the consulting hotel industry, she joined the tech ecosystem when she became a CRM Lead for Kapten, and then joined Qonto to build from scratch our CRM Global team in 2020. Since then she has been leading a team of 10 Qontoers.
What they can bring to you: a client-focused business approach and she will also give you a clear vision and full ownership of your responsibilities.

🤔 What You Can Expect
Participate in a growing project as you will build your roadmap and your team
Impact on a daily basis with measurable actions
To work in a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on quality and 40+ different nationalities

🏅About You
Experience: You have 5+ years of experience in analytical skills and cross-channel CRM marketing (email, mobile, in-product) and automation strategies using CRM platforms like customer.io , Intercom, or Braze
Mastery: You are an analytical thinker with experience measuring communication actions performance, and finding areas of opportunity. Strong A/B testing skills and KPIs analysis knowledge. SQL knowledge is a plus
Structure: You have strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Storyteller: You like to articulate complex situations in a simple manner to convey meaningful messages & communicate efficiently
Languages: You are fluent in English, and French would be nice to have.

Qonto is an open-minded company. Don’t tick all the boxes? Apply and we’ll let you know if we think you could fit the role. You never know ☺️

🎁 Perks

A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed.
A central fully-renovated building in Paris with WeWork services
Monthly team events
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for

- 25 days of paid leave + 5 Qonto days or 25 days of paid leave + 10 RTT +/-
Alan health insurance, Moka Care to take care of your mental health, and Gymlib for sports and wellness activities
A Swile lunch card: 50% covered
A progressive parenthood policy as part of our commitment to the Parental Act (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners

💪 Our hiring process:
Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like

We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

One last thing. We recently raised 486M€ in our Series D to ensure we keep growing safely, despite the current economic environment looking a bit gloomy. We revealed our plans for the future here .

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Les Échos I Challenges | Forbes

About the job
Looking to be part of a team developing leading FinTech solutions with a client-base of multinational and blue-chip corporations?
Become a part of Limitlex/ForumPay, an international group with a portfolio of disruptive products in the FinTech, blockchain and digital asset industries.

We are looking for an experienced Back-end Software Engineer.
Candidates must have knowledge in all stages of software back-end development as well as a good understanding of the overall microservices architecture supporting high-availability and scalability.

The work will comprise the following:
Developing of software, web applications and microservices
Working with databases
Software testing, monitoring, maintenance and fixing
CI and CD automation
Managing dockerized environment
Creating software metrics

What we expect from the candidates:
Comprehensive knowledge and experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Go, C++, C# or PHP
Experience with HTML, JS and CSS
Experience with Event sourcing (NATS)
Experience with relational databases (MySQL and PostgreSQL)
Experience with Kubernetes
Experience with Grafana, InfluxDB and Telegraf
Experience with GrayLog and Elasticsearch
Strong aptitude for problem solving in software development and maintenance
Good command of the English language
Ability to work agile

What we offer:
Above average salary
Opportunity to learn, develop and apply state-of-the-art technologies
Mentoring upon starting the job
Promotional opportunities
Healthy company culture with communication, openness and common sense as our daily drivers
A stimulating work environment with worldwide customers, with priority on work-life balance with flexible working hours. We trust you because you trust the team!

About the job
The Company

Cover Genius is a Series D insurtech that protects the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com , Intuit, Hopper , Skyscanner , Ryanair , Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We’re also available at Amazon , Flipkart , eBay , Wayfair and SE Asia’s largest company, Shopee.

Our partners integrate with XCover , our award-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year. Our team and products have been recognized sed with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times who ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 20+ countries and many language groups commits itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities.

Our People are

Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired

Our People are not

Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious

About The Role

As a Platform Engineer you will lead and coordinate the development, testing and execution of new insurance products across multiple verticals. Working closely with stakeholders, such as our Technology, Actuarial, Data, Insurance and Partnership teams, you will build market leading insurance products. Using ‘XCover’, our Policy Administration System, you will create products in an easy-to-use API format to deliver a seamless integration experience for our global Partners.

What Your Work Week Will Look Like

Leverage your technical experience to build insurance products and design API endpoints with our Partner’s technical requirements
Create and execute comprehensive API test plans prior to product launch
Work with front-end & back-end Product Managers to gather and communicate requirements for additional product features, across all XCover platforms
Support the continuous development of our Policy Administration System, QA & testing frameworks
Support the Finance and Data team with robust reporting configuration and ensure timely delivery of financial reporting
Develop trusted advisor status and strong relationships with internal stakeholders, such as Insurance, Data, Actuarial and Product teams.

What The Ideal Profile Looks Like

2+ years' experience in business analysis or as a programmer
Proficient in Python scripting, SQL and spreadsheets (Excel, Google Sheets)
Experience using Web APIs with tools such as Postman and cURL
Experience with API testing frameworks
Experience reading and understanding technical documentation such as API Documents, Process Flow diagrams etc.
Ability to understand technical challenges and communicate optimal solutions in a clear, concise manner (verbally and written)
Strong numerical and analytical ability
Proven ability to foster and develop relationships with key internal stakeholders
Positive approach to change with an ability to adapt quickly to a start-up pace environment and culture.

Why Cover Genius?

Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We’re a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?

Flexible Work Environment - we are outcome focussed and understand that for our people to perform at their best flexibility is critical. Soon after the declaration of the COVID-19 global pandemic the entire CG team was granted an extra 15 days of Wellness Leave to take throughout 2020.
Employee Stock Options - we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world-class company.
Work with like-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back. Our CG Gives programs enables us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.
Social Initiatives - pictures speak a thousand words!

Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!

Cover Genius promotes diversity and inclusivity. We don't tolerate discrimination, demeaning treatment of anyone, or harassment due to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

job_title: Business Developer Junior - logiciel SaaS F/H
description:
About the job
Solinki, 1er réseau de consultants indépendants en recrutement en France. L'expertise de consultants indépendants formés et experts de leur domaine appuyés par la force d'un réseau national bénéficiant des meilleurs outils technologiques et de la possibilité d'intervenir sur tous vos besoins de recrutement partout en France.

Nous recrutons pour une startup qui a l'ambition de révolutionner le secteur de la beauté en créant une réelle communauté digitale !

Présente dans plus de 15 pays, leur équipe de 800 collaborateurs européens accompagne plus de 50000 clients et est en croissance forte.

Nous recherchons donc leurs futures pépites ! Tu intégreras une équipe de commerciaux dynamiques et surmotivés pour révolutionner le marché de la beauté.

Véritable pilier de leur développement commercial en France, tu auras pour mission de développer un secteur géographique afin de convaincre des professionnels du secteur de nous rejoindre et d'utiliser notre logiciel afin de développer leur activité. C'est une grande responsabilité et une très belle opportunité.

Tu souhaites parfaire tes techniques de ventes/prospections acquises lors de tes précédentes expériences avec un service innovant auprès de clients exigeants La satisfaction des clients fait partie de tes priorités Ce poste est fait pour toi.

Tes missions :
Effectuer une veille concurrentielle
Prospecter de nouveaux professionnels de la beauté et du bien-être via téléphone, réseaux sociaux ou directement sur le terrain
Développer ton secteur géographique pour atteindre un objectif déterminé
Prendre des RDV, effectuer des démonstrations du logiciel et gérer ta vente jusqu'au closing
Effectuées des remontées du terrain
Effectuer un reporting journalier sur nos outils et CRM
Atteindre les KPIs fixés mensuellement
Analyser tes KPI et améliorer en continu ton impact et tes résultats

Dès ton arrivée tu seras pris en charge par un manager pour intégrer l'école de vente : 2 semaines de formation pour apprendre les techniques du métier et montrer en compétence rapidement : connaissance du secteur, prospection, phoning, négociation commerciale, formation à nos outils et CRM.

Tu deviendras un(e) véritable expert(e) de la vente de SaaS dans le secteur de la beauté et du bien-être.
Package (Fixe + variable déplafonné)
Véhicule de fonction selon la localisation
Carte ticket restaurant
Carte cadeau mensuelle
Package de 28 jours de vacances
Ordinateur portable et téléphone professionnel
Une formation et un accompagnement sur-mesure
Une superbe ambiance et des teams building toute

Tu aimes l'univers start-up, l'esprit d'équipe, le challenge. Tu souhaites être managé par un directeur commercial agile, bienveillant et efficace.

Tu possèdes une première expérience en prospection et négociation B2B. Tu es un(e) chasseur(se) dans l'âme. Tu sais t'adapter à un environnement en continuelle évolution.

Tu es particulièrement à l'aise oralement et en négociation. Tu as un excellent relationnel et tu es de nature ambitieuse. Ta bonne humeur est contagieuse.

Tu as une super communication à l'écrit comme à l'oral. Tu sais exprimer vos idées, les synthétiser, les vulgariser parfois, les communiquer et convaincre. 14823934-55584

About the job
We’re looking for outstanding and dynamic Engineering graduates to join our graduate scheme to begin in September 2023. We are a forward-looking company with a desire to remain both innovative and sustainable in an increasingly global market. We are looking for highly motivated, emotionally intelligent, hardworking, articulate communicators like you to help us achieve our growth aspirations.

This role will be based on site at either our Esmoriz Packaging Plant.

We are the leading provider of packaging solutions and Europe’s biggest recycler. We have a unique supply cycle strategy with an industry leading approach to sustainability: we want the brightest new ideas to continually improve our design, innovation and entrepreneurship. That’s where you come in; every role at DS Smith plays a part in helping us reduce that carbon footprint.


About the programme
Our scheme runs for two years and will give graduates the foundations to succeed in Engineering with different placements across the course of the programme. You’ll go on a rigorous development programme to give you the skillsets to succeed in these areas, whilst also developing you into becoming a DS Smith future leader. You’ll be paired up with a mentor and be given first class training from our external partner to develop leadership capabilities and be offered opportunities to put everything you’ve learned into practice.

Within Engineering you’ll have placements within maintenance (where we ensure that our machines are always running and keeping our factory flowing) and process (where you’ll look at how we maximise the performance of our machines to increase speed whilst reducing cost and waste. You'll also undertake a Continuous Improvement placement where you will review all our processes to determine where we can be more effective and reduce waste in our mission to be the most sustainable packaging company.

Your placements will take place within either our Packaging or Paper businesses. Our Packaging solutions team provide sustainable packaging solutions, which considers the entire supply cycle and supports some of the biggest brands in the world. Whilst our Paper business manufactures sustainable corrugated case materials, specialty papers and high performance papers for packaging production. Whichever business you end up in, you’ll play a key part in developing bespoke strategies and provide a high quality sustainable product.

Alongside the role specific skills you’ll develop, you’ll be in a cohort of graduates and together we’ll offer you a world class development programme which will support you in becoming one of our future leaders.

In year one the focus is on understanding yourself; your skills, your strengths and how to realise your potential.
In year two your development will be about understanding others, how to work effectively in teams and how to support others.

You’ll then be in charge of your own career pathway, whether you become a leader or a specialist, we'll help you find that perfect home at DS Smith.

About you
To be considered for this scheme you must have as a minimum:
A degree within Engineering (electrical, mechanical, chemical, civil, industrial, structural design or process disciplines) or due to achieve your qualification before September 2023.
Speak fluently in English and the country you’re applying within (B2 Level minimum).
Hold the relevant right to work within the country you’re applying within.
Be fully flexible and geographically mobile.

Benefits
A competitive salary.
A range of other benefits depending on the country you’re applying within.

*Assessment Centres will take place in March/April 2023 and candidates will need to be able to attend this virtually.
**Successful applicants will need to be available to begin their first placement on September 4th 2023.

About the job
Description

Clinical Operations Specialist

Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives.

Our Clinical Development model brings the customer and the patient to the center of everything that we do. We are continuously looking for ways to simplify and streamline our work to not only make Syneos Health easier to work with, but to make us easier to work for.

Whether you join us in a Functional Service Provider partnership or a Full-Service environment, you’ll collaborate with passionate problem solvers, innovating as a team to help our customers achieve their goals. We are agile and driven to accelerate the delivery of therapies, because we are passionate to change lives.

Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know:

WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE

Why Syneos Health
We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.
Job Responsibilities
Responsible for performing activities in compliance with applicable Corporate and Clinical Operations Policies, Standard Operating Procedures and Work Instructions
Assists Clinical Monitoring staff with site management activities, including serving as a Sponsor representative for sites on assigned studies, and communicating with sites to ensure compliance with protocol requirements, study procedures and relevant guidelines
Creates and assists with maintenance of Trial Master File (TMF) and project files, including participation in file audits
Prepares and maintains site manuals, reference tools and other documents
Maintains, updates, and inputs clinical tracking information into databases
Tracks incoming and outgoing clinical and regulatory documents and updates for investigator sites, studies, project team, or client
Manages shared mailbox, processes site requests and routes correspondence appropriately
Coordinates the ordering, packaging, shipping and tracking of site supplies and materials
Assists with coordination of team meetings, attends meetings and prepares accurate meeting minutes and action items
May handle receipt, tracking and disposition of Case Report Forms and Queries
Maintains overall awareness in the field of clinical research by completing all necessary and assigned training
Qualifications

What we’re looking for
High School diploma or equivalent
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to embrace new technologies
Minimal travel up to 25% may be required
Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health

Additional Information

Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

About the job
At Camelot Lottery Solutions we design, build and deliver compelling and complex digital gaming solutions for lotteries around the world helping them do what they do best: create winners and support communities. What's our secret for leveraging digital impact for our clients? Years of experience in the industry, an extensive knowledge base and a diversely talented team. Our collective expertise enables our clients to reach new players, expand their brand engagement and build long-term growth through sustainable and impactful technical solutions.
What sets us apart is our ability to seamlessly engineer a technical solution to meet a client's vision - and to have fun while we do it. Our ethos is built on trust and teamwork: two core values that empower our team to be trailblazers and ultimately underpins everything we do. We have teams in Greece, the UK, Ireland and the US working together to achieve common goals. We are a learning environment, with multiple opportunities for growth and development, and we will support your career path through actual projects, coaching and 360 feedback. We are proud of where we are today, but we're still growing, which means we need more brilliant people who share the same values.
Do you want to join us on the next part of our exciting journey?
The team:
Join our games team passionate about creating interactive and fun games in the area of Digital Lotteries. As a Junior Front End Engineer, you'll be part of a Scrum team for conceptualizing, designing and "breathing life" into our lottery games. You will have the opportunity to utilise the full range of your skills and work alongside a great team of people. We work as part of cross-functional teams located in Greece, London, Ireland and Chicago.
The role:
The role involves some challenging work designing and developing HTML5 sites for the lottery and gaming industry. You should be able to demonstrate a good understanding of Object Oriented Programming and Javascript (ES6+).
Requirements
This role is perfect for you if you have...
Computer Science Degree (BSc or higher).
Good understanding of ES6+, Javascript
Good understanding of Object Oriented Programming, and Web Applications
Willingness to learn how to write clean, maintainable and secure code.
Be able to work in a fast-paced environment on multiple projects and as part of a highly-skilled team.
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)

Also, it would be cool if you had:
Good understanding of Nuxt.js, Vue.js or React, Next.js, Jest
Familiarity with coding standards and best practices
Familiarity with TypeScript
Good understanding of CSS Preprocessors
Open source projects or contributions.

Benefits
What we will do for you:
We are an energetic group of passionate professionals that will support your talent, innovation, and curiosity! You will be given an environment full of challenges to flourish in. By joining our team, you will enjoy benefits that make you more productive and contribute to your development:
Attractive salary and a bonus plan
Health insurance plan including dependents
Well-being allowance
Biannual Developmental 360° feedback framework
Coaching sessions
Continues Training
Extensive leave plan(annual/sick)
Employee Assistance program with specialized Counselors / Licensed Psychologists
Enjoyable and stable working environment
Flexible working arrangements (fully remote/hybrid)
How to join our teams:
After your application, our team will reach out to those candidates with the most promising CVs! You will be invited to identify your level of knowledge through 2 stages of tests:
Part 1: contains multiple option questions and code gaps covering the following areas: logical thinking, math, SQL basics, HTML/CSS, Javascript, and security basics.
Your good score will lead you to Part 2!
Part 2: contains Javascript programming challenges.
Technical and HR interviews will follow with the candidates that performed well at the test evaluations.

Privacy Disclaimer
By clicking "Apply" for this Job, you agree that you have read and accepted our Privacy Statement relating to job applicants and that you provide your consent for the processing of your personal data for the purposes described therein.

About the job
Description

Backend Software Engineer

We’re looking for talented, friendly and experienced Software Engineers to help build our suite of customer facing products. Here in the Treatwell tech team we’re a nice bunch, we love to ship software and we like to think we’re pretty smart. We believe in Agile principles and values, our teams typically use Kanban and various XP practices, we love DDD and are using an event driven architecture to further decouple our applications and increase resilience. We like to use the right tech for the job but we don’t get seduced by the latest shiny fads. In this role, you will make a meaningful contribution in ensuring we make the right decisions.

You will be working on a variety of exciting technologies. Our application code is written in Java 11 using Spring Boot, Hibernate and Immutables. We use Redis for caching, Elasticsearch powers our venue searching and RabbitMQ is our message broker. Your application will be deployed within Docker containers and monitored using Prometheus. Everything runs in AWS.

You Will Be Responsible For

As a Software Engineer in the Treatwell team you will work as part of a cross functional Agile team writing and shipping high quality code frequently. You’ll do whatever you can to help your team to meet or exceed its goals and you will drive incremental improvements in both the way we work and the software we deliver. You will also help your teammates to become more effective and grow their skills.

We do things well, but we’re not complacent. We want to do great work and to be known for it. We are breaking up our applications into microservices that are well tested, independently deployable and highly observable. We are empowering our teams to operate independently and to ship to production as frequently as they see fit. We’re looking for people who can help us to realise this vision and accelerate the journey, who know what great technology looks like and who can mentor our existing team.

About You
You’ve written Java professionally.
You’ve worked with some of our tech stack and can learn the rest very quickly.
You’ve been part of a high-performing, autonomous Agile development team who deliver continuously.
You get a kick out of mentoring and empowering the team around you.
You have a deep understanding of how distributed applications are designed and built.
You know good technical design when you see it and how to ensure quality is embedded in the software development process.
You’re a good communicator, fun to work with and enjoy being part of a vocal, passionate team.
You’re active in the software development community, whether through blogs, meetups, personal projects or open source contributions.

About Treatwell

Hi, we’re Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

We’re a team of 800 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We’re the industry’s smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe’s leading booking platform, working with over 50,000 salon partners across 13 countries and processing over 8 million bookings every month. And….breathe.

But we’re not done yet. We’re on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community.

If this excites you, we might have just the role for you.

We’ll Treat You With
28-days holiday, plus bank holidays
Monthly 40 EUR Treatwell vouchers so you can treat yourself too
Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team
A discount for gym membership
100% remote position with flexible working
Annual Treatwell retreat to a sunny European destination
All the tools / devices supplied to do the best job you can eg. laptop, monitor, keyboard, etc

Equal Ops

Treatwell is an ‘Open to All’ employer and warmly welcomes everybody to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.

job_title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer - Prediction and Planning for Autonomous Driving
description:
About the job
Job Description:
The Stellantis AI Team - Prediction and Planning for AD - has exciting opportunities for exceptional candidates to work on AI for autonomous vehicles. As a member of the team, you will be using the latest deep learning technologies to create prediction and planning functionalities for the Stellantis AD vehicle platform. The team is part of the AI algorithms and ops department, and you will work in strict collaboration with the other teams of the area.

The ideal candidate will have a good deep learning and software engineering background and will be ideally familiar with time series/behaviour prediction and/or planning.

Position Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in technical field
1 year of work/research experience developing Deep Learning models, ideally for time series/behaviour prediction or planning and experience with classical Machine Learning models
Basic understanding of vehicle kinematics and controls
Basic understanding of robotic perception systems and algorithms
Good command of at least one deep learning framework such as Tensorflow, Pytorch
Proficient in Python, Linux
Good communication skills in English language

Preferred Qualifications:
Master of Science in Applied Physics, Math, Computer Science, Electrical/Computer/ Automation Engineering, or related Engineering field
3 years of work/research experience developing Deep Learning models, ideally for autonomous systems
Experience with one of the following: Deep Learning for prediction, Deep Reinforcement learning
Experience with C++ development
Good understanding of vehicle/robotics control and trajectory planning
Good understanding of deep learning for perception

At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability. Diverse teams, will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.

By submitting your application, you are accepting our privacy notice:
https://www.stellantis.com/en/privacy

En BCNC GROUP buscamos incorporar al equipo BackEnd Developers Java/Microservicios con experiencia contrastada en programación Java 11/8 para trabajar en modalidad 100 remoto en proyectos multinacionales.

Job Position Description:
• Work on technical and functional test strategy and methodology setup
• Perform various duties related to software quality assurance, function testing, performance testing
• Find and track the issues that will cause bad user experiences
• Collaborate with global RD and operations team to verify bug fix and recreate issues from user feedbackJob Position Description:

About the job
Project Description
Join our Development Centre in Bucharest and become a member of our open-minded, progressive and professional team. In this role you will be working on projects for one our world famous clients. You will have a chance to grow your technical and soft skills, and build a thorough expertise of the industry of our client. On top of attractive salary and benefits package, Luxoft will invest into your professional training, and allow you to grow your professional career.
Surveillance and Regulatory Technology is responsible for delivering solutions that protect the bank's financial and reputational interests from potentially criminal or inappropriate behavior by our clients, employees, vendors. It enables the bank to manage its compliance to regulations and the risk appetite to stay in business in the various legislation. In addition, the function, is responsible for driving improvement across the IT delivery cycle through adoption of best practices, automation tooling and metrics, as well as developing a target state DevOps capability.
We are responsible for delivering solutions that protect Bank's financial and reputational interests from criminal or inappropriate behavior. Through real-time sanction and embargo filtering, operational risk controls and sophisticated fraud detection that will increasingly deploy artificial intelligence, our systems protect both clients and the bank, allow risks to be managed according to risk appetite, and keep the Bank in compliance with global and local regulations.
Responsibilities
Analysis of big data volumes from data pools / databases
SQL expertise, further query language expertise
Very good analytical skills
Understanding data and data dependencies for assessment and validation of the results
Skills
Must have
Very good know how of SQL (MsSQL / Oracle)
Previous experience in handling large volume of data and it's analysis
ETL
Nice to have
Datawarehouse

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

job_title: Senior SAS Programmer – Fast Progression – Remote Working
description:
About the job
Senior SAS Programmer – Global CRO – Fully Remote

Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer / Senior SAS Consultant / Clinical SAS Programmer

Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.

Looking for an experienced Statistical Programmer who will be fully responsible for leading multiple complex projects across oncology and other therapeutic areas – phases I-III.
You will remain the point of contact for all client meetings/queries and dependent on your experience level will also be responsible for leading/managing the project teams.

Role Responsibilities:
Project lead clinical studies
Develop and maintain project timelines
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and Pharma industry

We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.

Desired Skills:
3 years’ experience in SAS Programming
Some experience Co-leading / Leading Projects and Studies
Experience mentoring and supporting a team of SAS Programmers.
You have Good SAS programming and CDISC standards knowledge
You possess excellent interpersonal skills

Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working

Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.

Title: Senior Statistical Programmer

Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.

Please apply below or email your CV to Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com

Associated Keywords: Senior SAS Programmer / Senior Statistical Programmer / Senior SAS Analyst / Senior SAS Developer Senior SAS Consultant / United Kingdom / London / Manchester / Remote / Home based / CDISC / ADaM / STDM / CDASH / TLF / SAS Certificate / SAS Certification / Clinical SAS Programmer / Clinical SAS Programmer / SAS Programming / Statistical Programming / Submission / Specifications / Regulatory Authorities / Good Clinical Practices (GCP) / Data Manipulation

About the job
ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations.
With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life.

Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.

The Role:

If you are seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, working closely together with the top minds in Biotechnology, then here is your chance. ICON Global Strategic Solutions is hiring a Clinical Research Associate (m/f/d) to work closely with one of the most successful pharmaceutical companies. If you are a CRA in Austria willing to work home based and open for a new challenge, we would like to get to know you.


Key responsibilities:

• Ensures clinical study sites are conducting clinical trials in compliance with the respective protocol, SOPs and applicable ICH/GCP guidelines and regulations
• Conduct Investigator Profile and Clinical Site Initiation visits as well as Clinical Site Close-Out visits for studies in a range of different indications
• Facilitate subject enrolment at the site level with focused patient recruitment strategies and action plans
• Identify site needs and site-related issues, escalate them and/or initiate corrective actions when necessary, providing solutions for site staff to facilitate the clinical trial process
• Ensures appropriate safety reporting as well as tracking and reporting of adverse events (AEs and SAEs)
• Assist in preparing sites for audits, review audit reports and contributes to resolve findings
• Build and maintain solid and long-term professional relationships with investigators and site staff
• Mentor new CRAs, as needed (experienced CRAs only)
• Travel frequency of up to 50%


To be successful in the role, you will have:

• clinical research experience as study coordinator, study nurse, etc
• Familiarity with ICH/GCP guidelines plus local codes of practice as applicable
• Proficiency in English and German
• Willingness to travel


What is offered:

• 100% Home Office
• Permanent contract
• Mostly regional travel
• Compensatory time-off
• Travel time = work time



Benefits of Working in ICON:

Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That’s why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture – one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.

At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.

ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know.

Would you like to know more? Please submit your CV via www.ICONplc.com/FSP or nadine.rabenstein@docsglobal.com. We are looking forward to your application.

About the job
Varicent is the industry leader in developing Sales Performance Management (SPM) software, enabling businesses worldwide to Plan, Operate and Pay effectively to drive sales performance and growth.

A named Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Sales Performance Management seven times in a row, Varicent was founded in 2005 when we pioneered sales performance management software. Evolving quickly to become the fastest growing software company in North America according to Deloitte’s Fast 50™ in 2010, Varicent was acquired by IBM in 2012 and has since been re-founded as an independent global business serving mid-size and enterprise clients with our full suite of solutions to assist in smarter territory and quota planning, efficient lead to revenue operations, and the fastest and most flexible way to pay sellers accurately and on-time. We are looking for talented, driven people that can make an impact across our organization.

As a Technical Analyst you will have the opportunity to work side-by-side with some of the most experienced technology leaders for both on-premise and SaaS products to support our customers/business partners and connect with them by telephone, email and social media e.g. connection sites, forums and other state of the art communication methods. You will also be exposed to a variety of technologies and take responsibility for the creation of a positive customer experience.

Technical Analysts are at the center of our after sales value proposition to our clients and you will lead conversations and coordinate activities with experts and leaders across departments and divisions in Varicent.

What you will do:

Resolve complex technical problems across multiple products by troubleshooting incidents, collecting detailed problem description, traces and log files, and then replication of the issue.
Regularly communicate the progress of your investigation with the client while ensuring all related records are properly updated in our CRM system.
Cross collaboration with developers and peers will become part of your daily routines.
Sharing best practices for the utilization and deployment of Varicent products is elementary to your customer communication and you will help customers maximize their product’s business value.
Sharing knowledge within practice, based on project experience and lessons learned.
Contribute to the Support Project Roadmap
Meet support KPI targets and SLAs

What you will bring:

Fluency in English
Fluency in Spanish or French is an asset
Minimum 3 years experience in a technical client facing role
General software troubleshooting skills (broad experience in logical problem-solving)
Familiar with relational databases concepts, both basic administration and SQL scripting
Familiar with client server architecture
Experience working with and troubleshooting web-based applications
Experience of self-sufficiency to install/upgrade/downgrade/configure software in general
Ability to communicate clearly (both verbally and in written form) technical instructions to people with limited experience

Varicent is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accomodations@varicent.com

Varicent is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. About the job
Title: Program de absolvire a ingineriei 2023
Căutăm absolvenți de Inginerie remarcabili și dinamici care să se alăture programului nostru de absolvenți care va începe în septembrie 2023. Suntem o companie de perspectivă cu dorința de a rămâne atât inovatoare, cât și sustenabile pe o piață din ce în ce mai globală. Căutăm comunicatori foarte motivați, inteligenți din punct de vedere emoțional, muncitori, articulați, precum dvs., care să ne ajute să ne îndeplinim aspirațiile de creștere.
Cine sunt DS Smith?
Suntem cel mai mare furnizor de soluții de ambalare și cel mai mare reciclator din Europa. Avem o strategie unică pentru ciclul de aprovizionare, cu o abordare de lider în industrie a durabilității: dorim cele mai strălucitoare idei noi pentru a ne îmbunătăți continuu designul, inovația și antreprenoriatul. Acolo intri; fiecare rol la DS Smith joacă un rol în a ne ajuta să reducem amprenta de carbon.


Locații
În cadrul programului nostru de absolvenți de inginerie pentru 2023, oferim oportunități în următoarele locații*:
· Zărnești, România
*Locațiile se pot schimba în funcție de cerințe. Pentru a obține cele mai bune rezultate din program, solicităm candidaților să fie complet mobili.
Despre program
Schema noastră se desfășoară pe o perioadă de doi ani și le va oferi absolvenților bazele pentru a reuși în Inginerie cu diferite locuri de muncă pe parcursul programului. Veți urma un program riguros de dezvoltare pentru a vă oferi seturile de abilități pentru a reuși în aceste domenii, în timp ce vă va dezvolta și pentru a deveni un viitor lider DS Smith. Veți fi asociat cu un mentor și veți primi o pregătire de primă clasă de la partenerul nostru extern pentru a dezvolta capacități de conducere și vi se vor oferi oportunități de a pune în practică tot ceea ce ați învățat.
În cadrul Ingineriei, veți avea locuri de plasare în întreținere (unde ne asigurăm că mașinile noastre funcționează mereu și mențin fabrica noastră) și proces (unde veți vedea cum maximizăm performanța mașinilor noastre pentru a crește viteza, reducând în același timp costurile și risipa). Veți efectua, de asemenea, o plasare de îmbunătățire continuă, în care veți revizui toate procesele noastre pentru a determina unde putem fi mai eficienți și reduce risipa în misiunea noastră de a fi cea mai sustenabilă companie de ambalare.
Plasamentele dvs. vor avea loc fie în cadrul afacerilor noastre de ambalare, fie în cadrul întreprinderii de hârtie. Echipa noastră de soluții de ambalare oferă soluții de ambalare durabile, care iau în considerare întregul ciclu de aprovizionare și susțin unele dintre cele mai mari mărci din lume. În timp ce afacerea noastră de hârtie produce materiale durabile pentru cutii ondulate, hârtie de specialitate și hârtie de înaltă performanță pentru producția de ambalaje. Indiferent de afacerea în care ajungeți, veți juca un rol cheie în dezvoltarea strategiilor personalizate și veți oferi un produs durabil de înaltă calitate.
Pe lângă abilitățile specifice rolului pe care le veți dezvolta, veți fi într-o cohortă de absolvenți și împreună vă vom oferi un program de dezvoltare de clasă mondială care vă va sprijini să deveniți unul dintre viitorii noștri lideri.
· În primul an, accentul este pe a te înțelege pe tine însuți; abilitățile tale, punctele tale forte și cum să-ți realizezi potențialul.
· În anul doi, dezvoltarea ta va fi despre înțelegerea celorlalți, cum să lucrezi eficient în echipă și cum să îi susții pe ceilalți.
· Vei fi apoi responsabil de propria ta carieră, fie că devii lider sau specialist, te vom ajuta să găsești casa perfectă la DS Smith.


Despre tine

Pentru a fi luat în considerare pentru această schemă trebuie să aveți cel puțin:
· O diplomă în Inginerie (electrică, mecanică, chimică, civilă, industrială, proiectare structurală sau discipline de proces) sau pentru a obține calificarea înainte de septembrie 2023.
· Vorbește fluent în română și engleză.
· Aveți dreptul de a lucra în România.
· Fii complet flexibil și mobil din punct de vedere geografic.


Beneficii

Un salariu competitiv.
serie de alte beneficii, în funcție de țara în care aplicați.
*Centrele de evaluare vor avea loc în martie/aprilie 2023, iar candidații vor trebui să poată participa la aceasta virtual.
**Solicitanții de succes vor trebui să fie disponibili pentru a începe primul lor plasament pe 4 septembrie 2023.

About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Über ITernity GmbH

Wir sind ein führender Softwareentwickler für Datenmanagementlösungen und prägen seit über 10 Jahren den Markt. Wir schützen Daten aus verschiedensten Anwendungen zukunftssicher und rechtskonform. Wir kooperieren international mit Technologiepartnern wie z. B. HPE und Microsoft sowie zahlreichen Softwareunternehmen aus dem ECM- und DMS- Umfeld. Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Verstärkung für unser Jobangebot Linux Operations Engineer (m/w/d) Remote.

Klingt spannend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine aussagekräftige Bewerbung über unseren Partner Workwise.

Wir schaffen Software mit Zukunft, Herz und klugen Köpfen! Wir entwickeln Software für Archivierung und Datenmanagement. Klingt trocken? Wir beweisen dir das Gegenteil! Unsere Software sorgt dafür, dass die Automobil-Produktion rund läuft, der Chirurg im OP operieren kann, Patientendaten vor Ransomware geschützt sind oder Personaldaten nicht manipuliert werden können. Und das bei Top-Kunden weltweit von Mittelstand bis Konzern, von Kreiskrankenhaus bis Uniklinik. Unser Anspruch sind rundum zufriedene Kunden. Daran arbeiten wir voller Ehrgeiz und Tatendrang. Unterstütze du uns, diesem Anspruch Tag für Tag gerecht zu werden. Wir sind immer auf der Suche nach neuen Talenten, die sich durch training-on-the-job (weiter)entwickeln möchten, gerne über den Tellerrand hinausschauen und bereit sind, neue Wege zu gehen. Kurz gesagt: wir sind auf der Suche nach Dir! Bei uns kannst du so sein, wie du bist und so arbeiten, wie es zu dir passt. Du kannst deine Ideen und Erfahrungen einbringen und deine Aufgabenbereiche aktiv mitgestalten. Dabei arbeitest du in einem zukunftsorientierten Umfeld und kannst dich auf vielseitige Projekte freuen. Wir legen viel Wert auf unsere positive, offene und ehrliche Arbeitsatmosphäre und Teamspirit. Hast du Lust, Teil unseres Teams zu werden? Dann melde dich bei uns!

Was erwartet Dich?

Du begleitest Kunden beim Onboarding und implementierst unsere Software
Du bist der Experte und unterstützt unsere nationalen und internationalen Kunden
Du führst Migrationen durch und stellst dabei sicher, dass nichts verloren geht
Du analysierst und bearbeitest 2nd Level Anfragen und führst Fehleranalysen durch

Was solltest Du mitbringen?

Du beherrschst dein Handwerkszeug und hast eine Ausbildung z. B. als Fachinformatiker/-in Systemintegration oder vergleichbare Kenntnisse
Du verfügst über eine Get-the-job-done-Mentalität und große Neugierde
Du willst mehr als einen 08/15 Admin-Job und hast Lust auf internationale Kunden
Du hast schon idealerweise bereits erste Erfahrung mit Linux

Was bieten wir Dir?

Ein Maximum an Flexibilität: Homeoffice und/oder Büro? Arbeitszeiten? Du gestaltest und entscheidest!
Es ist dir möglich 100% Remote zu arbeiten, wobei wir uns freuen dich obligatorisch mindestens 2-4 mal in unserem Büro in Freiburg begrüßen zu dürfen - Die Kosten dafür übernehmen wir
Jeden Tag neue Herausforderungen, versprochen!
Top nationale und internationale Kunden
Ein richtiges Team mit Zusammenhalt
Work und Life im Einklang
Top Verkehrsanbindung dank bester Lage in Freiburg – nur 10 Minuten zu Fuß von Bahnhof und Stadtmitte entfernt

Unser Jobangebot Linux Operations Engineer (m/w/d) Remote klingt vielversprechend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine Bewerbung über Workwise.

Bei unserem Partner Workwise kann man sich in nur wenigen Minuten ohne Anschreiben für diesen Job bewerben und den Status der Bewerbung live verfolgen.

About the job
We are JATO Dynamics, the market-leading automotive data provider!

We are currently expanding our remotely based Data Research team in Greece. If you are a car enthusiast with a passion for data, this may be the role for you!

As an Automotive Researcher, you will work within a virtual team and will contribute to deliver the most accurate research of different sets of automotive data (price lists, specifications, public incentives, etc) to our clients!

You MUST have a good command of written and spoken English. Any of the following second European language is an advantage:
German
French
Italian
Spanish

Key Responsibilities
- Monitor the events of the automotive market (s) allocated and collect the relevant and required information to then enter into our proprietary software, following company procedures and guidelines

- Review documentation to gather details of specific changes and align against relevant JATO definitions, data structure and existing vehicle data
- Successfully resolve customer issues as a part of The JATO experience customer support/escalation process
- Stay up to date and execute the latest, ongoing procedure changes
- To implement corrections and changes into the database as guided and required by the Data Operations management and Centre of Excellence team


Key Requirements
- Higher level of education or proven experience in collecting processing and analysis of data
- Interest and/or working experience in the automotive sector is preferred
- Fluent in English (spoken and written), and knowledge of any of the following second European language is an advantage (German, French, Swedish, Danish)
- The ability to focus on detailed information and to work with large amount of data long hours keeping highest attention
- Being inquisitive combined with a proactive attitude
- Ability to meet multiple deadlines and thrive in a fast-paced environment
- Proficient Knowledge of Microsoft Office packages, Advanced Excel

#automotivedata #dataentry #english #german #french #italian #spanish

About the job
Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?

At Relativity we make software to help users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Our e-discovery platform is used by more than 13,000 organizations around the world to manage large volumes of data and quickly identify key issues during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.

The Product Management team is looking for a Product Manager with background in product lifecycle, technical acumen and agile practices, as well as, strong communication and collaboration skills. You will be responsible for participating and leading both discovery and development to achieve a specific product goal. A successful candidate must be energized by building deep customer empathy, collaborating with design and development, optimizing team processes, and utilizing data to monitor project success.

Responsibilities

Deeply understands the product. Speaks to our technical implementation in a way that internal stakeholders and clients can understand.
Ability to speak to the variety of workflows and end user needs we see across segments and personas and coaches others on how to do the same.
Owns product roadmap and backlog for their product(s).
Works directly with Product Leads to help build a strategy and goals for their product(s).
Develops and shares plans and results clearly to immediate teams.
Ensure what we build solves the customer or business problem and delivers a product that is stable in production and satisfies scalability, reliability, performance and business goals.
Organize and engage in usability testing to define detailed Interaction flows.
Meet with users and stakeholders to obtain deep understanding of detailed needs and constraints.
Anticipates the need to bring cross-functional teams together to solve problems.
Provides recommendations rooted in customer empathy.
Responsible for user and competitive research for their product(s)
Self-directed analysis and data interpretation.
Tracks and reports on product metrics.
Develops external and internal facing go-to-market content
Ability to break down large projects into iterative releases
Translate validated designs and analysis into story cards with acceptance criteria.
Ability to prioritize work based on impact.
Test new features to ensure quality for release
Manage defect prioritization
Understands technical requirements for completion of new initiatives and ensures development team is set up for success.
Operates as an indirect leader, facilitating communication across internal stakeholders and effectively communicate ‘why’ and gain buy in. Also responsible for driving conflict resolution amongst product development stakeholders.
Provides direct feedback to peers and is skilled at understanding multiple points of view.

Preferred Qualifications

Generates excitement and curiosity when working with highly complex systems.
Is a team player with proven ability to deliver features from inception to delivery.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented, enthusiastic self-starter with ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
Has the technical acumen necessary to understand core functions of our e-discovery system and to understand technical challenges and make educated trade-offs with the development team
Strong project manager able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong facilitation and analysis skills.
Strong business acumen.

Minimum Qualifications

4+ years of experience in product management at a technology company.
Solid understanding of software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.
Knowledge and experience doing discovery & usability testing to gather customer feedback.

Relativity is a diverse workplace with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they're empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.

Benefit Highlights

Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans

Parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers

Flexible work arrangements

Two, week-long company breaks per year

Unlimited time off

Long-term incentive program

Training investment program

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Salary range: 22,000 - 27,000 EUR per year, gross.
